Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, courteous staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: anitak21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a trip to Asia in February 2012. The location was excellent, and very easy to get to. It was close to a Metro station, and across the street from a convenient store. It was just off the main road, so was quieter than I'd have expected. The staff were very helpful, and the computers in the lobby were very convenient. The room was very nice, and more spacious than I had anticipated (especially after Cambodia and Vietnam). The beds were comfortable and I had no issues with the room at all. The best part of this hotel was it's prime location and proximity to restaurants, stores and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ralph M
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three days in HK at this hotel. I was last there shortly after it opened and not much has changed. I stayed in an executive room which is still as disappointingly small and I could see nothing in it which made it seem different from any other non executive rooms in which I have recently stayed. The toilet is of comfortable size, toiletries are normal, room is clean and bed is large. There is a type of chaise longe which offers a degree of comfort but the views from the hotel are very dreary in downtown Kowloon (not the hotel's fault of course!) The service again is as one would expect in Hong Kong, quite efficient but rarely warm or sincere. Check in staff were fine as were some of the staff in the executive lounge. Unfortunately I did overhear an argument between one guest and a lady on duty in the lounge, neither was giving way but I felt uncomfortable sitting near and hearing such verbal abuse being exchanged between the two. The snacks and drinks in the lounge are excellent, the breakfast there is continental but a larger one can be had downstairs in the main restaurant where as usual, I on my own was given a single table away in the corner crushed against the wall. The tables are very close to each other so there is no point in planning a cosy chat a deux in that particular restaurant! My stay was quiet but I left thinking, where had I been for the last three days? Was there anything memorable about the hotel or its service and the answer I think was "bland and harmless!"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a vibrant part of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: msNightglow
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hong Kong, and I must admit... I LOVE HONG KONG!! So anything I write will be a little biased I suppose. First of all: Stay in Kowloon, it's such a sureal experience! The overwhelming and undeniable Chinese influence wrapped in a very Western, business driven energy... It's an experience that can't be described and that I honestly didn't expect I would get caught up in. The Novotel is steps from Nathan Road, and just around the corner is an Airport shuttle bus drop off. Two minutes walk from Jordan metro station, and if you keep walking (which is easy as this city seems to pull you in anyway) you'll find Kowloon Park among the crowds and shops, a quiet oasis. After 5 minutes you reach the harbour where you find "The Walk of Stars" and a breathtaking view of Hong Kong Island. The Novotel has everything you would expect of a 4 star hotel, very modern with friendly staff. Our room was on the small side (apparently it's like this in all Hong Kong hotels) but sufficient, nicely decorated and clean. The bathroom was nice and clean, but only had a shower... which is fine with me but I'm just mentioning it. We didn't take the breakfast so I can't omment. All in all, a lovely stay at the Novotel and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to MTR”
Reviews.Author: Michelle808
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times over the past few years, good product. I usually don't bother getting breakfast included, over priced and for Hong Kong you can get better elsewhere. I just go around the block to starbucks in the mornings, then walk around for something for breakfast. Rooms are a really go size, modern, good amenities in the room. Only thing is they need to get wifi in the rooms, I hate having to go to lobby to get wifi. Overall I probably would stay here again, although I prefer staying in Apartment/Hotels instead now so Novotel would need to upsell me on some perks to want me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Mareefr
Reviews.Content: Great location and what you expect from Novotel. The Club Lounge was good. The diwnstairs bar has music early in the evening - wish they played later when you come back from dinner as well. Staff in bar need to smile more but otherwise a great place to stay while in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location in Kowloon.”
Reviews.Author: Alywin C
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for our visit to Hong Kong/Macau with my wife and 17 month toddler. We split our stay with a Macau visit in-between, this way we could leave our heavy luggage behind. Both times at check-in a special welcome gift (soft toy) was given to my son. Hotel had good service, and the staff were helpful with directions when asked. We took up the upgrade which includes breakfast, free wifi, afternoon tea and evening drinks the 1st time, but did not after returning from Macau, the place is surrounded by good food that you do not have to eat in the hotel. The hotel itself was located on a side road off the main Nathan Road. It is about a 5 minutes walk to the nearest MTR station, Jordan station. The Jordan station exit B1 had a lift which made it more stroller friendly. Directly opposite the hotel there is a Congee place which served quite good congee. It is also very close to the Australian Dairy Co. which has breakfast option and next to that is Mak's noodles which also serves good noodles and wonton soup. The hotel is also very close to the Temple street market. Upon exiting from the hotel, turn right, and head down and under the subway (underground) passage, surfacing on the other side, continue walking straight till you see stalls selling all sorts on both sides of temple street. Overall, great location with many local eateries nearby, convenient access to the MTR which links to most of HK and clean and good serviced place to give you a pleasant base to explore Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff are so friendly and helpful. They even prepared welcome gift for my two toddlers. The location is really great with just less than 5 minutes walk to mtr. The lady in tour desk is really nice, dont hesitate to ask for any travel tips. It's my first time staying here and surely will come back again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - an oasis in busy Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: H P
Reviews.Content: The executive rooms are fantastic, with huge comfortable bed and clean modern bathroom. Free wifi for two devices was included as well as access to the top floor lounge with daily afternoon tea and evening free drinks and canapés. The staff at the exclusive top floor check in for executive rooms are excellent - especially Emmily who is so helpful. Hotel also has a great breakfast, a small but adequate massage/beauty area with very reasonable prices. Located less than 10 mins walk from Jordan metro station. The airport bus stops on Nathan Rd right outside, and there were always plenty f taxis around. For convenience, there is a 7-Eleven right across the road. Close walk also to the Temple St night markets and two metro stops from the Symphony of Lights sounsdshow. This is a terrific hotel and I definitely recommend it. It was such a relief to come back here after a busy day out in the Hong Kong heat.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice hotel with a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: Nininyajay-K
Reviews.Content: I love the minimalist feel of the hotel. Room is small, but the decor makes up for it. We squeezed 3 people into a twin room, not a good idea. Customer service was a negative. I was not allowed to check in even an hour earlier prior to chk-in time. Very unhappy especially after flying long hours. Location is also a negative. Far walk to the nearest mtr station. However, I always willingly give up location versus quality of room. Overall it was a great stay, and would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Adytiger
Reviews.Content: Ok, Nathan Road is one long shopping drag and the views from this hotel (and all others in this area) are nothing to write home about but if you want views then stay by the harbour and pay the prices. Otherwise, this hotel is modern, clean and the service we received equivalent to the best hotels I have stayed in anywhere. Everyone was cheerful, helpful and very courteous to us as guests throughout our all too short a stay here. We had booked basic rooms but were offered an upgrade to the Premier Lounge for an additional HK$450 per room per night. What a bargain this turned out to be! Complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails in a private lounge on the 15th floor plus free wi-fi. Don't think twice about this if you do stay here. The hotel restaurant is excellent - the a la carte menu is good but the international all you can eat buffet served each evening is too good to miss. Even the locals come to take advantage of this. Oh, by the way, being a Novotel you even get a choice of alternative pillows if you don't like the ones provided. Jordan Road MTR is a couple of minutes away so you can get to everwhere very easily and cheaply - Landau Island for the airport/Big Buddha, harbourside for the Symphony of Lights, Central Hong Kong for the tram to the Peak or shopping. Temple Street night market is right on the doorstep and a great experience (just be prepared to haggle over price). One word of warning - you will be accosted every few yards along Nathan Road by someome wanting to sell you a suit/shirt/watch so just ignore them and don't get into conversation with them. When I ever return to Hong Kong this hotel will definitely be on my shortlist.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon Honh Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Surprised to have to pay for wiFi. This should have been part of the service as travellers depend on being able to use iPads etc. in their own rooms. Disappointed to have a service fee on all food and drink. This was in very small print on all advertising. Staff were very helpful. Very good advice from Local Information Desk at hotel on travel around Hong Kong. We used the metro confidently after helpful directions from lady at desk..

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Novotel Nathan Road in Kowloon - arrived near midnight off plane from Australia, staff on ready to collect bags of bus and check us in quickly - close to MTR, Temple Street Night Market and other shopping, service all over hotel excellent, great travel adviser in hotel, great food and room - could not fault will hopefully be back

Reviews.Title: “View from room is a slum”
Reviews.Author: kgrif0581
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice modern property with all the modern conveniences of a basic hotel. The view from the rooms is a slum with mattresses, discarded old couches etc. on the roofs outside. The buildings across outside seem to be a fire trap.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Business Hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Udo F
Reviews.Content: Very close To the Jordan Station , close To the Night market Small Rooms but very Good Service , nice breakfast If you Upgrade you will have 1h per day a free Business Meetingroom . Happy Hour every day

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We got connecting room for our family and served very well at the reception-well done. Hotel's location is just perfect-it was at the Nathan Road, where all the bus will lead you to many of destination. From the bus stop near to hotel, it can take you to the Avenue of Star, Tsim Sha Tsui Shopping Area, or to Mongkok (Ladie's Market). The MTR Jordan only 5 minutes walk from the hotel-not too far if you want fast and cheap transport using MTR around HK which is the best choice. There is subway for pedestrian to opposite of Nathan Road where the Night Market is located, and you can taste various of food at shop stall, hawker, and restaurant opened until almost midnight. Many shopping outlet and department store nearby the hotel. Right in front of the hotel, there is congee shop which is famous for HK locals. Taste it yourself. Even there are some minus: From our room window view is renovated building (a bit annoying), sliding door for bathroom do not have lock (a bit annoying too), during two night of our stay, TV sound and aircon in one of our room is not function properly (but we still can accept it, even we do not have time to watch TV, and AC is not too hot), room space is small. But we enjoy our stay because of the good price and superb location. Will stay again when coming back to HK? YES Recommend to others to stay here? YES THANKS NOVOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: Good size room for Hong Kong. Excellent breakfast. Good location for metro and shopping on Nathan Road. A fair walk to the harbour. We arrived during the afternoon of July 23 and the taxi driver on the way to the hotel told us that there was a typhoon warning. When we arrived at the hotel the Receptionist told us nothing about this. When I asked he confirmed that there was a typhoon warning but offered us no advice regarding if we should not venture out of the hotel or not. Even though there was a weather warning poster in the foyer the hotel should consider a typhoon guide in the rooms for travellers. We eat at the hotel restaurant one night. Very reasonable prices for both food and drinks and happy hour which is a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and still loving it”
Reviews.Author: py_bh
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I stayed with Novotel Nathan. Service was still as great as the year before - Friendly and helpful staffs. Clean room and good sleep quality. Given it's location and the quality of service and room, it's definitely value for money. Will definitely return..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern with good facilities, staff are helpful and friendly. Location is good, short distance to MTR and buses but also plenty of food and shopping in the immediate area. Good fitness facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Artie R
Reviews.Content: if you are reading this review clearly you are thinking of staying at the "The Novotel Kowloon Hong Kong" read no more as it's the place to stay! My mum (aged 74) and myself stayed at the The Novotel Kowloon Hong Kong from the 13th July 2012 - 29th July 2012 in a twin room on the 8th floor. This hotel would have to be in the best spot half way up Nathan Rd with the harbour (20-30min walk) to your left and the ladies market (20 min walk) to your right with lots and lots of shops inbetween, it may take you a while to get to your destination as all the shops that you pass you will want to visit. The hotel and rooms have a contemporary feel about them and are beautiful in design with ultra modern rooms and bathrooms with showers. The rooms are small in size however big enough for 2 (we were really only in the room to sleep) The daily breakfast is great with something for everyone, the resturant was not crowded and pleanty of food for all, also great coffee. Mum had her birthday while we were in HKG and the hotel had sent up a birthday cake, wine and a beautiful letter from the hotel managers, she really appricated this and it made her day that they thought of her. We will ofcourse be coming back to stay again and again, thank you for such a fantastic stay and to Derek who looked after us, Novotel Nathan Rd, the place to stay in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in HK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Staff were knowledgeable and helpful. However, I was asked to pay for a full-day rate for late check-out at 2100h on 11 August. A half-day rate would be reasonable as one would require a quick freshening before flight departure.

Reviews.Title: “Good business and tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhian_Dobbs
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to this hotel by a friend and love it for the same reasons. Staff helpful, reasonably priced, great location. Rooms not very big, but this is HK - space is a premium everywhere. Just round the corner from the MTR, opposite one of the night markets (where you can get good food), opposite a 7 11 store for basic provision, Starbucks round the corner and an ATM round the corner. I normally go for room only as I find breakfast expensive (in most hotels for what I actually eat - hence the joy of having the 7 11 so close).

Reviews.Title: “Good Locatiob”
Reviews.Author: Ruth1984_11
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed recently on a trip to Hong Kong. It is well situated on Nathan Road and is very close to the Jordon MTR stantion. On first impressions the rooms seem small but they are not actually that bad. They are very clean tidy and modern, a perfect base from which to explore Hong Kong. The only negative was the spa, the staff are very unprofessional talking to one another during the entire hour of my facial - not a relaxing environment at all. It is a pity the spa let this hotel down because other than that I could not fault my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good size room”
Reviews.Author: Jen1306
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Novotel 3 nights. The room was decent size and the bed very confortable. Service was good and staff helpful. The hotel is located 5min walk from the Jordan MTR, which is very convenient. The temple street night market is just accross the road, which is great for local street food and good bargains. We didn't have any meal at the hotel as we wanted to eat as much local food as possible, so I can't comment on the hotel restaurant. A few iMac computers are available for the guests with internet access. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: atcc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 days in August 2012. Hotel was downtown close to lots of shops and restaurants, very good location. The rooms very clean, bit small but as expected for Asia. Hotel looked pretty new, nice lobby, had Imacs downstairs free to use, staff were friendly and very helpful. The only complaint was no free wifi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon's, Nathan Road, superb location to stay.”
Reviews.Author: NZLindaAnne
Reviews.Content: Overall experience very good. We stayed in a superior room (1010) on a non-smoking floor for 6 nights. We arrived at the hotel at 8am, unfortunately our room wasn't going to be ready till 12noon. We could have upgraded (at extra cost) or taken a smoking room but decided just to look around Kowloon til 12noon.The room was very clean & comfortable, smallish but adequate for us. Wifi wasn't included in our room rate but you could use the internet in the reception area for 20 minutes at one time, before you incurred a fee. The only compliant about the hotel was that there wasn't enough information in the room about the hotel & the staff didn't give us any information when we checked in. eg about wifi, breakfast etc. We didn't use the restaurant but it looked popular as was very busy. There is a tour desk available in the lobby & day spa offering facials, massage etc. Across the road from the hotel in Saigon Street is "Hong Kong Fashion". My husband had 2 suits with extra trousers & shirts made within the 6 days we were in Hong Kong. Would recommend this tailor very happy with fabric & workmanship. Total cost was HK$5,600. Had a 1 hour foot, upper back & neck massage, by one of the many massage parlours, around Nathan Road very cheap at HK$120pp. Great experience & pretty good massage, definitely needed the foot massage with all the walking we had done. Local markets are Temple street & Ladies market. A lot of the same items, some good & some junk. Our experience with restaurants wasn't that great. The couple we ate at, the staff had little English & you weren't made to feel welcome. Transport in & around Hong Kong is exceptional. We purchased an Octopus card at the airport. You pay HK$50 deposit (this is refunded when you return the card, with HK$9 service fee deducted) you then load on how much you think you may use while you are in Hong Kong. We put on HK$100 to start with, you can then top up at the MTR's & other places. The card can then be used for buses, cable car, MTR & some shops. We also used it to catch the tram up to the Peak. When you return your card if there is a credit balance this is refunded. The closest MTR station to the Novotel is "Jordan Station" you exit at B1.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but..”
Reviews.Author: golfcaddie
Reviews.Content: Only here on a work trip so not too fussy. Room was clean and of a decent size - food in restaurant and bar fine - drinks expensive but I expect that in a hotel. not too impressed with the spa. Booked a hot stone massage as this seemed to be a speciality. Lady doing the massage was constantly chatting with her colleague in the next cubicle. She also left the room several times to attend to phone calls etc. This did NOT lead to a relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: terry r
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights , August 1 st to 6th , arrived at hotel thinking "ah well here we go again" but was pleasently surprised , check in was faultless , room was ready , clean and everything worked , admittedly we paid for room on executive floor but that was worth the extra , room was a little small but for a short stay was ok. hotel was only 30min by taxi from airport , and even though was right on a very busy street was quiete . Bar had entertainment every night , and happy hour proces were good , breakfast was very good , would stay here again when in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: shirotan
Reviews.Content: Good location with convenient stores, local shops, eaterries and shopping places around. Room is on the small size but it was good enough for us. Wifi connection is the room is free which made me very happy. One thing I didn't like is: Housekeeping ladies turned up at 8:00AM!!! I was still in bed or was working in my pyjamas... Breakfast was good and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dmitri76
Reviews.Content: This is my second time I stayed at this hotel. The reason for chosing this place second time is that is right in the middle of life, and it's close from this hotel to many attaractions, transportation is easy. The first time I stayed the hotel did not impress much, however it had everything I needed. So when I visited second time, I stayed only one night. A big pleasant surprise did I have, when a girl at the reception said I am upgraded to Executive room. Well, there is no difference in size and facilities, but what is great, you get lots of nice free options like free internet, free calls in HK and what is more- you get free tea and coffee at the bar from 14 to 17:00, and from 18 to 20:00, you get free alcohol drinks as much as you want, as well as some fine food!!! Great, I love it! Very nice, and I do advise to try it!

Reviews.Title: “Near everything”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: near 7-11 ,near exchange counter ,near shopping center they are opposite hotel. near food center everything ok. But the room's wall is not ok . i can listen the next room talk about everything. and you can walk to mrt only 200meter.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Novotel hotels I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Martyn W
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. We arrived earlier than check-in time but they made sure a room was available. The room was small but very clean and of a very good standard. I booked several months in advance so got a good deal. The hotel was ideally located in the Kowloon district so there was plenty of restaurants and activities in the area. The ferry to Hong Kong island was 30 mins walk. On the downside, the restaurant was overpriced and I was not impressed with the quality of the food for breakfast or in the evening. The bed was also a little too hard. Also the walls were relatively thin which meant it was possible to hear neighbours. I would, however, stay at this hotel again if I was to re-visit Hong Kong (which I would highly recommend).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ngaire5
Reviews.Content: We were traveling as three couples and chose this hotel because we were Accor members and they had a great deal at the time. The hotel is well positioned with easy walk to Temple Street markets and food stalls etc and a short walk to Jordan MTR. The staff were all extremely helpful and the service great. We were amazed at how quickly our requests were responded to for room service etc. Rooms were clean and well equipped and beds comfortable. The only thing missing was a pool which we desperately missed with temperatures and humidity at its worst! Aside from that we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business trips to HKG”
Reviews.Author: KKlow
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel, which is very strategically located between everything, MRT, restaurants, malls, money changers, 7-elevens, starbucks, etc. The staff is very attentive and professional. This place is always well maintained.The room is a good size room considering Hong Kong hotels with a comfortable queen size bed and very clean. It comes with basic toiletries, clean towels, etc. and there was a note saying that the water from the tap was tested and was proven to be safe to drink, otherwise, there's always a 7-eleven located across street from the main entrance of the hotel. Never had a chance to try the breakfast in the hotel, but it is always crowded. Downside: There is no wifi available in the room and you have to pay for LAN services, although there a several MACs available in the lobby for guest to tab into.

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were most helpful and the hotel facilities were excellent and reasonably priced. It was well positioned in Nathan Rd. We would stay there again. The room was on the small side but clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “12 hours in Novotel Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Basically booked this hotel due to location and very reasonable rate. Flight wasn't scheduled to arrive until late (9pm) but didn't end up getting to hotel until 2am due to typhoon that hit HK. Very nice rom and comfortable bed. Can't comment on anything else apart from the room service was quick at 2am... didn't use other services as I checked out at 2pm. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Rollaway bed added with no cost, best for small family or 3 traveller...”
Reviews.Author: vio86
Reviews.Content: stay the hotel during the summer sale 2011, we actually got it for 1 night free because i'm an accor advantage card holder. the hotel offer the additional bed with no cost is a great save for us which most the hotel in HK need to pay additional for add bed. 3 street away from the MTR Jordan station. 5mins away from the temple street.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: diana_zialcita
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband for one of our minimoons. we actually got it for free because i'm an accor advantage card holder. the bed was a comfortable queen, the floor was one of the highest so the view of the city was fabulous. the room comes with basic toiletries. bottles of water were also provided. it is important to note that there was a note saying that the water int he tap was tested and was proven to be safe to drink. the size of the room was just right. there was no wifi in the room but they did provide free internet in the computers in the lobby. the lobby was a bit on the smaller side, and in check in and check out, it gets very cramped. breakfast buffet was free, food was good. the subway was very near too. just about 3-4 minutes away. cabs are easy to get too, and the doorman was very happy to help. there was a 7-11 a few steps away. restaurants and malls too.

Reviews.Title: “happyjan”
Reviews.Author: Champs12
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 5 nights on the Executive Premier floor. Lovely hotel, great staff and included breakfast plus afternoon tea and cocktails and free wifi added great value for money. Room was immaculate and bed quite comfortable. Location was very good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great accommodation at a reasonable price. We did used our Accor card for a members' 'hot' deal!

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend stop-over hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1moretimetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with our 3 girls earlier this month. We stayed in 2 rooms and upgraded to the fully inclusive package where free wifi, breakfast etc is included. We found this to be a good decision as we paid by the hour for a late check-out and were able to make use of the premier lounge for snacks, drinks etc before being picked up by our airport shuttle which was at 8.30pm! the hotel rooms are modern and clean, although if space is needed you won't find it here! Hotel is well situated and was a quick walk to the MTR and literally across the road from Temple Street Market!! We loved Hong Kong and my only advise is stay at least 4 nights as there is plenty to see and do! This was our second visit to Hong Kong and probably won't be our last!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service, excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: need_a_h0liday_n0w
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying here for a full week, close to everything, and great value for the quality of room and service. Lost my phone during the stay and they found it and kept it for me. Trustworthy and helpful staff, not a single bad experience on my entire stay. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: zqn_ness
Reviews.Content: This Novotel was different to my experiences through Europe. I took the upgrade, although I couldn't get the room upgrade due to requiring a twin bedded room, the option to change rooms later in my stay was offered however I really didn't fancy repacking and moving all my luggage again. The staff said we would receive the upgrade room perks in the twin bed room we had which sounded great but no special little treats or perks showed up during our stay. I took this option after working out the cost for us to have wifi on two devices, breakfasts, and a couple of drinks in the bar each night. We breakfasted down in the main restaurant and I was very impressed with the options given, and the staff friendliness. Our room was fine, I had read a complaint about being able to see the people in the building over the street, ummm yes high rises in most cities have that issue and I really can't see why people complain about it the management can't exactly move the building to give more space! The concierge on the ground floor were polite and helped with any questions, bags etc. The bar staff were more intent to stand around and gossip - I'm sure it was something very exciting or scandalous but service first then go back to the in-depth conversations. The staff on the premium floor weren't overly friendly or maybe it was lack of confidence in speaking english but it felt flat? It was an easy stroll to the shopping, public transport and night markets. It was great to finally get a face cloth in my room after 2 months of traveling in Europe and never seeing one! The most disappointing thing was the constant bombardment of emails to get me to fill in a survey. I still had over a week of traveling before I got home to my computer but I kept getting reminders to full in the survey. One email after departure and then another a week or 2 later would have been less irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chung1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed there several times. Loved the location and the generous sized room. Nice gym, good and friendly staff. Had not tried any restaurants there are there are just too many good, cheap and tasty restaurants nearby. Only down side is that there is no complimentary wifi nor in room Internet. There are however a few pcs at the lobby but there were perpetually occupied when I was there. Will still return to stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Novotel Hotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was clean and the location was quite convenient. . The only thing what would make the stay more comfortable is to change all pillow, it is too flat with one and too high for two. The staff was quite friendly and tended to our needs quite promptly.

Reviews.Title: “really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel, excellent breakfast buffet to start the day, close to metro, all round excellence, many computers in foyer with internet for teenagers. Very polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Comfortable Stay !”
Reviews.Author: sihuii
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my trip and here's my opinion. I reached the hotel at noon and we were able to check in early. Though the room is slightly small, it is neat and clean with King Size bed. The staffs were friendly too! The hotel is about five minutes’ walk away from Jordan station. But I would prefer place that offers a walking distance to Mongkok. There are nice eating places around the hotel – Australia dairy farm and man ji noodles store. Service was good too. There was once we borrowed two umbrellas (with 30 dollars as deposit) and one umbrella when we returned. We were prepared to pay the umbrella (we did not check in the first place) but the staff returned our deposit with no questions asked. We did not have meals in the hotel as we went to authentic breakfast eateries. The checkout was fast and smooth. In all, Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon is a comfortable and affordable to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the strategic location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel location just two block from jordan mrt.Room is clean and nice. No view from the window. Staff is very helpfull. There is travel agent that sell dysney tickets with the nice sovenir. Wifi also available. In front htl can try wonton noddle. But for shopping near the hotel, price is too expensive compared to quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, prime location only 5 mnt walk to Jordan MTR station. But the room its quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie8
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Hong Kong and stayed here. As other reviewers have stated the rooms are small but perfectly formed. Our room looked out over the front of the hotel-not a great view. The room itself was comfortable, although we both found the bed to be a little too hard for us. The contol panel also took some working out! Our experience here was a positive one-check in was very quick as was check out. The staff were very friendly at all times and were most helpful if we had questions. We did not upgrade our room as breakfast was included in our package. We found the buffet breakfast to be quite satisfactory, although sometimes the hot food could have been hotter. Even on the days we had early tours and ate at 6.30am, some foods were still not very hot. We used the free internet stations in the lobby and never had any issues with getting access. The hotel is located about 1.2km from the harbour. It took us 20mins to walk down Nathan Rd. We did not use the MTR or taxis as we were happy to walk. We did take the Star Ferry over to Hong Kong Island and this was very easy and cheap. If we came to Hong Kong again we would consider this hotel but would also investigate ones that were closer to the harbour. All in all a comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel location near with shoping mall and mrt but no free internet wifi in the room also in the lounge but available with internet public. breakfast is good taste but not more item. hotel location just 5 menit from jordan mrt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: K S G
Reviews.Content: Visiting Hongkong you do not have to look for scenic beauty of the place where you stay. Its the easy accessibility to other facilities which matter, This hotel caters for it. You in the heart of hustle bustle, a typical character of HK. Service is very good. Breakfasts had variety and catered for all tastes. Rooms are too tight if you have to fit in a child bed. Space is JUST adequate for two.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lacking in service quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff took a long time for the check-in process and there were trainees hanging around them, looking lost. There was no proper queue system and the staff were talking loudly to one another regarding room availability. One of the female staff even said that she cannot remember the client who checked in earlier but returned to pick up room cards as the room was previously not available. Having stayed at a few Novotel hotels, I really think that the staff could do better. Even the concierge was not helpful and seemed impatient when we asked for comments on the eateries found across the street. The hotel also did not provide any free Wi-Fi in the room or at the lobby, which should not be the case for a business hotel. However, the hotel was in a good location for toursits visting the street markets and shopping areas in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay as it is centrally located. Moving around is easy as it is near the MTR subway. Room is cleaan. Will continue to stay there in my next visit to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: TofuMainie
Reviews.Content: With that price, definitely best value of it's location. Continental breakfast included, I was surprised such a small hotel would have a nice breakfast like that.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend great location and value”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at beginning of July. Took A21 bus from airport and dropped right outside. Return to airport on same bus is across the road....if you have alot of luggage is less convenient but still cheapest way to get to and from airport (35 hkd). Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Dont expect the Ritz but this is not a city where you should be in your room. Hotel service was very good. Free internet terminals at lobby readily available. Would be perfect if internet was included in the rate. Dont see how reception on 1st floor is a problem as per previous reviews.....staff were very willing to help with luggage. Temple street night market only minutes away. Also easy walk to Ladies market and to Tsim Sha Tsui. Subway from Jordan close by and easy access to Central. Convenience of 7-11 across road and McDs on Nathan rd opposite with Mcafe for value breakfast. Did not try hotel restaurant as tends to be more expensive than using outside options. This place is true value for money given the expensive accomodations in HK. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for value and enjoys walking to experience the city.

Reviews.Title: “great location... convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Thundering_Raiden
Reviews.Content: one of the best aspects of Novotel Nathan Road is the great location... middle of Nathan Road.. about 5mins walk from the Jordan metro station... makes the hotel as the best place to stay... very close to the famous ladies market, night market and jade market... rooms are kinda small .. but makes it difficult if you have more than 1 large suitcase... bathrooms are fairly ok... utilization of space is well thought of. other good aspect is the hotel staff... very helpful.. willing to help you and understand your requirement...esp. the travel desk... travelled as couple in June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location, stay for the bar”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of Kowloon shopping & market districts. Close to transport links; Rooms were great as was the bar & service in general; Live music was an aded bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly where you want to stay”
Reviews.Author: RARMAS
Reviews.Content: You're en route from Europe to Australia and you choose to spend a 4 night layover in Hong Kong to see some temples ( AKA ladies - do some shopping!) You've never been before and you're looking for somewhere new, clean, bright and central that's not going to hit the wallet too hard. This is easy guys , trust me, just book in here. On the main Nathan Road, central thoroughfare of Kowloon, ladies market is a 15 min walk to the right, Temple street market (good street food) is a mere 5 mins walk to the left. The hotel offers a variety of tours. We chose a half day tour of a fishing village, a Buddhist temple and a cable car ride which was expertly arranged and professionally executed. The hotel has all the facilities, including a beauty treatment room. My girlfriend had an enjoyable facial. All the staff made us feel very welcome. In particular, our travel agent had mistakenly not actually booked us in until later in the week, but the check in staff hardly batted an eye and contacted the travel agency directly to sort this out. The hotel itself provides the three B's with ease - fabulous Breakfast, comfortable Bed and Bargain price... Finally, ok, it's not the most luxurious hotel in Hong Kong, the rooms are on the small side but if you dont plan on spending all your time in the hotel it is perfect. Let's just finish by saying my girlfriend is quite particular (very fussy) and she was impressed - if you knew her, you'd book this place immediately!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay!”
Reviews.Author: SanjeevB
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the bustling nathan road and local hangout places in tsim tsa shui, temple street, night market are just in walking distance from the hotel. Even Jordan MTR is located 2 mins.walk from hotel. Rooms are a bit small but very clean & tidy. Amenities are great, food is good .... welcome gift for kids!

Reviews.Title: “VIBRANT HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A most enjoyable stay in a very good hotel, in a good location for Hong Kong generally. All of your staff were excellent, but I would like to make special mention of one of your concierges - Stanley Chow, who did much more than he needed to do, and who helped me greatly in a strange city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Hong Kong. This hotel offers a better value with still having a nice location. I was a little disappointed that the lobby did not have free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Layover”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: Spotless-efficient and very friendly staff. Terrific location in Kowloon and walking distance to the wharf and ferries. Very close to Kowloon Park....shopping everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Short Night Transit Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 2230 and out 0600 the following morning. Selected the hotel because of good price but the lack of free WF in lobby and room make it not a choice for longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the location of the hotel perfect being in the heart of the Kowloon shopping centre. Reception was prompt and efficient. The breakfasts were excellent but we did not find the dinner buffet worth a return visit. Room fitout and cleanliness was excellent but we were disappointed that staff did not respect the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. We were sleeping after 5 weeks travel. When they did not get a response to a card under the door they phoned the room. The following day a supervisor entered the room while my wife was sleeping to check that it had been made up. The card was not on the door on the second occasion but I believe they would know the room was occupied by their teltale light outside. I do not think that charging for wifi is a good look in a four star hotel and do not believe that it was made clear in the advertisement. However, If I return to Hong Kong I would still consider using this hotel along with other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: HomebaseTauranga
Reviews.Content: We found our two night stay pleasant. It was a quick ride from the airport our taxi cost 250 HK one way. The room was average size, bed was very comfortable, pillows great, bathroom shower good. We upgraded and stayed on exec floor (15 floor). We found this good value you can eat in their small dining or down stairs in the large restaurant for breakfast. We made use of the afternoon tea and happy hour for snacks and our evening G & Ts. The package also included wifi so it was worth it, and you have express checkout. Staff were very pleasant. Great location to markets and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Review Novotel Kowloon, Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: The location is good (markets, restaurants, metro station in the near) and the hotel is not located in a noisy area. We booked Executive room, where check in and lounge is on top floor. The room was small, but comfy and cleaned well. The rooms are small, coz in Hong Kong you don't have much space to built. The room and bathroom were always cleaned very well. The service from the staff is very good, but they have to make more attention to details: No one was on the desk when I wanted to check out and waited several minutes until some one came to the desk. Another point to detail is that near the coffee machine the sugar was mostly empty and not filled out. This are only details for small complaints and nothing to worry about. I can highly recommend this hotel. Good location, good service staff and price / quality ratio is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: prestontan
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is on level 2 hence you have to take an escalator to get up to the lobby. Not very convenient if you have to lug bags after shopping. It is near the Jordon MTR station but 'near' is subjective. About 3 blocks away to be precise and you take the stairs down to reach the subway. I booked two executive rooms. The checking in process was smooth though it took a while (30 minutes and we were the only ones checking in). I wanted to help ourselves to some soft drinks but we were told drinks were available only between 5 and 7 p.m. Rather different from other executive floor practices which offered some form of hydration during operation hours but never mind. We could respect that. We bought drinks from the 7-eleven nearby. Breakfast food was very very average. Some continental fare and two or three types of dim-sum dishes but it is not of standard Hong Kong fare. Hence we only ate breakfast on 2 of our 5 mornings. Novotel Nathan in Hong Kong pales in comparison with other Novotels elsewhere. If this was my first Novotel experience, I would probably not give other Novotels a try. On the second evening when we tried to have the evening cocktail, the lady setting up the food helped herself to some alcoholic drink when working. So much for professionalism. There are some some eateries (cha chan tang, as they are called) along the small street behind. They serve better food than the hotel but there is always a queue comprising mainly of locals. Reasonable price. Perhaps it was just our luck but the room on the executive floor that we had had certainly seen better days. Some of the cupboard doors were giving way and the sight outside our bedroom windows was an equally sorry sight. We looked right into the adjacent building that was in a sorry state with books piling up in one of the rooms (Yes, it was THAT close and if you could see the neighbours, so could they see you in your room). The rooms are also tiny. Not much space for one to open up one's luggage. Hotels in Hong Kong are small I know but this is a room in an executive floor. Given a choice and if staying at this hotel is NOT a must, perhaps you can consider some of the other options available nearby or elsewhere. And if you have to stay here, don't bother about the executive floor. It is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “modern and comfortable hotel, stylish rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier in the year and not much has changed, which is good. The hotel features a stylish yet restful euro theme, the bedroom is smartly designed to accomodate a modest number of luggage and guests, the ultramodern bathroom is small but functional. There's a console by the king bed to control lights and radio, and amenities like a coffeemaker, plug adaptor, plentiful desk and bedside power outlets, and a small bedside rolling tray are still there. The 32in HDTV console has a VGA, LAN, power ports but no HDMI or audio inputs. A sliding door covers either the bath entrance or the adjoining closet but not both. This is a slight problem at night as this door is best left covering the closet to deactivate its light. This leaves the bath open to the corridor, and when its lights are turned on it floods a darkened room with bright light. Instead of the two cube seats by the window we found a small chaise sofa which can sleep a small child. But I requested for a free bed which was big enough that I wound up sleeping on it instead. We tried the buffet breakfast on our last day, it was plentiful and good featuring many meats, fruits, and greens and great breads and coffee, and thankfully my kids ate for free. These family-friendly features made for a nicely affordable stay. Housekeeping and Reception staff were good and friendly. Billing is fast and check-out was straightforward as before. One difficulty was getting a taxi right away during rush hours, the concierge were attentive but apparently taxis are infrequent in the area. It's best to go down and have them hail one as early as possible. The great thing about the Novotel's location is its proximity to the subway and airport bus stops and to good local restaurants like Nathan Congee right outside. There's Starbucks on the corner, Wing On department store and McCafe/ McDonalds across Nathan, and the famous Yee Shun dairy and affordable chains like Yoshinoya, Cafe de Coral two blocks south and to the west on Jordan Rd. One2Free mobile broadband is fast, at least from the 6th and 12th floors where we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but fair price too”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the 15th June. I booked in the exec club level to make use of the snacks and cocktails and the breakfast. Room was OK. Size aveerage and pretty much like an upmarket Ibis. Everything required was there, bed comfy, pillows comfy as well. There was a selection of hard and soft pillows. Evening snacks was average at best and breakfast was far off what I have had in other hotels. Service was good with staff being very helpful. Nice area with lots to see at the night market and plant of shops around. Might stay again but will probably pay a little more and go to the Langham or Holiday Inn Golden Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for my family and the stay was excellent. The roms were very clearn and the service given to us was top notch. Location was in a more upscale pat of Hong Kong with lots of boutuques. But it is a 5 mins walk to the Jordan MTR Station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for its location near the ferry terminal and Hunghom station, since we are going to Shenzen and Macau. Novotel Nathan road was famous among tourists for its location near mtr Jordan, many shopping center in TST, Temple Street Market, and nice food in the nite-market there. But this hotel also very nice to stay for its nice and clean room, the staffs both reception and concierge are helpful to us. So it is very recommended to all friends who will be going to Hongkong. Definitely would be stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good location - lesiure hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomp_travel_reviews
Reviews.Content: Hotel location: - good kowloon location within an hour of the airport (train every 10 mins, then taxi 5-10 mins. Less is all by taxi). - night market, temple street, jade market all nearby. - entrance is not perfecxt as off the side street and can be slow for traffic due to 1-way Rooms: - small for asia, but big for Paris...so correct and have all amenities. - good shower (12 floor), but have the cheap looking novotel soaps good aircon not noisy or too hard on drying the skin - only a little noise from the noisy guests pasisng to their rooms (very good in asia) restaurant / reception - checkin very quick, accurate. But you have to take escalator to 1st floor (US = 2nd floor). - lounge small but quite good food - evening buffet reasonable price with wide range but many too many customers, staff do not know how to cut meat or sushi correctly - maybe because Friday and was busy. PLus = can brng your own bottle without corkage fee if I understood other guests. Staff did not come round (almost at all) to fill water glasses. Overall positive review, some small touches could help.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a small family.”
Reviews.Author: UpinderS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 6 night during June 2012. We had a quite a comfortable and convenient stay at the hotel. As you would have read already in most of the posting that the location is amazing and indeed it is. Staff is generally good and speak fair english for you to get around. Family size room are quite good, we were 2 adults and 1 kid. We all had a comfortable sleep during our stay. Mattress quality is good, you won't disturb the partner if you change your sleeping position. King size bed is good. Its quite a good size for small families. Hotel offers free single sofa bed facility to the toddlers. Breakfast menu is good, but could have some more choices. Fruits are not always fresh, Cheese quality could be improved as well. Tasca Bar: One on one happy hour is good for the guests. Tasca Bar is average, staff speak fair english, sometime don't even know what a drink contains. Live band is good, but during the band breaks, there is no music at all. I would recommend your hotel to my friends and extended family to stay, if they would visit HK next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Stacey J
Reviews.Content: I'm actually quite surprised with the review previous to mine. I had a very similar situation when I stayed. My brother works for Accor. We had spent time in shanghai and Beijing before ending out trip in hong kong. Unfortunately due to personal reason my brother went home and couldn't make it to hong kong. As we were staying under his Accor rates we were concerned how this would work with him not being there. We had booked 2 rooms and on arrival we had explain our situation. The FO staff were more than happy to accommodate us under our current rate. We had originally booked 2 rooms as there were 4 of us. Once there, they kindly upgraded us to one of there suites as we were now only 3. There was no extra charge and they cancelled the second room. As we didn't have the required staff card on us, they were still willing to let us pay Accor rates as long as they had a copy of the staff card and license of my brother before we checked out. We ha arranged the necessary information to be emailed and check out was no problem at all. I thank the staff for their amazing effort in helping us out. The room was absolutely beautiful. The VIP section was a very nice touch with drinks and snacks available in the evening. The hotel itself was beautiful and the breakfast was very yummy. It is situated in a prime location. Close to everything. And subway really isn't that hard to navigate. If you can read Chinese. Loved every minute and we are definitely going back with my brother so he can see why we loved it. Will definitely being staying here again on our return journey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Be Careful Poor Front Office Staff Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am Accor Adv. Plus Gold Member, Unfortunately, I was not able to come along my families for this trip on last minute cancellation. so that the reviews based on their feedback. first at all, i booked 2 rooms for this trip. everything run smoothly started from useful information from reservation supervisor to answer my enquiry until check in process. eventhough i was not able to present during check in, one of FO staff did not trouble my families, he allowed them to have a nice room and had fresh welcome drink as well. I gave my member card and letter authorization to my mom to prevent any miss understanding during check in, and ask my mom to show it when check in and so far until this stage there was no problem. problem happened during check out process, one of FO staff (woman) seems not happy with this condition (i was not able to come), before check out she told to my mom where i am. her face was totally not welcome my family with this. and it seem affect to my member card benefit, where my point could not be transferred. i mailed hotel, and although their gave me clear explanation, but for me it was not fair explanation, so that i ask their wisdom to clear this issue and still hoping my point can be transffered. until now, i havent gotten any answer from them whereas the issue has been informed to respective department. how well the hotel is if the basic services do not create a satisfactory level, it would create a bad image itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: grasal001
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we booked the executive premier floor which is well worth the extra cost as it includes free internet, breakfast and of course the evening cocktails. The only problem with this package is that the executive premier lounge is very small and gets very crowded at peak times and there is no toilet facilities on the floor, you have to return to your room for this. The square restaurant in the hotel was great value and as we are Advantage Plus members we had a 50% discount on meals. We will stay here again on our next Hong Kong stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jpooh
Reviews.Content: Other than the room's view, everything is tiptop. Staff is very accommodating from front desk to housekeeping. They took time to explain the upgrade inclusive and extra charges that we would expect, extra blanket came in 5 min upon request and rooms were kept every clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locations”
Reviews.Author: StacyMeiLiWong
Reviews.Content: Third trip staying here and still enjoy it here. Great location nearby many shopping malls, restaurants and shops. The room is quite modern with all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “No Free Wifi?!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to get free access to the internet, there are only 7 iMacs at the hotel lobby. Be prepared to stand in line, and wait for kids who sit there for hours playing games or logging in to their Facebook accounts, even at unearthly hours like 1am. When I did get a terminal, I even had a French woman using Skype right opposite me, conversing with her male friend. It was really loud. Recently renovated Nathan Hotel is just right next to Novotel, and they provide free wifi. Same price range, same comfort. Same accessibility. You're better off staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Mandurahmum
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night at this hotel, but found it a beautiful hotel. We are members of Advantage Plus so we used our free night and our friends who are members as well purchased a room at only about $116. the room was modern, and clean, bathroom was nice with a bathtub, The room itself was reasonably small, as most hotels in Hong Kong are, but still was adequate with a lounging chair beside the window. We only had 1 night, so didn't have time to do much, but it was amongst the shopping, so was great. Not sure if there was a pool, I'm sure there would have been but never got that far

Reviews.Title: “Clean and green hotel”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned to stay at the Kowloon side for three days and two days at Hong Kong island. We chose Novotel Kowloon for the first part of our trip since most of the reviews at TA were reasonable. The room was not as small as I expected. It was clean, functional, and modern which I always expected from Novotel properties. The a/c was strong and a welcome relief after a long hot day walking around town plus a nice bath tub for soaking our tired muscles. There was a nice Sony Bravia flat screen tv and a mini fridge to store our cold drinks. The king sized bed was very comfortable and we had no trouble getting some sleep. Although in-room wifi was chargeable, there were free PC stations at the lobby. The faucet in the bathroom sink mentioned that the water was potable. The hotel was pushing for less use of plastic water bottles as part of its conservation drive. Getting around was easy with the Jordan MTR station just a couple of minutes walk away and a bus stop right in front of the hotel along Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: KeiGal
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel, with modern feel. Suitable for business travellers who would like to stay in Kowloon. I believe the hotel is newly refurbished, or it's actually pretty new, altogether. Hotel is hidden in the lane, instead of the frontal of Nathan Road. However, location is good, with a 5-7minutes walk to the MTR Station. Temple Street Night Market is just across the road, accessible by underpass. We spent most of the nights finding supper and shopping at this night market. I find Temple Street night market has somehow surpass Ladies Market in terms of quality of products. Also, you don't need to bargain excessively. The only problem I find, is that the room size is small and not able to accommodate triple-sharing. We travelled as a party of three, and have a hard time convincing them to put an extra bed. So, I guess, this is not really a family friendly hotel. Nevertheless, it was settled eventually. Also, WIFI is not complimentary for the superior rooms. Unless you are staying in the Premier rooms, there's no complimentary WIFI, not even at the lobby. All in all, the stay was good. Price was not too high, considering the type of prices Kowloon Hotels command these days. Read More: http://snewthewanderlust.blogspot.sg/2012/02/hong-kong.html

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in Kowloon near MTR”
Reviews.Author: Nordic_Mike
Reviews.Content: Located in the densest populated area of the world, Kowloon, the Novotel offers nice modern accomodation, not fancy, but decent and clean. The rooms are small, even very small, held in perhaps bit boring predictable Novotel stereotype colors, are equipped with coffee brewer, mini bar, safe, nice comfy bed and a clean functional bathroom with walk-in shower. Free computers (Macs) available in the lobby with printing facilities (HKD 5,- pr. page), but paid wifi in the rooms. If breakfast is not included in your room rate, it is offered at HKD 118,- at the hotel's restaurant. Hotel staff is friendly, efficient and smiling. Because of it's location and not being a high rise building, the rooms offer no view to the Hong Kong skyline, only to the buildings next door, but again, Hong Kong is supposed to be explored outdoor, not indoor:-). The hotel is a five min walk from the MTR station of Jordan, and a simple 8-10 min taxi ride to the Kowloon Airport Express train station (taxi fare ca. HKD 30,-). From the many hotels I have stayed at in HKG, this hotel is among my possible return-to candidates, because of it's modernity and a decent price/quality ratio. It's not five star, and it does not surprise, but on the other hand it does not disappoint neither. A very good base in Hong Kong for a few days. But, my favourite above all in this great city remains the Langham Place Hotel in Mongkok; best five stars in Hong Kong at reasonable prices, unlike the absorbitant excessively priced fice star hotels in Central.

Reviews.Title: “Near the center and quiet”
Reviews.Author: MafArt83
Reviews.Content: After visiting Hong Kong 12 years ago, we’ve decided to return and choose a hotel on the Kowloon side again. This time it was not that easy, since Hong Kong got more expensive and the hotel we used to stay did not exist anymore (Hyatt Regency Nathan Rd) After studying the Tripadvisor we finally decided to book at the Novotel since the comments about the Hotel were quite reasonable. Despite the hotel is a bit further up the Nathan Rd., the location is still central and one can reach the points of interest within a few minutes. Since the hotel is not direct at the main road it is quieter. The first impression when entering the hotel was positive already. I nice fresh smell welcomed us and the modern bright appearance of the interior design looks inviting. Like a lot of other hotels in Hong Kong the lobby is situated at the first floor and can conveniently be reached by an escalator. The front desk staff is efficient and after a few minutes you get the key of the assigned room. As we have learned from other guests comments the rooms are rather small. During our 4 days stay we’ve had time to study the interior design and the furniture which are modern and nicely designed. But…. because the rooms in general are so tiny in Hong Kong, the architect has chosen the wrong design. The bulky bed headboard and the TV box are taking to much of the limited space. Therefore you have problems moving around in the room specially if you have to suitcases blocking the way. The bathroom is tiny as well, but well equipped with a glass wall shower and all necessary amenities. Another choke is the cabinet. You have to stretch yourself that you can reach the hangers and of course the space is very limited. To safe space the architect has provided a common sliding door for the bath room and the cabinet. That means if somebody is on the toilet you cannot close the cabinet. Well, we know that the space in Hong Kong is limited and expensive but this hotel has taken it to its limit what the room area is concern. Despite of that negative points, there are still positive ones like the restaurant with a decant breakfast and on the other side a bar with life music and a few internet stations. We think it was still worthwhile staying at this hotel and we probably will return.

Reviews.Title: “foul smelling rooms”
Reviews.Author: susiepnewzealand
Reviews.Content: We belong to the Accor hotel group and use there hotels all around the world and find them farily consistently good however this one is the worst one we have stayed at. while its location is great the staff don't care about addressing any problems and the food is poor. We stayed at this hotel last year and had a non smoking room it had a bad damp mustie smell like wet carpets mixed with smokers odour we were moved only to have the same smell and noisy air conditioning that didnt work well and i think thats because they sometimes control it themselves so lost sleep and found it difficult doing business due to being tired. This year we thought we would try it again because we may have just been unlucky but again a room that stank and noisy air conditioning approached managment but just no action taken . Very dissapointing as the chain is good and location great however we will not stay again and suggest they clean and repair the air conditiong before people get sick. there are many other nice hotel the PLAZA METROPOLIS The hotel bathrooms are very pokie . is very good so back there we will be going.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: JBONanjing_China
Reviews.Content: Well maintained modern hotel. Rooms have pleasant and practical decoration. Could be a bit wider though as there was too limited space to pass behind the bed. Staff at reception was nice and forthcoming. They allowed me to check in 2 hrs before normal time. Good breakfast for the price paid. Downside of the hotel is the location. It is inbetween run down city blocks of the same height so do not expect a good view unless you like typical Kowloon residential buildings. But Jordan MTR is a good gateway to all the great views in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Premier club well worth extra”
Reviews.Author: Theressa_1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 7 night stay, staff attentive, Premier floor worth the extra. close to Jordan Station and Temple Markets

Reviews.Title: “Small but in the thick of things”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As most of you have read the rooms are on the small side. I was in 714 and the view just plain SUCKED. Not sure if any room had a decent view, mine was of the buildings across the street hanging their laundry to dry. The building was old and looked dilapidated. The concierge is very helpful in navigating the city. Try bus 2, 2a, 6 or 6a to the ferry terminal and enjoy the mall. Temple street market is directly across the street that sells all sorts of stuff, things you do and don't need. Also a block or so away is a street that sells nothing but produce, from grapes to durian.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: vouleme123
Reviews.Content: Good location right in the heart of Kowloon. We had read in another review about asking to be upgraded to the Premier Floor. This upgrade really paid for itself in breakfasts, afternoon tea, cocktails and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Only 2 minutes walk to the MTR station and bus stops adjacent to the hotel. Shopping at the Temple Street Night Markets are less than 100 metres away. The rooms are large and very well laid out. If anything there was too much furniture in the room. Bathrooms are very well designed. Everything was perfect for us. Good internet access in the foyer and restaurants and bars offered all that a person could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & comfortable hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AndyandKim2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and although we weren't overly impressed with Hong Kong itself and all of it's hustle and bustle, we found this hotel very reasonably priced, modern and clean with a more than adequate restaurant and bar. The location was perfect to hit the shops and markets which was our intention whilst here. Our superior king room room was clean and modern but smaller than most others we have stayed in, however saying that, everything you needed was there. No views, no pool but we new that. The staff at the restaurant and the tour booking lady were great but we weren't overly impressed with the check in staff. We surprisingly found it difficult to communicate in English with them. We probably won't be back in Hong Kong but if we were, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but nice stay”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: This was a busy hotel in the heart of Kowloon. The hotel is close to the Jordan station on the MTR so it was very convenient to walk to transit. The room was small but overall, well appointed and relatively clean. The overall common space could use some updating as there were stains on the hallway carpet as well as on our room door. There were a few stains on our room carpet as well. The bathroom was updated and offered the regular ammenities. There were some rust stains on some of the fixtures, but overall it was clean and comfortable. Overall, a nice stay in the heart of Hong Kong action.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior king room and checked into a clean and nicely decorated on an upper floor. Although the room is not very big and the toilet is smaller, I still think that it's good value for money, as it is in a great location. There's a mtr station within minutes of walking and near many local eateries. Don't have breakfast in the hotel, it's not worth the hkd118+ they charged, have dim sum breakfast in a nearby Chinese restaurant instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Bad surrounding”
Reviews.Author: Rajaharry
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are good and decently spacious. Location though is no longer central, if your work takes you to downtown Kowloon. The hotel is situated in a lane off and not on Nathan Road though the hotel address says it is Nathan Road. There is no view from the room as the hotel is surrounded with dilapidated buildings. If you stay in superior rooms, the vision is blocked by the buildings which are very unlike Hongkong landscape and one can barely see the sky. It would be better spending HK$500 extra and stay on higher floor ie Executive Club rooms. The rooms is cozy though and one tends to get a good nights sleep after a hard day out in HK. There is a pillow menu offering pillows to suit one's requirement.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: adon123
Reviews.Content: Good food, my family enjoyed very well and it is near to jordan mtr so it is easy connect other areas,rooms are very clean, staff are very helpful to us,

Reviews.Title: “Easy to go around and pleasant environment”
Reviews.Author: sweetgelato
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time in less than 9 months in this NOVOTEL. The reason is that we were satisfied with our first stay. Unfortunately we had not the time to use all amenities. The rooms are not big but this is Hong Kong and are appointed in the usual Novotel style. If you want to have bigger rooms one needs to go to the five star hotels and pay consequently a lot more. The breakfast was excellent and the dinner food regular hotel style food. We liked the front office service and the service of the concierge. Also the service in the breakfast area was efficient and friendly. We did not like that the room cleaner forgot to clean the top of the writing tabe stained with residues rom drinks. The location for us is good since we are used to travel in big cities with public tranport if available ., comfortable and clean. The hotel is just walking distance of 3 minutes to Jordan MTR station and from Jordan you reach Central or Kow Loon Station within 10 minutes train ride. Cheap and comfortable. From the airport we went to Kow Lonn station by Airport Express train and took a taxi from there. There is also a Hotellink Shuttle bus which takes a little longer but ist from airport to the hotel and one has not to move the luggage from one vehicle to the next. A satisfying stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: loxias27
Reviews.Content: I have just recently spent 3 days at the Novotel on Nathan Road, Kowloon. I got a great deal through the British Airways website and this was my first time staying in Kowloon. I got the limousine shuttle to the hotel (HK$130) - there are cheaper options like the MTR or the A21 bus- but to be honest I wanted the least fuss and it worked out around £10, which was hardly a huge dent in my expenses. Check-in was prompt and pleasant enough. I was given room 610, which was directly opposite the lift, but despite occasional noise (mainly the irritating piped music in the actual lift) I didn't really notice it enough to bother me. Certainly no one was making a noise when I went to sleep. The room was spacious for Hong Kong standards - I had a good size king bed, a desk, large TV, a chaise longue/sofa, wardrobe (with slippers/laundry bag/shoe shine items), and a bathroom (with bath, shower, toilet, sink and a variety of toiletries). The room was clean and well maintained with a large window. I could hear outside noise - traffic etc - but it didn't bother me at all. The only downside I felt was the bed - which was incredibly hard. However, I had so many pillows to choose from, that once I had all of them on the bed I could just about get comfortable. I kept the 'do not disturb' sign on my door throughout my visit, and this was respected. I was called and offered any housekeeping items if needed, but I was fine without (I prefer my room not to be disturbed on short stays). The major downside was the cost of internet access. I travel for business so it is essential, but at HK$130 a day it soon adds up. Starbucks is a one minute walk away and I could get it free in there. If they just made their internet free I would certainly recommend it. Of course, if internet is a not a concern, then it's a pretty fine hotel. It sits a short 2 minute walk away from Jordan MTR station (which has lifts if you take that route from the airport), which is on the central line and can zoom you over to Hong Kong Island for $8.50. Alternatively, take the leisurely 25 minute walk in the humidity to the Star Ferry Terminal and catch the pleasant ride at HK$2.50. Well worth it. Overall a good hotel if you can get a good rate - I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: sanjaymahendra
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smallish & though centrally located the staff & the front desk are Rude, Cold & Uncooperative.Stayed for 4 days & inspite of the assurances and conformations given by the hotel upon arrival none of the commitments were fulfilled. All that was offered was Excuses & where is the swimming Pool The Concierge said there is none. Stay only if you R looking for a centrally located hotel but DO NOT EXPECT ANYTHING ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_and_Simon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel, Kowloon for two weeks in November 2011. We had booked into a room on the Premier Floor which turned out to be a good move. The room was clean and fresh and very nicely decorated - the bed was comfortable and we had no concerns during our stay. The breakfast was international, providing just about anything you could want or need.
