The Premier Floor Lounge provided afternoon tea (soft drinks / tea and cakes) and cocktails in the evening, consisting of a good range of wines, beers and cocktails, plus nibbles including dim sum etc. This was all included in the room price, which proved to be very good value. This hotel is well located for the MTR station, so it was very easy to move around to see the many sights of Hong Kong. Overall, a good hotel and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nathan Road Novotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: adrian b
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful three night stop over at the Novotel on the way home from Europe. We had booked a premium room and were accommodated on the 15th floor which has its own front desk, free internet, seperate breakfast and free afternoon tea and cocktails. The staff were very friendly and the room spotless. The large king bed bed however was far too hard to our taste and the lighting arrangement created in the early hours by a shared single sliding door to the wardrobe and bathroom was somewhat annoying but otherwise a first class effort all around. If you didnt like the small b/fast selection on the 15th floor the full b/fast option was still available in the hotel's main dining room.The location on Nathan Road is very central. The walk to the Star Ferry terminal takes about 15 minutes ( if your not distracted by the shopping) and the Temple market is almost just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 48lynn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. The hotel was well located for the MTR station at Jordon rd and walking distance to both Temple street market and Ladies market which are both worth visiting. A twenty minute walk would take you to the harbour. Hotel rooms are clean and comfortable overall the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Flowercandy575
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011. Hotel is located close to Jordan MTR. About 5 minutes walk. Very convenient as right across one of the popular night markets. Food is aplenty in the late evening. Took the MTR from airport to Kowloon Station and thereafter a taxi to the hotel which only cost about HKD 30. We booked a Club room and was allowed to check in at 6.30am on a Sunday morning. Receptionist was very accommodating without the usual response that one would get about early check in charge from other hotels for arriving so early in the morning. Room was small but functional. Anyway, did not expect to spent much time in the hotel room since we were only on a one day stopover. Guests booked on a Club room can either patronize the Club Lounge or main restaurant for breakfast. Suggest the latter as there are definitely ample choices. There are several iMacs at the lobby for internet access. There is also a gym located beside the porter's desk. Overall the hotel is value for money. Would recommend for couples travelling without any kids, considering the size of the room, who is visiting Hong Kong for a shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking room”
Reviews.Author: truebi
Reviews.Content: i did requested a non smoking room and it was confirmed ,the only room avaible was ,smoking room at 13th floor the room are extremly small, there was dirty hand towel in the bath room i did fergot a Rain Jacket in the Lobby,the Front Desk was not very Help full

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Teresa922
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with young children so had connecting rooms which suited us well. Lovely accomodating staff. Rooms very clean and decent size. slightly disappointed with food options in the hotel, we don't usually eat in hotels, but given the kids and exhaustion at the end of the day it was the easiest option on 2 nights we stayed, and found the room service menu, the same as the ala carte menu at the restaurant, had limited options given we were staying in a city reknown for its food. We didn't need the full buffet which looked good. Fantastic location though -would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready, 3hr wait!!!”
Reviews.Author: pauli355
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Hong Kong at the end of April 2012, we decided to stay at the Novatel because of the location and the reviews on trip advisor. Well, check in was at 2pm which we had arrived at the hotel about 2.05pm. When I went to check in and give my details I was informed that the rooms were not ready yet.(we were traveling with other family and had pre paid for 5 rooms about 2 weeks earlier) The 2 rooms that I had booked would not be ready for another 3 hrs!! 2 of the other family members rooms were ready and the other 1 had to wait 30min. The staff explaned that the previous guests had a late check out and the rooms would not be ready for 3hrs!! I explained to the staff that we had just arrived and my children are ready for an afternoon nap and my wife was feeling sick. The staff couldn't do anymore for us and said please come back in 3hrs. For the next 3 hrs my family and I were to either roam around Hong Kong, sit in the lobby or wait in the front bar!! These were not the ideal options as my children were crying and my wife was sick, we just wanted to rest in our room!! We came back 3hrs later and we were given our rooms. I asked again why was the rooms not ready as the rooms were fully paid for 2 weeks earlier??? The sam excuse was given!!! It's not my problem that they have people checking out late when I should have had a room at 2pm if thats the time to cheack in. If the check in time was 5pm well I wouldn't be writing this review! I told the staff that this is not acceptable and the manager came to see me, she offered a dew drink voucher but I didn't accept as I felt that more could have been done for me and my family. So not only have Novatel lost m and my family as customers that love going to Hong Kong but they have lost the 10 other people we were traveling with and all their friends and familys.

Reviews.Title: “Super duper delayed check-in. AVOID”
Reviews.Author: bruce r
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from a famous hotel book maker months before arriving. We arrived at the hotel around 2.30pm (30 minutes late from actual check-in time). Upon checking in, the staff informed us that only 1 room (of our 4 rooms) are available since the room is still "not ready". The negotiation went on that we wanted a late check-out for this case. It was instantly denied. We decided to walk around Nathan Rd. till 4pm which the staff promised as our check-in time. The time came and we head back to the hotel realizing that one of the rooms are still unavailable due to certain "circumstances" that we have to wait till 4.30pm. We totally understand that the hotel was congested due to some circumstances but having waited hours for our room was just in-tolerable. Check-out time was a mere 1pm.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: Hakun
Reviews.Content: For my first stay in Hong-Kong, we picked a centrally located Novotel hotel. It does cater to all the business needs with a good working station and a spacious room... The hotel is surrounded by a lot of shopping and a some nice restaurants too. Good pick !

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the most shopping areas, and The Temple Str market just accros the hotel. There are many restaurants around and 7eleven in front of the hotel. Near Jordan MTR and Bus stop. The room is small, but clean, and the bed is comfortable for us to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “efficiently served high quality food”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of Kowloon, Hong Kong, near the small alleys and markets. The set up of the hotel in a entrance ground level with a reception desk on the 1st floor, where the rooms are located up to the 14th floor. The rooms are small, just enough, but fully equipped with the necessary things as hair blower, minibar, television. Internet in the room is available for additional charge. The reception area has quite a number of iMac to check internet for things to do or to check emails. The breakfast is for additional charge and consists of a great variety of European things to choose from. Including an egg station and

Reviews.Title: “It hits the spot!”
Reviews.Author: jsoloca
Reviews.Content: I purposely planned a longer layover in Hong Kong en route to my final destination because I have never been here. I chose this hotel based on reviews and affordability. I was not disappointed. The room (1421) is like a great cocoon- a perfect way to decompress after a 14 flight. The shower literally bought me back to life. The hotel location and amenities are great. As a solo female traveler, I feel safe. This is the perfect way to get a little taste of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay. Overall very good hotel. Good location in TST area!”
Reviews.Author: DrKong
Reviews.Content: Very good choice of hotel if you want a descent quality place to stay without excessive luxury. The location is very good in the Tsim Sha Tsui area very close to MTR subway (Jordan) and is close to most shopping/market areas plus easy access to Hong Kong island via MTR. It is set back from Nathan Road so is quiet. Lobby and room service is very good. Breakfast is tasty. Gym is well equipped and has long opening hours. Surrounded by buildings so not much of a view. The rooms are relatively small - probably because this Novotel is a re-furbished older hotel but the new look is clean and modern. Facilities are good and same as other Novotel hotels. It is more than adequate if you are mostly going to be sightseeing rather than relaxing in the hotel. The Premier area is good if you decide to upgrade or are a Accor Advantage Plus member. If there is more than one person and the traffic is OK, a taxi is actually just quicker than the airport express train door-to-door at similar cost. Otherwise it is a short taxi to Kowloon airport express train stop (or use free shuttle to Eaton Hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RedRobyn1
Reviews.Content: Good location - a few minutes walk to the MTR and buses on Nathan Road. All staff very helpful and polite. Restaurant was good too. Room was clean with all amenities provided - even condoms! Bed was also very comfortable which is appreciated after a long day of sight seeing and visiting the markets. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pretty satisfied with the location - 7-mins walk from Jordan MTR station. Room was clean and bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sambarts
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with comfortable rooms, we stayed in one of the premier floor rooms with the added extras. The hotel is in a good location with most attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable bed, very clean and neat room, polite staff,”
Reviews.Author: dorishew2
Reviews.Content: Thanks Novetel hotel in Kowloon, Comfortable bed, very clean and neat room, polite staff, reasonable price to stay in a international four star hotel, it is perfect, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, easy access to public transport or walk. Clean, comfortable King Bed. Buffet Breakfast was good value. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Dimpy1
Reviews.Content: As part of a 35th Wedding Anniversary trip to Hong Kong for 6 days, the last 2 days was spent at Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon. Kowloon is on the other side of the harbour from Hong Kong Central, but it is where all the markets are. The ladies markets (Temple Street) is only 500 metres from the hotel, whilst the other markets are at the other end of Nathan Road, you are just around the corner from Jordan MTR station, which can take you most places you want to go for $4,00 HKD (which is equivalent to 50 cents in Australia). The hotel has a great buffet dinner, which is also at a reasonable cost, but the menu does not change, so if you were staying longer than 2 nights, it could get repetative, but saying that you do have an option for A la Carte. This restaurant is very busy and has a lot of locals eating there, so it is recommended to book. Although there is no pool to cool off in at this hotel, it does have the location, but no views, other than other buildings. But if you have come to shop at the markets and you want a base, this hotel is in a great location. Room size was average, but very impressive decor. Not a hotel for just sitting around enjoying the view and the room, but very practical location for the shopper. Bed was hard, but it appeared that most of the beds we stayed in at Hong Kong were hard. Overall, great hotel, location, food and service and my wife and I would recommend a stay on that side of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “What a great bed!”
Reviews.Author: valron37
Reviews.Content: Just completed a trip on QM2 from Adelaide Australia and disembarked in Hong Kong with a 3 night stopover before flying home. Our travel agent booked us into this Hotel because of its central location. The staff were extremely obliging and the position of the hotel was great with its proximity to Nathan Road and the night market. The breakfast which was inclusion with our package was of a high standard, the room was very comfortable, the bed and the shower were first class. Sometimes these things can be so unpredictable even in the best of hotels. Would not hesitate to stay there again on another visit .

Reviews.Title: “Quite Comfort of the room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is quite comfortable and clean, sleeping is quite good. The location is very near to the bus stop and it is very near to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bulakbol
Reviews.Content: I am only at my second day of my 4-day stay at this hotel. My flight to Hong Kong got delayed so I arrived at the hotel very late last night. I booked an Executive Room with 1 King size bed with Premier benefits but I was given one with twin beds. I was tired and I wanted to rest so I accepted it. I went straight to my room and was surprised by its size... not in a pleasant way. It is so tiny that I felt claustrophobic. I have stayed at the Executive rooms of other hotels and this one would pale in comparison. The room looked dull, lifeless and cramped. No "executive" feel about it. I understand that space is at a premium in Hong Kong but I have stayed at hotels with rooms smaller than this one and they have made use of the space better. I debated with myself if I should ask to be transferred to another room then I figured that the others will not be any bigger. I was really exhausted so I stayed put. I opened the curtains wide to make the room feel larger and I regretted doing that. Check one of my photos to see why. This morning I decided to have my breakfast at the ground floor because I know that the Premier lounge would have very limited choices of food. Breakfast at the main restaurant was not the best and the choices not as wide as I expected. I would probably skip breakfast tomorrow and just grab something at a nearby restaurant. Afternoon tea at the Premier lounge was also disappointing. I am not going back there for evening cocktails so I will not be able to share the experience. The location of the hotel is about 5 minutes by foot to Jordan MTR station. I won't mind the distance IF I am having a grand time here. I would advise you to lower your expectations if you plan to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “A bit random ... !”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little mis-matched. Despite booking directly with Accor on their website, the information I had, did not seem to match the hotel. I booked an ' Executive Premier Floor 1 King Bed '. Since I did not have an opportunity to see a non executive room, I cannot compare like/like. I can however, compare executive rooms in other hotels I have stayed in and reviewed and I fail to see anything executive about it. The room was pleasant enough, if a bit cramped. The bed was a king and was comfortable. Ample pillows. Desk area, well equipped. My package included Free Wi Fi, breakfast and access to the executive lounge. The bathroom was the best feature. A great walk in shower, fantastic water pressure. Breakfast was very good. Excellent choices and the quality was very good. The Executive Lounge was the smallest I have ever seen. Cheap modern furniture, certainly very little privacy and would find it hard to imagine it could seat more than 20 people and those 20 people would have to share tables with others. Really not a lounge at all because seating was not comfortable enough to linger - possibly the intention. A few ' snack ' items and drink available. Pretty much self service - including the drinks. Help yourself from a bottle. The first time I have seen this in a lounge, but frankly, I would prefer to be served. The hotel location is central enough, Jordan would probably be the closest MTR. I am rating my stay as 'average' based upon the fact that I did not feel the ' Executive ' package met my expectations. Some photos attached.

Reviews.Title: “location not good enough”
Reviews.Author: MaroochydoreLam
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights there just before Easter. Upon checking at 4pm we were told the room was not available because most people had already checked in. We had to wait for more than an hour and were given 2 drink vouchers. This had caused us great inconvenience as we were going to meet up friends and liked to get changed. About the room, it's on the small side but having a couch in the room does feel better. And in fact if you have a young child there is no problem to use it as a bed. Buffet breakfast was not up to scratch. Both western and chinese menu were poorly done.Buffet dinner was a lobster theme. You need to line up for a long time just to get a small share of the lobster. Not worth the effort. Location is not the best although it's close to a lot of eateries and shops. A better location is near Mongkok MTR station where the ladies market, computer shops, goldfish market and sneakers street are. Novotel is situated 2 MTR stations away from all these highlights. Staff were all polite and helpful.There is free wifi and a few computer stations in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “from average to good”
Reviews.Author: H0spitalityTraveller
Reviews.Content: The room is good and the services vary from average to great in two days Let down in a lot of ways

Reviews.Title: “2nd time to this hotel was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mmyk72
Reviews.Content: I really liked this Novotel when I stayed 3 yrs ago, so I booked it again. However, on this visit, everything went wrong starting from day 1. Upon check in at 12:45 pm on Saturaday March 31, I was told my room wasn't ready and to come back at 2 pm. No problem... When I returned at 3 pm, I still was told no rooms were ready. After waiting a long time at the check-in desk, I was given a king bed room. Even though I booked a room with 2 twin beds, I accepted it to avoid potentially waiting many more hours. So I went to bed after settling down in the room, but for the rest of the afternoon, all I heard was construction that seemed to originate right next door (at least in close proximity to my room). I mentioned this when checking out, I was told it was due to construction outside the hotel. What a lie. I guess this will be my last stay at this particular Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great hotel for business or leisure... Strategy location, make us easy to reach otherdistrict of Hongkong by train.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews of this hotel and as a member of Accor decided to stay at this Novotel location. We dont normally write a review but in light of some of the comments posted we decided to give an honest opinion of our experience at this hotel. An upgrade to the Executive Premier floor was worthwhile as the breakfast selection was more than adequate,afternoon tea and happy hour enjoyable and relaxing. The room was very quiet, well appointed and the bed extremely comfortable. Room Service was excellent after a long day of sight seeing, the dining room and lounge on the first floor served excelent food. We found the staff very courteous and helpful in all areas of the hotel. The hotel was very clean and housekeeping maintained our room in spotless condition. We booked several tours with the staff at the tour desk and found the service very satisfactory.Whilst we didnt use the internet there was more than adequate outlets available throughout the hotel. The hotel location maybe a little out of the way for some travellers but we enjoyed the 20 min walk to the harbour with lots of shops along the way, the night markets are only a 2 mins walk. The rail system is a must do, we found it so clean and efficient and easy to manage with Jorden Street station just near the hotel which enabled us to go anywhere we pleased with relative ease. We have been travelling for many years and have reasonable expectations of qaulity service and accommodation and we were not dissapointed with our experience at this hotel. If you treat staff with respect then they will assist you to have an enjoyabl stay. Hopefully one day we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4-star hotel off Nathan Road but away from the busy Tsimshatsui area”
Reviews.Author: miketri722
Reviews.Content: We were greeted perfunctorily at the Ground Floor Concierge Desk where our luggage was tagged and we were given instructions to proceed to the Lobby at the First Floor via escalator where our reservation was promptly acknowledged. I requested for a room in the quiet side of the hotel as we are light sleepers, at which time I was given room card keys to Room 1023 containing a king size bed. My request for a room with twin beds could not be granted, instead I was offered an extra bed free of charge. The room had modern trimmings and everything you would expect from a hotel of this category (4-Star, I believe). It was larger than I expected, probably 50% bigger than the rooms at its sister property in Wanchai (Hong Kong side). The hotel's location is good if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of Tsimshatsui, but close enough, actually 2 or 3 stops away by air conditioned bus. There's a 7-11 opposite the hotel and a Chinese Restaurant/Coffee Shop if you want to try local and inexpensive local cuisine. Everything worked to perfection and the unobtrusive service in all departments was quite welcome. We opted to dine out during our 2 night stay so we had no opportunity to try the coffee shop off the Lobby. There were 6 Mac Desktop computers available for guest's use at the Lobby which was a nice touch. Wi-fi at a fee is available throughout the hotel, so the complimentary use of the computers with internet connection was a welcome sight for us and other guests. I would definitely be staying here again, as we are frequent visitors to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobtown55
Reviews.Content: I stayed the first time in a Novotel and I have to say that this Hotel was great for the purpose I had. Very friendly at Check-In. The rooms are nice and modern decorated. Cleanliness was very good. Wish they had a toothbrush set at the rooms, but this is a minor issue. Overall it is a great business hotel in Hong Kong with a good location if you want to reach some tourist attraction by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just remember that the entrance is NOT in Nathan Rd but in Saigon St. Staff very friendly and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: Kimskate
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic position in Kowloon. Right near the Temple St markets and not far from the Ladies Market. The MTR was just up the road and connected to most places. The hotel was recently refurbished and the room was very nice. The breakfast in the Square buffet was fantastic. The only let down is the view (or lack of).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: eolopinion
Reviews.Content: Staid for 3 nights at Novotel on their executive floor. Staff was very helpful, usual executive floor benefits where there but the best part is the room size which is quite spacious for a Novotel and Hong Kong! Very well located on Kowloon too with easy access to the sub,

Reviews.Title: “Efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: ChineseTea
Reviews.Content: We usually don't book as hotels cannot guaranty communicating rooms. On arrival they got us the best internet prices without trouble so I was very impressed with the staff who saved me the usual discussion. (Some novotels even asked me to go to the business center and make the booking on the spot myself...) They helped with transport, mail and overall we had a pleasant stay. The area is good for shopping, touristic places are not far by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Attol1030
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location. It's along Nathan Rd. and very near Jordan station. With subway going to Temple St. (night market with various food stores). If you're not travelling on a package tour, transfer from airport to hotel (vice versa) is so very easy. You can take a bus that would cost HKD23 only. We will stay again in this hotel the next time we go to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be at but please try to accommodate your customers”
Reviews.Author: DesertTraveller0823
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well appointed with all the necessary necessities. The bed was great as with everything else that was functional for a city hotel. Location wise, it is strategically located between TST and YMT/MK, which makes it less crowded, yet still accessible. MTR is just a few blocks away which makes it easy to zip around town. The only grouse I have would be that for the front desk staff to more attentive to the customer's request. I booked direct with Accor and specifically requested for a high-floor away from the elevator. I wouldn't have minded the height but would appreciate the distance from the elevator. Obviously this was not of a concern at check in since the front desk did not bother to even inform me my request cannot be fulfilled and why they could not do it. 1 stayed here 3 times and have the.same treatment each time so that I believe I need to mention in order for the hotel to make some improvements in this. The boys at the concierge were excellent in helping with the luggage and extra packing which i needed for fragile luggage. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Valps
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our family of 5. We had connecting rooms which worked well for us. Close to the subway for easy access to where ever you need to go. Breakfast was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern room, very near Jordan MTR”
Reviews.Author: age_m82
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice modern bedroom at Golden Triangle area (Jordan Rd). Complete amenities. They can fit a medium sized sofa in such small room. Modern lounges. They have computers+internet to use at lobby but usually are always filled up. Very efficient staffs. Cons: Small room, but then again, it's in Hongkong so it's pretty normal sized. No view. No FREE Wifi. Overall, very good for sleepover coz I spent most of my time going out n about.

Reviews.Title: “Top Nathan road location”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTravellover
Reviews.Content: An excelent clean well located hotel for the serious shopper.Located less than a few minutes walk from the Jordon street subway station.modern rooms a little on the small size but with king sized beds.We found this a quiet hotel for it's location.The bar area is great for happy hour and bar meals with great entertainment and service.Yes there are McDonalds and Starbucks very close to the hotel but do try the local eateries all around this area.We walked from the hotel to the waterfrount most days (stayed 4) which is a very pleasent walk especially when shopping. Do wander off Nathan road to explore the many allyways and shpping centres. A well located hotel with a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location close to all the markets. good service with warm hospitality of the stuff. the internet is very good but cost 130 HK$.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, modern and good value”
Reviews.Author: 4leaf1981
Reviews.Content: We spent a 1 night stopover at the Novotel Kowloon, which is a few metres from Nathan Road, adjacent to the Nathan Hotel and the Eaton. We've stayed at the Nathan before, but the Novotel is a little better in my opinion. The location is perfect - a short stroll from Jordan MTR and easily reached from the airport via the Airport Express and shuttle bus (the shuttle stops at the Eaton and the walk to this hotel takes less than a minute). The hotel appears almost brand new inside and is very clean and modern. The breakfast buffet (I think it cost about $130 HKD) was excellent in range. We also got this hotel for a bargain price of $166 AUD ($155 USD) through a sale on the Australian website - Webjet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant, can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: petporter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Excellant hotel, modern, clean, bright, good gym with tredmil, bikes, stair climber, weights + machine. Free Internet in foyer,or in room rates are reasonable. Spa facilities offer excellant massage for around $60 aud's. This hotel is also Non smoking, a bonus in my book. Luggage storage FOC is available for people with late evening flights. Location great location near Jordan Station (5 min walk), starbucks on the corner for morning coffee. 5mins to Temple st markets, womens market 10 min. Rooms Clean, modern, reasonable size rooms for hong kong, quite, good selection of TV channels. firm but comfortable bed - king size - choice of pillows, bathrobs, hairdryer etc included. safe in room Stayed in a standard king size room for 4 nights. Excellant Hotel, can't fault it, you will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugsPerth
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, lovely modern rooms although very small. Clean and tidy, good location, very helpful and friendly staff, nice bar area and a good gym. The food in the bar was average, but the atmosphere was very nice. Breakfast was very good and worth having included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “No complimentary wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine with a great location in Kowloon, and spotlessly clean rooms. Rooms are small for a 4-star hotel, but typical of Hong Kong. Biggest disappointment was that there is no complimentary wi-fi; you have to sign up for an expensive subscription. Even Ibis offers complimentary wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, central for everything in Kowloon.”
Reviews.Author: Culinaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for two nights being en route from Singapore to London. This hotel is without doubt very well run. On arrival, keys for our rooms were immediately forthcoming, and the room itself was first class with plenty of hanging space, a very comfortable bed, and an excellent bathroom. The breakfast suited all tastes, including vegetarian and was well presented. We did eat dinner in the hotel, and found it to be very reasonably priced, and of excellent quality. We did notice that the restaurant was very busy, with young business people. Always a good sign when the locals eat in a restaurant. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: sham00
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Went for the Premier option and was really pleased. Staff were incredibly helpful and polite. Bed was fantastically comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hong Kong Experience”
Reviews.Author: Catherine D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road and were very impressed with the hotel. We chose a Premier floor room which has added extras such as breakfast, either in the Premier Lounge or the Square Restaurant, afternoon tea in the Premier Lounge and evening cocktails also served in the Premier Lounge. We opted for the Square Restaurant buffet breakfast which had many choices including western and asian and were more than happy with the food selection and service. I had afternoon tea once in the Premier lounge, there were several choices of sweet and savoury snacks and the coffee was good. Evening cocktails were a must and it was nice to have a relaxing drink before hitting the streets for dinner. Our room was clean and comfortable and a little larger than I had anticipated. Daily room service was always completed before we returned from our day's outing. The staff were always friendly and helpful with any of our questions about getting around the city. Emmily who was working on the Premier floor for most of our stay was exceptionally kind and helpful to us and we would like to thank all the staff for making our stay one to remember. From our easy check in to check out we could not find any faults with the Novotel Nathan Road. We had a couple of meals in the bar area which were tasty and quickly served and the staff there were also courteous and efficient. I have read some reviews where people have complained about taking their suitcases up the escalator to check in, but if you go to the concierge desk at the hotel entrance your luggage will be sent to your room only a few minutes after you have checked in. Our last night we decided to do the buffet dinner in the Square Restaurant, it is very popular with locals and tourists. My only drawback with our dinner was that the dishes were not replenished quickly enough for the amount of people that were there but the food on offer was very tasty. Novotel Nathan road is close to the night markets and the ladies market and a short walk to the harbour. Very convenient location and would definitely stay there again if we go to Hong Kong. Well done Novotel Nathan Road!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher D
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location near the easy to navigate HK MTR. Public transportation in HK is fantastic. The hotel was very modern and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar and entertainment were fantastic. My only complaint is the food. The restaurant was overpriced and not very good. The food available in the bar and room service were also very overpriced. No matter what, do NOT order the sandwiches...you'd have better luck with a vending machine or hawker food. Novotel was expensive, but well worth the cost for a very clean, spacious, and modern room.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: janeastrange
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Novotel for 5 nights. Have been to HK before and have previously stayed in Mong Kok, this was a really good position between Mong Kok and Shim Sha Shui - very close to Jordan MTR. Rooms were small but clean and had everything you could need. We got the executive package which was great because we could have breakfast upstairs in the lounge as well as afternoon tea and cocktail hour. It also included wireless Internet which was great. Would definitely stay here again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “very good, good price”
Reviews.Author: mattbull
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel on Nathan Road in Kowloon. Room is not very large but everything needed is present. Comfortable bed, spacious bathroom. Downside the cost of the internet connection that is around 13 Euro per day. Staff very friendly. Storage of baggage after checkout is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: fumblefish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the premium room and really enjoyed it. Free tea, coffee and snacks during the day. They changed the room when we found the noise from the lift machinery disturbed us a little. The room facilities were great, like the shower. The hotel was convenient for the subway and the ladies market in the evening and a wide choice of local restaurants. the concierge sorted a taxi out very quickly and we were only minutes from Kowloon Airport Express to get to and from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves more expensive hotels for dead !”
Reviews.Author: Dakar1967
Reviews.Content: Third time staying here and the service really stands out in all areas. Very courteous staff at every touchpoint, who actually care about thier guests and enjoy what they are doing. The rooms are very compact, but let's face it, all you need for Hong Kong. I lost my passport enroute from the ariport, and the Assistant Manager Yean Tan had it tracked down within 40 minutes, chasing me down as I was heading for the police station. She may have freaked out a little when I gave her a big hug though. I'd stay there anytime, and reccommend this place without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location....”
Reviews.Author: Tonelim
Reviews.Content: You can never go hungry by staying at this hotel. Within walking distance to all the nice restaurants, MTR station and Temple St Market. Check in/out was swift and friendly. Free internet at lobby is a big plus although you have to pay for in-room access. Overall, a fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Travel_16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother for 6 nights in March. Fantastic location - so close to Jordan station (I had no idea the MTR was so easy and cheap to use) and loved the Temple St night markets. The room was modern and spotless. Whenever we required anything it was done quickly - milk to our room, extra towels, etc. My Mum had food poisoning and the Assistant Manager could not have been more helpful. She arranged for a Dr, extra towels and late check-out so my mother could rest. We had dinner one night in the dining room - a very good variety of food on the a la carte menu (everyone else seemed to be enjoying the buffet) and breakfast one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dannyboy65
Reviews.Content: A decent hotelif you are a biz traveller as the location in Nathan Road is excellent. All the action like the Hong Kong night market, the excellent dining options and the harbour are all walking distance. The metro station is also next door so mobility would not be an issue. The hotel surprisingly does not have a swimming pool so if you plan to take your children there on vacation I suggest you rethink. Otherwise the rooms are clean, the breakfast choice is huge and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princesspea01
Reviews.Content: We go back and back here with our family. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. Great value. Clean. Good staff. Kids Like the food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travell0ver86
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with great services! I really enjoyed the room, it's big enough and comfortable! The breakfast is of good quality and with good service! As well as asian food as western items on the buffet! With the metro around the corner and a busstop from/to the airport almost in front of the hotel! I would definitely come back to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: YorkBonBon
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here . The bed was HUGE and so comfortable . The service was excellent and the location is so central for the markets . There is free internet access in the bar with 3 or 4 terminals for guests to use . We had a coffee in the lounge which was a bit expensive but worth it . I would defintely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kazart
Reviews.Content: Good hotel is great location. Rooms decent size for Hong Kong. Comfortable extra large bed. Location on Nathon Rd is perfectly placed for all areas. Victoria Peak is a must do as is Stanley Bay, great market and great beaches. Overall an excellent few days

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: davsyd
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is a good choice but just skip the buffet breakfast. The pastries are not freshly made and every morning were soggy and not crisp. Bacon was luke warm even when I see the chef bring it out fresh. The scrambled eggs one morning had a green colour to them, not sure what it was. Not enough selection and quality not up to par. Apart from breakfast the hotel is a modern Novotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: Hgrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in February after leaving a cruise. The hotel is situated on Nathan Rd but access is via what seems a slightly seedy side street. Its a safe area and not problem once you tune into Hong Kong living. Transport links to the hotel via the underground station at Jordon are very good. Walk towards Kowloon Park on Nathan Rd and you have the shopping malls and restaurants. Walk in the opposite direction and you have the traditional markets and Jade markets etc. Kowloon park is well worth a visit and only a short walk from the hotel. We noted that the restaurant was full to capacity with local Chinese families enjoying the evening buffet so we joined in. Very good food and value including Maine lobster and assorted meats and seafood. Rooms are fine but a bit quirky with a sliding door which doubles for the clothes space and the bathroom. We found the reception, restaurant and house staff to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very centrally located on Nathan Road. Excellent value for money, although the staff did not seem as friendly as in other Hong Kong hotels we have stayed in. Room excellent size (for city hotel), very clean and modern looking. Fitness centre did the job for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly efficient staff, excellent breakfast, great shopping hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: Left our luggage in the lobby and took the lift to the club floor where we were quickly checked in. Luggage soon followed. The room is not as small as some of the hotels we have previously stayed at in Hong Kong. Complimentary in room high speed internet worked well. Modern design and functional. A roomy rain shower and quality ammenities. Bed was comfortable. Club lounge rather smallish with no real private areas, but food and drink was of a good variety and standard. Superb breakfast catering for all tastes. This hotel is an excellent to use as a shopping base, with everything at within a short stroll from the front door including the night market and lots of eateries. Jordan station is an easy 3-5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Stay...Had a Great Time, Excellent Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KimmieRN
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with my stay at the Novotel Nathan Road Hotel last year...that I decided to stay here again this February when my sister decided she wanted to come to Hong Kong. We stayed for nine nights and had an excellent experience. The room was clean and comfortable. The beds were comfy and had nice down comforters and nice fluffy pillows. The bathroom was sparkly clean and the shower had great water pressure and lots of hot water. On our third night, we came back to the hotel after midnight and found out that the toilet flushing mechanism was not working. We called the front desk and in a few minutes, two friendly maintenance men appeared and in 15 minutes the toilet part was replaced and the toilet was working perfectly. How's that for service!! I was really impressed by how fast they responded and fixed the situation. The hotel staff were friendly, pleasant and very polite. The hotel check-in and check-out process was quick and easy. The concierge were very helpful with giving us directions and writing out in Chinese to places we wanted to go to by taxi. They had several computers in the lobby and bar area for client use. The hotel is in an excellent area for shopping and eating. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Easy access to local transportation. Bus stops are out in front of the hotel and the Jordan subway is a few minutes walk away. We used the Airport Express train/free shuttle (K1) to and from the hotel which took less than an hour and was very convenient. We even checked in our luggage at the Airport Express area before boarding the train to the airport. We had a great time in Hong Kong and would definitely recommend the Novotel Nathan Road Hotel to anyone that wants a comfortable, pleasant place to stay. I will definitely be staying at the Novotel Nathan Road Hotel on my next trip to Hong Kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Naveen13
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Hong Kong and want to stay in the thick of the action and the busiest area of the city, then is the perfect hotel for you. Surrounded by shops and located on the famous Nathan Road, this hotel caters to all the needs of a shopaholic as well has nearby access to the Night Market as well as the MTR station. Rooms are good and the staff are very courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet is also an impressive spread. You also have the option of free internet in lobby area which has over 8 apple Mac computers. On the whole, awesome hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of HK; no view and tight rooms”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: Renovated property; used to be the Majestic a few years ago; Accor have done a decent job in renovating it and having the rooms resemble the latest Novotel Room Incarnation with the HUGE bed heads that take up 20% of the rooms. The bathrooms have no baths (suites may have) and just shower, but that's ok as they are not big and the shower makes better sense. The location is in Jordan (MTR - Underground) and a stones through to Temple St Market and 15min walk to Tsim Sha Tsui one way and Mong Kok the other way. Gym is great size, only 1 restaurant (i would eat elsewhere) and bar next to reception. Overall if you can get this hotel for a good price and you know the area, then decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasa99
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfy hotel in Kowloon area. I Stay here for 2 weeks Excellent location and just 3 min walk to Jordon MTR station. Room is spacious and nice decor. However, front desk staff is Not well trained and not Too professional.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Floor is good”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin_RRR
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights thru Accor Advantage Plus. Not only we received a good rate, but we were assigned to go to the Premier Floor. The staff are always pleasant (we had the preconception that everything in HK is rush and hurried). The concierge was helpful to tell us not to worry about transport as we had ample time to go to the train station etc etc. We were given breakfasts, afternoon tea and cocktail. The bad part is that we were so full that we missed some chances to sample the famous HongKong food :-( The location is really central with lots of shops around it. Anyone can do with a little walk around the area for at least a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and accesible”
Reviews.Author: babygemini
Reviews.Content: from the airport, we took the MTR to airport Express to Kowloon then there is a free shuttle bus to connecting hotels. Since we will be staying at NOVOTEL nathan road, the bus assigned is bus number K1, where we got down Eaton Hotel and a 2minute walk to NOVOTEL nathan Road. first time to ride the free shuttle bus, so we kindda had a free day tour of the area. =) Novotel is convenient, it is very near mtr (Jordan station) WING ON Mall is on the next street. a lot of restaurants and shops around. walking distance to Temple drive night market. Novotel's room is nice,modern the restroom is small i like how they maximized the space and design. ... accommodating people. wifi wasnt free, you have to pay HK$95 for a whole day access. didnt pay anymore coz there is free wifi in the area... advice to tourists, there is a small electronic shop at the corner near the stairs to the subway, do not buy there because the prices of their goods are too high. it is still better and cheaper to buy stuffs at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in Nathan Road, the busy shopping street and a short walk from temple night market. It is about 5 min walk from Kowloon Park and 10min walk from the harbour. All in all a good loaction fro Kowloon. The hotel is modern, we stayed in an executive suite on the 15th floor which has its own reception and dining area for continental breakfast. If you prefer a full breakfast you can join the rest of the hotel on the 1st floor. Part of the deal also includes afternoon tea and cocktails. Staff were very friendly. Requested late check out which was free until 2pm then 110HK$ per hour for a maximum of 4hrs then charged for a full day. Shuttle bus available for transport to airport which cost 210HK$ for 2 people but be sure to book at least three hours in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable stay at great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Member's rate got a discounted short stay but as this is Hong Kong it's still on the pricey side for a four-star hotel. It was nice hotel has a modern restful theme, elevators are not keyed-access but were quick. The room is smallish but functional and well-lit and is smartly designed to accomodate a modest number of luggage and persons. The King bed was not-too-soft comfortable with a choice of pillows and a console to control lights and radio. Amenities like a plug adaptor, plentiful desk and bedside power outlets, a small bedside rolling tray were thoughtful. The HDTV console had a VGA, LAN, power ports but no HDMI, Al Jazeera and Foxnews were dissonantly available. There was no outdoor view to speak of, but my wife found the two cube seats by the window great for naps. The stylish bath was cramped but functional with decent hot water pressure. Toilet is top push-activated though which I heartily dislike. A single sliding door covers either the bath entrance or the adjoining closet but not both, this is a problem at night because the door is best left covering the latter to deactivate its bright closet light. This leaves the bath area open to the corridor, and turning on its overbright ceiling light floods a darkened room with too much brightness. I resorted to plugging a USB light into the wall shaver outlet for nightime duties. Housekeeping staff was thorough and friendly. Reception staff was a bit hurried and cool, but then we did arrive at midnight and they were tired-looking. The Concierge was helpful with directions but on arrival there was no one available to bring our bags up the escalator to the upper lobby where reception and elevators are. On the plus side, billing was fast and check-out was straightforward once I stated I had not availed of the minibar. The best thing about this location is its proximity to the subway and airport bus stops and to so many good local restaurants like Nathan Congee right outside. Also decent chains like Yoshinoya, Cafe de Coral two blocks down on Jordan Rd, a Starbucks on the corner. Broadband service in regular rooms is not free, so the first thing I did was to buy a mobile broadband SIM pack and hotspot it on my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: alanwwn1234
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel by travel agency website. When I attended to the concierge the young attendant asked me:"What's your name?" I was amazed that such kind of language can be came out from them. Then I told them my name and present my ID card. I was surprise that the young guy told me that no reservation from me. I told them I reserved the from specific website. They checked and told me no reservation from that website. Then I told the reservation number, finally they found my reservation. Their attitude are totally consistent but terribly bad! Anyway, the check in process is absolutely disaster! The thermostat of the room is useless as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Traveller13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in 2011. We had booked a concierge room and were delighted at the extras this included. The food was fabulous, the service phenomenal and the location absolutely magic. The staff couldn't do enough for us and ensured that we enjoyed everything about our trip. If we go to Hong Kong again, we would most definitely stay there. It is central to all transport and if we wanted advice or directions the staff was always available to provide the answers. I can't rate this hotel too highly and would give it 10/10. Thank you so much, Novotel Nathan Road!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay; Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Rainne_T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon for four nights. Good location, and the hotel is actually quite easy to locate as bus A21 from the airport stops only a few steps away from the lane that you need to turn into in order to get to the hotel's front doors. (Just do some research on the internet and you'll know how to find the hotel entrance.) Only gripe is the awkward escalators which you need to lug your suitcases on in order to get to the reception, if you don't want to leave them at the concierge. Within walking distance to night markets, and even to Mongkok, if you don't want to take the MTR. Also, there's a Starbucks just next block, which is good news for SB lovers. Staff at the reception are pretty well versed in English, and all of them are very well mannered and polite. Though not overwhelmingly friendly, they were quick to address any concerns that patrons have. We arrived earlier than the check-in time, so we weren't surprised to be told that the room was not ready yet. It was not a big problem as we just left our bags with the bellboys and went to scout around for interesting shops and eateries nearby. Went back to the hotel according to the timing given to us, and we were given the room cards to our room without a fuss. Room size is pretty decent, standard among all other HK hotels. All requests were fulfilled - non smoking floor, extra pillows, king sized bed. Their mattress was lovely, and I find the softness of the pillows just right. Lots of electric sockets in the room to charge our gadgets (my partner and I were gadget freaks), which is a huge bonus. Bathtub was clean too, and although the shower curtain looked a little old and worn, it's not exactly a huge issue for us. Housekeeping was prompt and lovely on our floor, replacing toiletries on the second day even though we did not finish using them on the first day. Noise isolation was marvelous too. Despite it's location and our room overseeing the busy Nathan Road, we couldn't hear any traffic noise nor anything from next door. All in all, Novotel Kowloon far exceeded my expectations, and I definitely will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Neats61
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent, not only was it close to Jordan MTR Station it was not too far from Temple Street Market, the Ladies Market and Jade Market. Nathan Road is lively and interesting; it's a pleasant walk (about 20 mins) to the Star Ferries along Nathan Road. The hotel was clean, the decor is modern, the staff were friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast had a good choice of food. They also placed 2 bottles of complimentary water daily in my room. In the reception there were 7 internet terminals that can be used free of charge. The hotel bar had a happy hour in the evening, during which time live singers and bands provided mellow entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsgp
Reviews.Content: Location can't be any better, with walking distance to Jordan MTr station, and less than 3 minutes' walk to Temple Street market. Plenty of food outlets with some that are simply outstanding at very reasonable prices. The hotel itself is good. The room is large, clean, well equiped, and quiet. The staff members from the concierge to the front office and housekeeping are always helpful. Only problem I have is the internet service, which is extremely expensive at this age and time. Why can't Novotel give free internet for a USD180 per night room?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: imperan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just round the corner from Jordan MTR station. Between Yau Ma Tei and Tsim Sha Tsui. If you fancy walking to the str ferry it only takes 20 minutes or so, or if you want to take the bus. There are plenty to go there and to Mongkok where the ladies' market is. Room is very well maintained and clean. Staff are very pleasant. The only compliant is that there is no wifi paid or free in the room. However Ethernet is available to use for the paid service. In the reception area there are a few iMacs there for the guests to use, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AussieinCHC
Reviews.Content: Checked at 130am. Night team very efficient and helpful. Good location and for Hong Kong very good value for money. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Novotel, Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very Nice staff. Stayed at executive floor room 1501. Nice bed. Breakfast is god, afternoon tea good and predinner drinks topp ! Good location at Nathan road. Take buss number A21 from airport , stopps in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Megs_TS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my dad, sharing a room with twin beds. We had booked through expedia and there was some sort of mix up which meant the hotel had to call expedia. They acted like this was a huge inconvenience and it took about 40 minutes before we could check in which was a little irritating. However, the rest of our time there was incident free and we were happy with the booking. Room was clean, a reasonable size for Hong Kong, and in a great location. I love Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were very freindly and helpful. The restaurants supplied a very menu and buffet options. The gym was fabulous, however unfortunately there was no swimming pool. We were given a disabled access room, as there were no other rooms with 2 single beds available. It was slightly inconvenient that no tissues were provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location et al.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and attention to detail. Very convenient location around Kowloon area. 5 mins walk from Jordan MTR. Just wish the reservation staff were a bit more attentive as in-spite of a change in booking they still had my old itinerary, front desk staff were quite efficient in fixing it though.You will be paying a premium to stay here but its worth it I'd say.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: laruru
Reviews.Content: The room looks exactly like the website pictures. Feels clean and it's spacious by the standard of Hong Kong hotel. Even with a couch and stands for 2 big luggages, there is adequate room to move about. The room is cozy and comfortable and was a joy to return to every night. Toiletries such as shampoo and shower foam are provided. Toothbrush and toothpaste are upon request. Even though there's no free wifi, we used the internet provided at the Macs in the lobby every night. To take the mtr, it's just a 5 mins walk to Jordan MTR exit B1. Walking from the hotel to Mongkok area would take 25 mins if you're into walking, during the cold weather. Not that advisable during summer. Try the steamed milk dessert and carrot cake at Hang Fa Lau which is just opposite Novotel. Overall I really loved the hotel. Even the lobby had such a nice fragrance!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay - Handy location near Jordan MTR”
Reviews.Author: O D
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Hong Kong many times over the last few years, I can recommend the Novotel. Stayed in a Premier Club room, on 14th Floor. Room was small (Fairly normal for HK) beautifully furnished, wonderful bathroom with a Proper shower! Rooms looked brand new. Breakfast in the main restaurant downstairs was great. Don't waste your time with Breakfast in the Premier club. Premier club was open useful hours unlike most HK hotel club floors, which meant you could actually go there. Needs a few more seats and more food & drink - Club only puts out refreshments during certain hours, so you can't really go there any time of day. If you had to pay for breakfast in the restaurant, it is HKD$120 per person for the full buffet which is pretty reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Size matters ?”
Reviews.Author: no1smeghead
Reviews.Content: Good location in Kowloon near night market and 1 stop on MRT to Mongkok market. Disappointed that the Hotel shuttle bus from the Kowloon stop of the airport express didnt stop at hotel .... not far to walk with bags but maybe a bit daunting if your first visit. Hotel itself was good - -the only complaint is that the rooms on the premium floor arent exactly expansive. If you are travelling with 1 child (allegedly the max per room) the put up bed gobbles up any space that there may have been !

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very good location and good service especially by the staff ( Alan) in the i Square for the morning breakfast. clean rooms and the travel advisor or agent near the reception was very helpful. Would definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “very practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickintinos
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very practical for the simple reason everything is at proximity, shopping, restaurants, sub-way. The hotel itself is very clean, and the staff eager to please. The view is not that good but you got to remember it is downtown Hong Kong, The executive lounge is a little small but cozy, wine, beer and snacks always full during hours. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, almost forgot, if you have Aeroplan card use it there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Fcosenti
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is one of our favourite destinations for shopping and holidays, and therefore we changed quite a few hotels during the past years. Not any more - from now on, this will be our place of stay. What we like: 1. Centrally positioned with fairly good access to MTR 2. Close to markets 3. Plenty of good eating spots around 4. Size of rooms - yes this usually is a big deal in Hong Kong, since MOST hotels have tiny tiny rooms, while this has standard size. Anyone thinking rooms are small here clearly has no idea of how it works in Hong Kong - they should see other hotels!! 5. Price point is ok, I consider it good value. 6. Clean and well serviced. In summary, we will be back regularly.

Reviews.Title: “What's a first class service”
Reviews.Author: xjnlrntx
Reviews.Content: My wife accidentally left some important travel documents, cash, credit card & ATM cards in the in-room safe when checked out. I phoned Ms Emily of the front desk from HK airport. She responded positively and confirmed by returned call within 15 mins after located the left package. She gave clear instruction how to retrieve the left package by our friend as we were about to depart and impossible to return to the hotel. After then, the e-mails exchanged with the manager, Mr. Yean & Mr. Li were promptly attended. With this incident, shows the professionalism and sincerity of the staffs of the hotel, Nobody wants to be as careless as I do, but when it happens, one will appreciate if there is good support. The hotel is located in the mid of shopping area and public transportation including MTR is only 300 meters away. Night market-Temple Street and many delicious Chinese restaurants and food stalls are at walking distance. We were assigned a inner room on the 10th floor. As expected, no view at all through the window. The room size is very reasonable in Hong Kong Hotels standard. It's clean. The furniture, beds as well as the bathroom and shower are well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite beyond our expectation. The location is perfect, near to MRT Jordan station, few blocks to the night market in Temple street and Browning street and there are so many eating places nearby. We enjoy our stay at Premiere Room and delighted to get free internet access and lounge snacks and entertainment. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: havevanwilltravel09
Reviews.Content: We had just got off the plane from the UK early in the morning so were tired and in need of a shower. Our room was very clean and of a nice size (esp. for a crowded city like Hong Kong) and most importantly was quiet. We managed to get over our jet lag nicely without being disturbed. The lounge bar has good price beers and wines and the singing was a great accompaniment. The Novotel is in a useful area - very close to the metro and lots of nice restaurants nearby. It doesn't have the views of hotels nearer the harbour but is a fraction of the price as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but it's vicinity to Nathan Road makes it a very noisy proposition. You'd think that sound proof windows could be installed - not so. The only positive item is the conveniently located power and internet socket. All the rest is questionable: Reception staff unfriendly, cleanliness marginal at best. It seems to be mostly a hotel for one night bus tourists. Not recommended for business people. There are numerous hotels that provide a much better value for the money. For me a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Value of money”
Reviews.Author: Ekkorn S
Reviews.Content: We have special rate from this hotel and take our daughter to stay at this hotel for her first trip to Hongkong, very nice hotel and services, recommend to stay here after long activities day

Reviews.Title: “Value and quality average”
Reviews.Author: claude c
Reviews.Content: my wife and I along with our two adult children stayed here from 17/12/11-22/12/11. This hotel is very conveniently located close to subway, markets, shopping malls and loads of restaurants. The hotel itself is typical of this Accor 3-4star product. We had two adjoining rooms which were clean, tidy but quite small. The bathrooms were modern and the toiletries very basic. As in all Novotels the towels are bath towels not bath sheets but that's in keeping with the level within Accor. The staff at reception were not terribly enthusiastic and lukewarm helpful. I asked if they could confirm my flights to Beijing as I struggle with Mandarin and Cantonese, I was told I could do it online using their free WIFI at reception. The airline (China eastern's website was down) when I informed the young lady behind the desk she was not forthcoming to help at all. The breakfast in the restaurants was great and the range and quality of food and drinks on offer was a standout feature of this hotel. The concierge staff were helpful in getting taxis for us and the house keeping attendants were most obliging when asked for extra toiletries. As far as value for money, I am left a little vexed and feel that next time I might consider an alternative, perhaps on HK island or even Tung Chung. All in all if your after an adequately clean, tidy and decent hotel without 4-5 star frills then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Xing30west
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly. Very clean and convenient location. Make sure you walk to Nomads and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: JessTKY
Reviews.Content: Location is one of key considerations when choosing a hotel and novotel certainly meet my expectations. It's just across the temple street night market where you can also find lots of small eateries. The subway is also not too far away. As in most hotel rooms in hk, it's small but functional and comfortable. Anyway, not many people stay in hotel room in hk. You go to hk to eat and shop and shop and eat ; ) Will stay there if i visit hk which I most likely will.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location nice room”
Reviews.Author: Bernie028
Reviews.Content: Occasionally one comes across a place that you do not wish to reveal to others as next time you may be unable to get a booking if it becomes to popular! Such a place for me was the Novotel in Kowloon. In fact it was fully booked in the weekend I stayed there prior to Christmas. So it no doubt it has been discovered by others. A very reasonable room rate especially if you prepay. The service was excellent and the Tasca Bar a delight. Handy to many shops, markets and the MTR. I could go on but I won’t. In summary, I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - expected much more”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall average stay, it is all about location, great choice if you are going to use the hotel only for an overnight nap. Overpriced considering the size of rooms and services, however cleanliness and housekeeping services were excellent. And if you are a A-club member please do not bother about privileges or benefits, no one really cares.

Reviews.Title: “China Quality Serivce!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was really dispointed for all serivce from staffs. really China quality. Naver has any serivce sprits. I am not recommend to stay this hotel. I think better serivce in Hong Kong Side of Novotel. I was stat at Premier Floor and I use Lounge several times, but, always nosy and busy and staff service are really no good. Even When I check in this hotel, my room are not ready and I need to waiting for quite long times to ready my room and that was really late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Kwokwp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in superior King room and love it. Bed is comfortable and room spacious in HK standard. Don't expect any views from the hotel window. Location is great, just a few blocks from Jordan MTR station. There are eateries nearby and they close really late at night. Airport bus A21 stops nearby the hotel. When we leave at 4am in the morning, cab is easily available along the road. I would recommend staying in Novotel Nathan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Time @ Novotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for Accor, great value complimentary hotel. Nice & Good staffs, good location, small room but perfect. Our suggestions, the movies in room should free for guest, breakfast include is better. Overall Very Good for us if chance we will back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: joelbarish
Reviews.Content: Close to subway and lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. No problems with English and the staff is friendly. Free internet in the lobby. Rooms are rather small and the view is terrible from the lower floors. The breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “great value but watch the price ！”
Reviews.Author: gehararigo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at least half dozen hotels in HKG and find the hotel excellet in the following points: close to Metro、easy acess to airport by bus A21,clean and functional rooms、lots of midrange restaurants around、walkable to major shopping areas. However, the pricing is very much reflecting according to the demand and supply. The same room costs nearly at least three times during the peak season. Also, the room which we stayed this time did not have bath tab which might be problem for some travelers. Room is equipped with iron and tea making afcility which are both helpful. We will always consider this hotel as a candidate when we come back to HKG but book after checking the price.

Reviews.Title: “clean and modern hotel - housekeeping a problem though”
Reviews.Author: H0w_it_is
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonable given its location (4 - 5 mins walk to Jordan MTR station) and the modern and comfortable facilities and rooms. Check in was fairly efficient, and we had a standard room on the 3rd floor. View wasn't great, but further to other reviewers about the not so pleasant views, this is to be expected when you're right in the centre of the city next to loads of other high rise/old buildings. This is Hong Kong! However, if you like magnificent sea/river views then go for the 5 star hotels near the harbour that cost £200 plus per night. The room size was more than adequate with space to walk around the bed and a chaise longue at one side of the room by the window. Very comfortable bed, very clean and the bathroom modern with good supply of toiletries (shampoo, soap etc, and also cotton wool pads/buds, shower cap...) You get 2 bottles of distilled water complimentary daily. Rest of mini bar stuff you had to pay for with standard rate. Good supply of tea and coffee making facilities, however as with most of HK hotels you don't get fresh milk or even milk jiggers, but powdered coffeemate milk. Air Conditioning was good and fairly quiet and the hotel was generally quiet all round (lucky that we had good neighbours!) There's a 7 eleven opposite and some fairly cheap diners, the big restaurant next door apparently does good dim sum. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel due to the price. The bar was good with efficient service and most nights had live music consisting of singer and musician, very relaxing. Drinks are expensive though, e.g. £4.50 - £5 for a pint of beer, however most nights there is a happy hour on 2 for 1 selected drinks, BUT the complimentary 'tapas/serrano ham' offer with drinks was not available to us even though we went about 4 times. The gym in the basement is pretty good with cardio machines and free weights. Towels and a water cooler machine provided - BEWARE the 'pink' tap pours hot water, don't do what i did and take some and gulp it down thinking it was cool water!! Tip - there is a bus stop on nathan road going to the airport (for your return trip) however it's on the other side of the road. If you have luggage (and even if you don't) go down the subway to get to the other side, it's quicker, but you need to carry your luggage down and up steps, depends which is the lesser of two evils (we had really heavy cases and it was awful carrying them across the steps but as nathan road is a dual carriageway you have to walk a while to get to a crossing). Another tip - for foreigners you may well get mega-hassled by the guys at the nearby tailor shop asking if you want to buy a cheap suit - my travelling partner wants me to post a good (!) tip if you do get hassled, just tell them you're a tailor yourself and he doesn't bother you again. Laundry tip - come out of the hotel (side street) turn left going up to the road running parallel to Nathan Road, then turn right, and there's a cheap launerette ahead on the corner of the next street. I definitely recommend - the only thing I would say is, even though you put a 'do not disturb' sign in the mornings, housekeeping would RING you several times to get a time off you of when it would be convenient to service the room, this AFTER they have placed a card under the door asking you to contact them. I found this infuriating, since more then one occasion housekeeping woke me up ringing the room, right when I was so tired with all the jet lag. Management please note this and I hope housekeeping will amend their practice of disturbing guests when they have specifically asked to not be disturbed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chenpo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights on our trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is situated on Nathan Rd, one of the main roads in Kowloon, a great location. We were about a 5 minutes walk from the Jordan subway station, and about 20 minute walk to the harbour. Also a short walk to the popular ladies market. The rooms themselves were very modern, a bit on the small side as expected for Hong Kong. There was no free wifi available in the hotel, but there was internet access available on computers in the lobby. There was also a handy travel agent in the lobby which we used to book tickets to Disney Land. The only minor issue was that the lobby was located on the 1st floor, and there was only an escalator going to the 1st floor. When arriving a porter brought our bags up for us (presumably from a staff elevator). However when checking out we had to carry our luggage down the escalators ourselves. Wasn't a big deal, but would have been nice if there were porters to take your bags down to the ground floor for you. Overall a nice stay, no major faults and a good base for exploring Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AhKing
Reviews.Content: I took a travel package from the airline with few night stays at Novotel Nathan. Good ambience. Good lobby check in with a number of staffs handle. Well spoken and handling with quick check-in, though it's season months. Great wide choices of buffet breakfast. Another great buffet Buy 1 Free 1 for supper on Christmas day. Room space just nice for couple, single or even small family with 1 kid. Four lifts, easy access and fast service. I'll return to stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “A complete Waste of Money for Executive Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loyalty doesn't count in this hotel. Being an A Club/Gold and having stayed at numerous Accor hotels this year alone, this hotel will be at the rock bottom in terms of service rating. This hotel has clearly lost its bearing and forgotten that SERVICE is the core product of its business. Identity of this hotel is questionable with condom displayed along with minibar refreshment on a countertop. Hospitality is non exisitent at the Premier Floor. Having paid extra for the additional comfort and service, staff at the premier floor were cold and iresponsive. Email me if you still value customer's feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Been there before and will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's not the first time that I checked in this hotel. Executive Checking-in lounge on the 15th floor with daily treats to the Executive room guests. However, it's also not the first time that I arrive, even after 2pm, and my room it's not ready! I have mentioned this to the management before. Also, I will not have breakfast in the 1st floor ever again, because their juice glasses are disgusting.
