I have also told this to the management before, but from the last 3 times i have been there, no improvement at all. I guess i'll give it last try, only because the location is really good and their beds are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but one thing disappointing me”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location, but there is one thing that disappointed me. When I checked out, there was nothing to pay additionally other than my payment at the time of reservation. Why do they keep my depoist money (HKD 100) without any explanation? They said it will be released within a week but it pass several weeks already. Is this your way of making a small money without thinking the on-going customer loyalty in the long run? I would like to heard from you the reason why I have to pay my deposit money. My email address is skchae01@gmail.com. Thanks anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right at the centre of Nathan Road. It is close to night markets, food, shopping mall etc. In addition, it is just a few minutes walk from the MTR Jordan station. Going anywhere is so convenient. The rooms are pretty spacious, neat and clean. My young children had no problem getting a good night sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was so easy!”
Reviews.Author: Chicken82
Reviews.Content: This hotel made everything so easy! They organised transfers, provided excellent customer service, and helped us with anything we needed. It's location near the Jordan MTR made it super easy to get around and it's walking distance to markets and the Harbour. I loved my stay and I definately reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and good service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Thexder
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near to Jordan MTR and restaurants. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that we stayed in Hong Kong, and this was a much better hotel, in a better location. It is within 5 minutes walk of the nearest MRT, Jordan Road MTR. There is nothing that I can fault the hotel with other than wanting to charge HK$98 for 1 day wifi access, whereas I could get a whole month for that cost with another local wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been advised by friends that to expect hotel rooms in HK to be a shoe box, that's why I went for the Executive Room for my stay. The reservation team had been excellent as I had been emailing them prior to my arrival with my late check-out request and their responses were all within 24 hours. Upon check-in, found out that they even have afternoon tea served in the Premier Lounge ontop of the breakfast & cocktail hours that were advertise in their website. The room I had was on th top floor, very clean & comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “well done, novotel nathan road”
Reviews.Author: jer859
Reviews.Content: Was here in December 2011 on holiday.. Positive aspects as follows: - Nice and modern room interior, probably has been through a recent facelift; - Great location on Nathan road (near Jordan MTR station); - Large room for Hong Kong standards, with a recliner and respectably sized bathroom; - Lotsa channels on TV (AXN, Starworld, the works etc); - Comfortable king sized bed with clean white linen and spare pillows in the wardrobe; - Value for money on the Accor site promotion (about HKD1,000 per night on average); - Breakfast buffet for HKD118+10% taxes, which is reasonable Not so good aspects - No complimentary wifi in the room, with internet charges being quite exhorbitant in urban HK; - Breakfast buffet variety isn't much to shout about; All in all, had a great trip, thanks Novotel Nathan Road!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for staying in HK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good service provided by front desk. Room is very clean. The local shopping place is very close. Great place to stay if your choice is to find something local. Good taste Dimsum restuarant just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok”
Reviews.Author: Forbidden_apple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel in October while travelling with my family. The check in took almost ages. We reached the hotel by 1PM and was told that the check in time was 2PM and we will need to wait as rooms are not ready. That meant wait for an hour with my 4 year old daughter and wife after a 14 hour journey. At 2PM, I was told it will take another 45 minutes which totally flipped me out. The reason why I chose this hotel was because I was an Advantageplus member and have always been treated like royalty in all Novotel/Pullman/Sofitel brands. Finally, I get my room at 2.40PM which means our plans for Disneyland are nixed badly. Remaining of the stay itself was ok, nothing bad or good, just about average. The breakfast which we had there was good and filling but the Indian food was not great. FInally, after 3 days while we were checking out, I went to the reception and told that I will check out in the next 15 minutes (at about 12PM). I go up and the phone rings and a lady tells my wife that an addl. HKD200 will be charged if we do not check out within the next 10 minutes!!! Typical of the place, left hand does not know what the right hand is doing. My outrage was even more prononced because they conveniently forgot that they gave us our room a full 40 minutes late. I'd say its an ok hotel, but there are better hotels in better places in HK for a lot less that would be happier to serve you. The only saving grace was the service I recieved post checkout. Unfortunately, I had presented my Forex card for blocking at the time of check in and this amount was not reversed. The lady checking us in promised she will send for cancel but typical of my check in experience forgot about it (I had confirmed and she assured me that it had been sent for cancel). I reached India and started my follow up to get this cancelled. Edward Leung was very helpful in working to identify the chargeslip, etc and in his absence George Wong sent the required letters in a jiffy to take care of the reversals. This promptness kind of softened my overall feeling towards this hotel. Again, all in all an ok stay, nothing to write home about

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Mong Kok”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our 2nd stay at the Novotel, again staying for a week on the Executive Floor. It is well worth paying the extra $$ to stay on the exec floor: the cocktails and canapes in the evenings alone are worth the upgrade cost, let alone the other freebies (afternoon teas, internet etc). The rooms are not huge (thats Hong Kong) but they are well furnished and have everything you need. Service is great and the range of breakfast dishes available is extensive. The hotel is located on Nathan Rd Mong Kok and provides a great base for exploring Kowloon side of HK. It's conveniently located right near Temple St night market for shopping and street-side restaurants. Jordan MTR is close by if you want to travel further afield and taxis are cheap by Australian standards. We'll be staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel of Kowloon, HK”
Reviews.Author: lousifers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at several hotels in HK. Novotel Nathan is the best for the same range of price. The room is quite spacious and very clean. The sleep quality is very good. Walking distance from MTR, bus, congee/noodle restaurant, 7/11, shopping area. The airport express shuttle is also nearby. Being in Jordan makes you easily go to both shim sha tsui and mong kok. Can also walk to temple st. if you wanna buy fake stuff and sex toys.....kidding. Check-in/check-out process is fast. Free Mac in the lobby for free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful breakfast with a wide variety of food. At the egg bar, freshly made omlettes and eggs are cooked to your liking. Helpful and happy staff.We plan to stay there again next trip. I had deliveries sent to the hotel, the staff were efficient to notify me of the delivery arrival. The staff all smile.

Reviews.Title: “Good full-service hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full-service and in a good location in Kowloon. It is a bustling area, and a good place for the first time visitor to stay, though I now prefer Hong Kong Island. -The rooms are modern and well-equipped except for the lack of wifi. -Rooms are small, but not tiny--big enough to accommodate a chair and desk. You don't have to sit on the bed. -The second floor lobby is a minor nuisance, as you must rely on the bellhops to assist with luggage. -Concierge was fairly helpful. Front desk was professional, though busy. -The MTR (metro) is a block or two away, making it convenient. -My view was just of unattractive buildings nearby. -Lots of restaurants and convenience stores nearby -Some extras, like free water, free papers (in lobby), honor bar in room Our toilet broke, and was fixed within an hour. Overall, while not the cheapest or best hotel in Hong Kong, I feel that it is one of the better values.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the premier rooms which although small were well accquiped, clean and very modern. The extra benefit of Breakfast, afternoon tea and Happy Hour drinks and snacks was fantastic and well worth the extra money. Thanks for help with boarding passes etc as well. Close to the markets and an easy walk down to the Star Ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gabysf
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our decision to stay at Novotel Nathan road during our Hong Kong trip. The hotel is modern and impeccable. The rooms are small but extremely functional, modern and clean. The bathroom was absolutely spotless. The location is great as well. Nathan road is always brightly lit and busy, we felt safe walking around late at night. Around the block from the hotel there is a great dim sum restaurant. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the harbor. It's a pleasant walk with lots of stores and malls along the way. There is also a bus stop half a block from the hotel which is very convenient. On the downside, there is wifi in the lobby but not on the rooms. Rooms can only access the Internet through Ethernet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RNMills
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to markets, great restaurants, transport and shopping. We could either walk or catch public transport to anywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Three days in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: nanook9
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Hong Kong,at the Novotel on Nathan road, , which was right in the heart of Kowloon. Kowloon is like a suburb of Hong Kong, which you can see across the Harbor, and that is quite a sight. We found the hotel to be first rate, in every way, and made our stay very comfortable. We went over to Hong Kong, and climbed ( By car ) the highest mountain , Victoria Peak, from where you get a truly magnificent view. We also visited a floating fisherman's village, each house boat was complete with kids, dogs, chickens, and even a goat ! Dinner at the Jumbo Floating restaurant was well worth while, the carvings on the boat itself are worth the trip. My husband got a suit made at David Chow, in Kowloon, excellent workmanship, he keeps your measurements , so repeats can be ordered. A remarkable 3 days

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ttvn08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights towards the end of November. The standard rooms were clean, modern and small, but every nook and cranny is made to good use. They have 6-9 Macs for free internet use, though they're usually busy or not working most of the time. The best part about this hotel is the location, around 3 min. from the Jordan station and ~ 10 min. walk to Temple St. night market and Jade Market. Many nights we would stop by the night market for dinner followed by a nice stroll back to the hotel, very convenient. It is also walking distance to the Australian Dairy cafe, but I must say, this place is over-rated and the staff rude. On the other hand, the hotel staff was helpful and we had help with our luggage upon check-in and check-out. Reception is on the "first" floor, up the escalators. I didn't see any elevators on the ground floor, but surely there must be ones that bellhops use to help guests with bulky luggage. View from Saigon Street is of run-down housing complexes, gives you a reality jolt especially after walking past the many brand-name stores along the Tsim Sha Tsui area. Overall, this hotel is decent value, not the cheapest in the area, but fair for what you get. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Premier floor! Good value”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMegan
Reviews.Content: Stay is pleasant and extras with room upgrade to premier floor Level 15 good value. View from Saigon Street buildings from room a bit sad, looks down on what looks to be poor housing/apartments - jolts you into reality on how lucky one is to be staying in hotel. Staff pleasant in reception and restaurant. Rooms narrow - found it hard to get to my large Samsonite case every day-does not fit on suitcase designated area, bathroom also narrow. Options exist for upgrade to rooms double the size for more $$$ if you require bigger room. Still, this is a good hotel. This is fab location for shopping, getting to harbor, MTR a few blocks. Taxis close by. Senen/eleven across the street for incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, convenient and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Dickerydock
Reviews.Content: We paid a little extra and after reviews on trip adviser we decided to book, we were not disappointed. Took the airport express to Kowloon station then took the free exec bus which dropped us outside the Eaton Hotel. We then just walked around the corner to Novotel. Great location for temple st market and all other markets. Jordan MTR underground 2 mins walk. Make sure you get an octopus card it can be used on all trains, buses, ferries and even pay for goods. Novotel 15th floor has its own little chill out area with 2 apple computers. Between 6pm and 8pm free drinks and snacks and continental breakfast served. Make sure you look at getting breakfast included as we did its fantastic. There are breakfasts for all nationalities on the reception floor. There is no view from this hotel but the comfort of the hotel more than made up for it. I think you would be hard pushed not to like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “far much better than our previous hotel”
Reviews.Author: dengski68
Reviews.Content: though we got lost(we took busA21) Icould still say we enjoyed our stay in Novotel Nathan Road the rooms were not that small for 3 pax(we booked 3 rms coz we're group of 7)staff very attentive and they even upgrade our room they put us in premier floor without charging a single penny.Location very near to places most tourists would go to.

Reviews.Title: “2011 Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is great. The entrance is on Saigon st., and not Nathan Rd. Very close to MRT stop, bus stop for the ferry terminal and just blocks from the night market. The MRT stop does not have a lift or escalator to the surface and the hotel ice machines stop running AFTER 2200 hrs, I think. I have recommended this hotel to friends planning a trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Normally staying differently in Hong Kong i had to choose the Novotel this time as it was fairly busy time. Was despite the not cheap price very happy with the place as it had very nice rooms and good service and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent location very attentive staff clean rooms nice in house entertainment plenty of machines for internet usage and on the bar also nice in house bar and restaurant excellent food quality with good portion size every thing is very close by seven 11 is opposite to the hotel forex is next door taxis easily available good restaurants near by over all a very good experience i would stay here when ever i visit hong kong next and i would recommend this hotel to thers also

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mollysouthisland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very handy to alot of the tourist sights, the markets were across the road and if you like walking and don't mind being asked if you want a watch to buy on every corner then you can see alot more than going down to the waterfront by taxi. It was very handy having access to the free computers in the hotel lobby and sitting in the bar after a day of walking was a great way to relax. The breakfast at the hotel was good and the staff pleasant. The rooms weren't that big but the facilities were clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: madison88
Reviews.Content: My second stay in this hotel. City bus A21 at airport gets you to the hotel (stop no. 10) at just HKD33. Check-in is efficiently done. I like this hotel because it is clean and gives you the right level of comfort at the end of a long shopping and sightseeing day. And I stayed 5 nights. Plus points? A 7-11 just outside the hotel - I can grab some beers and tidbits to chill out after a long day. There is also a good porridge and noodle shop (彌敦粥麵家 or Nathan Porridge and Noodle House). Just next to the hotel is this unassuming restaurant that offers great Tim Sum too. It caters for wedding dinners and the dim sum was surprisingy good and reasonably priced. We went to Tim Ho Wan restaurant to eat dim sum on our first day and my girls think that the restaurant next to the hotel is better. And I do agree! The Temple Street night market is such a short distance away - you can't go wrong. Just cross the road via the underground tunnel, walk straight and soon you will see the stalls. You can also walk along Nathan Road to Mongkok or walk the opposite way to Tsim Sha Tsui. I could keep writing more about where I can eat or shop around the hotel. While there are lots of hotels around this location, the bottomline is that having stayed at this hotel, I'm happy to continue staying there and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms, abysmal service!”
Reviews.Author: Akaur5
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel along the heart of Nathan Rd was excellent. There is a well-stocked Wing On department store directly across the road, Kowloon's famous Ladies Market is just behind Wing On and the Jordan Rd MTR station is a few lanes away. The hotel is in an amazing location for vegetarian restaurants - Light Vegetarian (excellent Dim Sum and high tea buffet), Three Virtues and Sino Vegetarian Restaurant are only a 5-minute walk away. The rooms are small but well-designed. We had booked 3 Executive Double rooms but regretted that decision as the standard rooms are practically identical to the Exec rooms (save for a bathtub instead of a walk-in shower). The Club Room was tiny and severely under-staffed with only 2 staff members at Happy Hour, running frantically in all directions. The Nespresso machine was a nice touch, but a pity as it was out of water and the accompanying milk jug was empty both times we visited! We opted to have breakfast downstairs or at the nearby vegetarian restaurants to avoid the Club Room chaos! We were disappointed with the rude and impatient staff members that we encountered at the Club floor and the general reception. They were inflexible, curt and generally lacking in manners. For Accor staff to be so poorly trained in customer service is a let-down indeed. If you're not bothered by service, consider staying at the Novotel, if only for its stellar location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the rooms are a bit small, but the location is great. The Night markets are nearby and so are the Ladies markets, also it is just a short Bus ride to the Ferry. l

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased! Excellent location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: ALiEN2108
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Novotel for our short stopover in Hong Kong and I can only say, that was excellent decision! Right up from the check-in (taxi from airport 280HKD) we could feel that this is a good hotel. Not even fully checked in our daughter was already running around with a free toy which she really liked and it was a really nice gesture! We were upgraded to the executive floor for free and the room was very nice and stylish with very nice bathroom featuring spacious shower where our little daughter always had fun :) Complimentary water in room and quality utensils in bathroom! Breakfasts were very nice and featured nice selection of everything with enough space to sit and finally again a hotel where breakfast is served up to 11:00AM (we like to get up late)! Location is excellent, right in the middle of Nathan Road, as you can walk up to many top locations in Hong Kong. Jordan MTR and Night Market are around the corner. A little further and you come to Ladies, Sport, Electronic market...Everything you need on the reach of your feet alone :) We felt very good here and would certainly return to this hotel if returning to Hong Kong. Keep away from all photo stores on Nathan Road! Most scam you with very good price and demand money upfront and then goods will be available in an hour or so (they never are...then they trick you into buying something else....). Also haggle HARD on markets. Don't be insulted by rude sellers, just walk on and find another one....You are paying after all :)

Reviews.Title: “My holiday stay in Hong Kong at Novotel Nathan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall services are good. Suggestion for buffet breakfast: The food varieties should change on a daily basis. Although there are many varieties but it's almost the same menus. The staffs at front desk are very helpful and so as the staffs at the concierge, they are very eager to assist the guests.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service is mixed at best”
Reviews.Author: A_OKD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 2 occasions for business during November 2011. The hotel is located 2 blocks away from the Jordan subway station (exit B2) and this represents about a 7 minute walk. If you plan on taking the Airport Express train and then the MTR (subway) to get to this location then please be advised that there are no escalators as you are exiting the station to get to street level; you will have to climb two flights of stairs with your luggage. The hotel is popular with tourists and business people from around the world and with families. Both the rooms that I stayed at are small, with my room the second time around being smaller than the first, which I did not think was possible. There is one restaurant at the hotel and one bar that serves light meals. I ate breakfast at the restaurant and they offer only a buffet. Note that the menu of the buffet is that same everyday. It does not change....ever. The food at this restaurant is very average at best and the service is also average at best. The one area where his hotel needs to do a better job is training their staff to deliver world-class customer service. The staff tries hard but fail more often than not. The staff is young and unlike other hotels that I have stayed at the presence of management on the floor is non-existent. A few things caught my eye in terms of failure to deliver world-class customer service. After my first stay I had requested a quieter room for my next stay, which was only a day after I had first checked-out. The room I receive ended facing Nathan Road which made the room very noisy and I was also give a room that was smaller than my first room. Another time, I had arrived at 2:31pm for lunch and was told that I had missed the lunch specials by 1 minute and they couldn't offer this to me. Not big issues but I know that other hotels would have accommodated me on these two occasions. Overall, an average experience. The Eaton Smart hotel is one block away and for my next visit to Hong Kong I will stay there as I believe the service is much better there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Good value””
Reviews.Author: soilrich
Reviews.Content: Location Right in the heart of Jordan in Kowloon on Nathan Road ,Nathan Road is a main thoroughfare with buses and MTR and lots of shops The location of the hotel is very convenient. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Mc Donald's and 7 eleven and money Exchange are just right down of hotel and across of nearest road, My only complain is that the rooms are too small. Me and my Family we stay 5 nights using two , Interconnecting room. we have a lovely time at this hotel special at breakfast restaurant they have nice staff and delicious food special the fresh coffee at the side of restaurant. I love Hong kong and absolute i will back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel exercised drastic cost-cutting from the moment we checked in.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel used to provide free WIFI in the lobby but not anymore. The hotel did not provide toothbrush nor toothpaste. Even the bedroom slippers were of such poor quality that they were torn after just a few minutes of wearing. It is more like a backpackers' choice of hotel but not at that sort of rate. It'll no longer be my choice of hotel in Hong Kong for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is Great”
Reviews.Author: OneCageyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 ngihts in October on a group tour. The location is excellent, with easy access to public transportation. I now know that I can hop on the #2, 6 or 9 bus and get to the Star Ferry in very short order, and on the cheap! There are all kinds of shopping (Temple Street Night Market), restaurants, shopping, etc all along Nathan Road, and easily accessed from this place, but be prepared for heavy traffic and lots of people! The rooms we had were small but clean, and a little overdone on the 'modern' side. All the lights in the room were controlled from one panel that was not easily accessible if you were not sleeping right next to it. The hotel staff was very responsive. On first arrival, our room was set up not as a double for two roommates, but was made up as a king. The staff already had housekeeping changing the layout for us by the time we went back upstairs after our complaint at the desk, and threw in free drink vouchers to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mhltan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to all that Hong Kong has to offer. The rooms are clean, functional and well kept. The staff is generally friendly. I had a room that was next to a family, so I was able to hear everything that came from the neighbor's room. The front desk was really great and accommodating to place me in another room on the same floor. Across from the front desk, there are apple computers to browse on the internet. For a short stay in Hong Kong, I can highly recommend this hotel to both families and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Novotel service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to HKG due to work and I stay in this Hotel most of the time. The Hotel is in a great location both for leisure or business trips. This time we were here for a few days of leisure and relaxation. The staff was overwhelmingly friendly; they always are in this hotel. However I find it many times overpriced even in HKG standards. The rooms, the amenities and the breakfast are typical Novotel standards. The staff: In every case every member of the staff was super helpful, no matter what I asked for or needed to arrange a lift to the airport or whatever, I can only praise the nice people working this Hotel. The rooms: they are clean, and well serviced. They are not small with Hong Kong standards. Breakfast: It is rich with both oriental and intercontinental offerings; however after staying here so many times (and even more at other Novotel hotels) it is getting a little bit boring. It would be nice if they would be changing the menu more often. Location: It is just at Jordan metro station and right at the opposite side of the street you can go to see Temple street, the night market or the jade market. The surrounding area feels and looks safe even when returning after a late night out in the city :)

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: AudreyCML
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I am writing a hotel review and I am writing it while still staying at the hotel! Why? Because I am extremely happy with the whole experience so far. We arrived later than expected as my niece was sick and we went to the airport medical centre (it's in Arrival Hall A) then took the A21 bus here. The ride here was very nice - seeing night lights and enjoyed the very comfy seats with much more legroom than the plane! The bus stop was very near the Nathan Road-Saigon Street junction (the entrance to Novotel is on Saigon street even though the address is nathan road) so it was just a 1 minute walk to the hotel. We had 2 strollers, 4 kids and 6 bags and managed quite easily even though there was only 6 adults. (But take note to get off the bus quick as the bus actually moved on before all of us got off as it was crowded and we had many bags and strollers to get of the bus. Managed to shout out to the driver and he stopped the bus a few meters down the road) When entering the hotel, the hotel staff very quickly got us to leave our bags with him, gave me a slip and asked me to proceed 1 floor up to check in. Check in was very smooth and even met the Assistant Manager Derek Lim who made the children very happy with little gifts. Thanks! In my earlier email correspondences with him, he was kind enough to arrange a complimentary cake for my mother as it was her birthday on the day that we checked in. My mother was very touched with this surprise. Another big thank you Derek and Andy! (Andy is in Reservations and it was a pleasure corresponding with him via email. I had tons of questions and he answered them all very promptly in a very nice way.) When we got our keys and went up, the bellboy was already in the corridor with our luggage! First time for me that my luggage actually arrived before me :) We had requested rollaway beds and it was all nicely arranged in our rooms. Even our request to have the rooms on the same floor was fulfilled and exceeded my expectation as we had 3 rooms in a row! Yes, the room is compact when compared to most hotel rooms in other countries for the amount of money paid BUT it is very spacious if you compare it to hotels in Hong Kong. Just need to adjust your expectations accordingly as space is a premium here so don't expect to get the same size hotel room as you would in Malaysia, Singapore etc unless of course you are willing to pay much more for the top of the line hotels. For us, we needed a comfortable hotel with a guaranteed king size bed in a mid range price level, with local food nearby. We got this here and look forward to a fun family holiday over the next few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good location good experience”
Reviews.Author: Golfnut3977
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and were pleased with the location, service and breakfast buffet. We upgraded to the premium floor and were pleasantly surprised by the extras provided. The rooms are quite small and as we had 2 sets of golf clubs and two fairly large cases the space in the room was limited. The rooms were very clean and the service again excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Gl0bal_yatri
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in Novotel, kowloon from 28th Jan, 2011 to 5th Feb, 2011 and had a great experience. The staff is excellent and the hospitality is par excellence. The location of the hotel is really great. Right on the edge of Nathan road. Just 5 min. walk from the nearest MTR. The hotel provides free net surfing which is awesome considering that we wanted to do some online research about places around hong kong. Over all the hotel is excellent and i will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an interesting location”
Reviews.Author: Gunya
Reviews.Content: Like most HKG hotels that aren't priced into the stratosphere this has small-ish rooms, but is well-priced by local standards. It's quite close to Jordan MTR station, about 5 minutes walk along Nathan Rd. You can get there from the airport via the Airport Express and then a free shuttle bus to Jordan MTR. The Nathan Rd shops and more interesting back lanes full of locals (on the opposite side of Nathan Rd from the Novotel) are worth exploring. Had the buffet lunch after I noticed lots of locals coming in to have it and didn't regret it at all. Great range of Asian tastes from $HK150. The fitness centre is a little above average, though as is often the case in land=poor HKG there is no swimming pool. I'd be happy to stay here again, though.

Reviews.Title: “review of the property”
Reviews.Author: b0ycee
Reviews.Content: just come back from Hong Kong and stayed at this hotel. What a great location been in Nathan Road ,close to the Metro system , Temple Street Market, Ladies Market and great food outlets. yes rooms were small but not as small as over hotels in the area. Hotel staff were great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Kowloon R Us :)”
Reviews.Author: Zangtoi
Reviews.Content: Looking out of my room window, I ask myself what in hell possessed me to move from my 5 star hotel room on HK Island to the middle of Kowloon. In the heart of Nathan Road, you're surrounded by old shop lots and buildings with Hongkongites going about their daily bustle. I shut the shades and they remain shut for the duration of my stay. It's a tiny room but very clean and very comfortable. I decide to go out. Walking unto the street, memories of the HK city I'm used to fade away into a different reality. I step out walking past dimsum shops, char chan tengs, roasted meats. About 10 mins later, as I walk past the Jordan MTR making my way to temple street market, the neighborhood has sucked me in. In some bizarre way - I feel like I've been here all my life and the Novotel, my home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a regular customers to this hotel and I love it. The things I confuse is the rate stated in the website and the amount I paid. Maybe they need to upgrade their pricing system. hotel location is very close to MTR station only 5 minutes walk.. easy to find restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: During our stay we found that the location of the hotel was good but for the amount of money paid to them, the room could be better in terms of space and amenities. We found the room was too small as compared to other Novotel hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: scubadave1
Reviews.Content: Stayed on holiday in the hotel. On check inn they asked us to upgrade to a premier room for 400 HKD. We found this fair and upgraded. Lounge is small but very nice.Theu give tea , coffee and soft drinks all day and from 1500 until 1700 they serve sandwiches en cakes. Pre dinner drinks is from 1800 until 2000 . Nice . The room was very beautiful and quit. Breakfast buffet was also very good. After check out we got out to the left of the hotel and walked to Jordan MRT station. it is a small 5 minutes walk. Took the MRT for 8. 5 HKD to central and checked inn for our flight and got on the airport express. Tip : if you travel with 2 persons you are a group and the ticket is 160 HKD for 2 . You must buy it at the information center not at the ticket terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good and clean hotel, even though the room quite small, 3 blocks away from the mtr (train station) about 7 mins walk, quite convenient and close to shopping malls and other places. For the price, it is worth to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “'Workation' (if only such a word exists)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip in Hong Kong was for both holiday and work, but slightly more inclined to the former. On top of the many shops and eateries around the hotel, we were rather happy with the hotel's location and accessibility to the various modes of transportation around the city or island; drop-off point for the A21 airport shuttle bus along the main road just a few feet from the hotel, minutes walk to the Jordan MTR, taxis available outside the hotel, and walking distance to pick-up points for shuttle buses to places like Sai Kung. The only drawback from the whole experience was the breakfast issue that did not come with our rooms When we did the hotel bookings, it was stated 'city breaks' on the website, but at the confirmation stages it appeared that breakfast was not included, so we called a representative and was advised that as long as 'city breaks' was indicated, breakfast will be included. Anyway, despite any misunderstandings, no one will go hungry with all the eating places in the vicinity of the hotel; right after we got our rooms, we had roast pork with the crackling!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to HK with the parents and 2 young kids. Hotel was clean and the location at Nathan road was near many local shops, night markets, and good food places. Will stay at the Novotel Kowloon again when we visit HK again!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is nice, modern and clean, spacious enough also, equipped with one sofa. have complimentary bottled water. the concierge staff is very helpful, the location is not to near with the jordan mtr station, should walk a couple block to get the hotel. breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reception”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I checked out, I fully explained how I use hotel vouchers. But when I left hotel, your reception staff told me, I have not yet paid though I already handed over all hotel voucher. It surprised me a lot, and I never stay your hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap modern luxury - a winner”
Reviews.Author: Melb2day
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the gaudy chinese style reception. The rooms are elegant, modern, clean and incredibly good value. The bathroom was clean and had a really nice shower. The air-conditioning and linen was nice too. Service was reliably good and the laundry reasonably priced. I had my nails done at the spa - the girls were friendly but didn't do a great job, but the massage was fine. I would stay here again for an affordable but really nice option if staying in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly "huge" room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For hotel in Hong Kong, this hotel has quick comfortable room size which is similar to any other hotel elsewhere. Location is so so. Jordan MTR is like 5-10 min walk with 1 stop to infamous TST area. Many nearby eating and shopping shops. Starbucks around the corner. There is 7eleven just across the hotel. But I still prefer to be in TST or Mongkok. The only issue I had is that as a Accor Gold I have asked if I can do a late check out which has been responded by the checkin staff that "only til 3pm", which is good enough for me. Apparently, the next day when I realize that my keycard can no longer be used, I realized that my request for late check out is not even been noted down! They provide free use of Mac Computer in lobby. Overall, not a bad choice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: AhKing
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near to Jordan MRT station. Just a 5-minutes walk to many convenience stores and cafeterias. There's a shopping mall 'Wing On' opposite the hotel. The room is clean and tidy. Hmm, rather small but acceptable for short stay. There is free wi-fi at the lobby. The food and service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Mum & I”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location for night markets shopping & local restaurants. Friendly, helpful staff , clean rooms which are quiet & very good food served within the hotel. Well served by underground & bus transport.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to pay for upgrade when checking in and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pegs80
Reviews.Content: When checking in we asked to upgrade our room. For a small cost we were then upgraded to the Premier Package. This included a high quality Buffet Breakfast, afternoon tea (including sweets and cold drinks) from 3ish to 5ish, then free make your own cocktails and nibbles from 6-8pm. The rooms were modern and clean. The hotel is located a bit of a walk north down Nathan Road but using their amazingly efficient MTR we caught a train from Jordan station (a 3 min walk) to anywhere in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but rude street vendors!”
Reviews.Author: rivergirl192
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel's great location, pleasant staff and wonderful breakfast. Also liked the climate control and lighting adjustments on the nightstand...just couldn't find the right button in the dark. Be cautious when taking pictures in Hong Kong though. Had 2 incidents...one where a clerk held her hand in front of my camera in a hat shop; and one on Nathan Rd. (and Jordan?) where an older lady hit my arm really hard knocking my camera out of my hand! (I'd taken a picture of someone cooking pecans, and she was helping her). Who knew a Chinese vendor would mind a photo! You'd would think they'd be used to it. Really put a damper on my Hong Kong experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything right except internet.....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good located, nice staff, value rooms. The only problem is they don´t have wifi available on the rooms and just wired... is Hong Kong ans should be a nice wifi instead of old wired system.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located near Nathan Road and Jordan Road MTR Station. The Rooms are very clean, well appointed with good quality fittings and furnishings, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant and bar serve high quality food and drinks at reasonable prices. The hotel offers free use of the internet in its upstairs lobby and bar. The only fault we had with this hotel is street noise when we were in a suite overlooking Nathan Road, the other rooms do not have this issue. Importantly this hotel has large bathrooms and high water pressure for a good shower after the humidity of walking aroung HK. This hotel is only HK$35 taxi ride from Kowloon airport express station, were you can check your bags in for your flight before you get to the airport which is an awesome arrangement and very quick. There are good authentic Chinese Resturants across the road next too the seven eleven, do nt worry about the decor of these resturants the food is high quality and very well priced and the locals do eat here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in the heart of Kowloon, within walking distance to get to great shopping and sightseeing activities. The hotel service was very good with staff being very professional and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and clean. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: as usual Novotel Nathan rd was a good choice for business in HongKong as the location is near MTR, Airport transfers, Mainland rail stations and Star ferries. Convenient restaurants and shopping virtually at the doorstep. 15 minutes to HK island by MTR for convention center activities. The business floors offer a better level of room and extra services which are well worth the higher room charge

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Piglethead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in Sept on our way home from 5 weeks away in Europe. The room was a good size and very clean. We werent worried about a view and lucky we werent as we looked down on some pretty disgusting messy roof terraces, but we found it very funny rather than upsetting. The lifts were plentiful and quick. The staff were all extremely pleasant but oh so efficient. We booked a little minibus tour at the tour desk to get an overview of Hong Kong which took us to the Peak and on a Sampan. This was an excellent tour, except probably the visit to the jewellery factory wasnt quite so interesting. The staff in the restaurant were always welcoming and even knew us by our room number after a couple of days. Amazing considering the restaurant was packed for lunch and dinner always. Beware, book early or you might miss out and be told its full. The one day it was we just went back around 8pm and it had cleared out by then so we still got a table. The only very small thing we could fault was that we decided to get room service breakfast on the last day and everything we received was incorrect. I phoned to get it replaced, and they very promptly came back, but alas, still got a couple of things wrong. I think it was a language problem with the lady answering the room service phone. This hotel is excellent value for money in a good location an easy (but hot) walk to Jordan station.

Reviews.Title: “A solid, well-located option”
Reviews.Author: dr_iggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice, right in the heart of things just off Nathan Road, and close to Jordan station. The rooms may be a little on the small and dark side, but this would only be a problem if you were to spend all day in them. The public spaces are pleasant, and there is a small but excellent bar off the first floor lobby. I found all the staff I came in contact with to be most friendly and attentive. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: travelbean88
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for the location, between 2 MTR station and close to street market. The hotel and room are very modernly designed. A good value for money compared to other hotel within the area. Service was great. For some reason our request for non smoking hotel was not relayed to the hotel and they ran out of non smoking rooms. However they finally found a non smoking room for disabled, meaning there will be safety rail in bathroom and no cupboard space as to allow wheelchair access. We took the room and it was really comfortable. Check in and out was a breeze. Definitely worth coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly efficient service and clean modern rooms. Quite well located with easy walking distance to Kowloon shopping centres and subway. The view from the room was a bit dreary but the lack of free wifi my only real complaint.

Reviews.Title: “HKG visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centerally located and walking distance to all major sites and shops ( as well as Jordon MTR) you want to visit. We got the Octopus card and got off at Kowloon St and took a taxi to the hotel. The executive room was small but had everything we needed. Its worth paying extra for the free afternoon tea and the evening happy hour drinks although snacks are okish ( wish they filled samosas with some decent fillings). Met lots of Aussies at tea and happy hour although some of them can be irritating holding their meetings when you just want to have a quiet drink and not to hear them( business women showing off) patronising the locals. Great staff, very friendly and always willing to help. We had a problem on our last day when what seemed like a shower pump failure and woke us up in the early hours of the morning. I was quite impressed with the response and they had the right staff looking into it...not so easy as it was rather intermittent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel n”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great area, around the corner from Nathan Rd. We chose the executive package, with some good extras added in. Christina on Reception was a delight. We would stay again Wendy, Halls Head WA

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. quality is very normal.”
Reviews.Author: buro112
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to walk many area on Nathan Road. nearest station is Jordan (佐敦), you can easy to get airport shuttle bus from Kowloon station. Room is very standard in Hong Kong (actually small) I saw young tourist on premier room floor on 15F, they lied down on isle to connect power socket and free riding the Wi-Fi wave from the premier lounge..

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. It is on Nathan Road and a couple of blocks away from Jordan Station. Check-in was swift and the staff are pleasant here. The superior room I stayed in had a king sized bed with a firm mattress. The bathroom had only a shower and is quite compact however the room is above average for Hong Kong standards. Bit of a squeeze in the room but they cram a lot in. The door to the bathroom doubles up as a door to the wardrobe with safe. There is a master panel to control lights, tv, air con, and clock. Overall a good hotel to explore Hong Kong from and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our first family trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Novotel Kowloon, the location is centralised and easy to get around. We stayed at the Premier floor so the room is bigger and I have requested for an extra bed which fits into the room. The room is pleasant for family. But the service and food in the restaurant is average. If I am back to Hong Kong, I would like to try out the Novotel Citygate instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 22Gus
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location, staff very attentive. Nice room, loved the controls next to the bed that controlled everything - lights, alarm clock, 'do not disturb' etc.

Reviews.Title: “nice and close”
Reviews.Author: taj67
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Honk Kong for a 2 night stay prior to leaving on a 10 night asia cruise. The taxi ride from the airport to Nathan Rd was cheaper than we were expecting (only $272 HKD) Very clean taxis but they couldn't fit more than one case in the boot of car so we were petrified our 3 suitcases would bounce out! Didn't happen and all went without incident. The Novotel is right on Nathan Rd intersection and its close to just about everything. Our room wasn't ready but we did arrive 5 hours earlier than we were supposed to and to the Novotel's credit, they went out of their way to get us into our room quicker as we had been flying all night from Melbourne. They upgraded us with ease (at our request) and were very efficient. We decided to upgrade to the premier package which gives you access to the premier lounge and it is well worth the extra $50 AUD per person for 2 nights. You have access to a free buffet breakfast, free afternoon tea and free evening cocktails and canapes. Free internet access is included and they just make you feel a bit special........See our previous review with South Wharf Hilton (similar set up) Really nice rooms considering Hong Kong crams in their apartments and buildings and they cater very nicely for the little touches. Cable TV included and big king size bed. You can open the windows if you are in a smoking room (yes smoking rooms exist here) and the bathroom, although small, very nice and everything is clean and catered for!! Complimentary robes and slippers, in room safe, iron and board, mini bar, small fridge, universal adaptors in room (and available for sale at a cheap price of 10 AUD and the premier lounge always a winner with Aussies (everything is free that's why:)) Value for money is not bad considering the price for most things in Hong Kong is reasonably cheap so overall, I thought value for money was worth the upgrade and worth the stay. The staff are very friendly and will help you out with touristy stuff, tours, free advice, personal favorites of restaurants and just very friendly! Kong Kong itself is amazing and I could spend 2 weeks here just touring around seeing what is going on - amazing scenery and landscape - high rise buildings everywhere and really cheap deals on the street for clothing , jewelry etc.... Novotel full of Aussies, Kiwis, Germans and Pakistanis but they all speak english if you need that for directions etc.... A great stop over hotel or a long termer hotel - either way, you can't go wrong. well worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: 2Pickie
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel after 2pm and our rooms were not available yet. Was told that it would be ready at 6pm but they will try and give us 1 room by 4pm. Receptionist gave us coupons for complimentary drinks at the bar to make up for the inconvenience caused. We used the free internet in the lobby while waiting. We asked for quiet rooms on a higher level and although our room faced Nathan room the traffic noise was not bad. The rooms are tiny but very well designed with good size bathroom. Hotel is in a great location. MTR station and restaurants are close by. I would recommend this hotel for people who want to do shopping and explore Kowloon, HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Food buffet great value, room v ery spacious and quiet even though it was overlooking the street, service from the moment we got there we were looked after with luggage and tours etc entertainment singer dedicated a special song to us which was really sweet, all made this a very enjoyable stay for us, thank you Can get to the hotel by shuttle or taxi for almost the same price but the taxi is quicker..

Reviews.Title: “novotel kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent a week end in Hong Kong and went to Novotel Kowloon. Rooms are very clean, well decorated and equipped. The hotel is quiet eventhough on a big avenue. The location is great, very close to subway train Jordan station and a walk away from Temple street and its night market. Trying to find one negative point... The in-room internet is through cable and not wi-fi. It is really not a big deal, speed is really good, however with smartphones nowadays wi-fi is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied stay at Novotel Nathan road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had an early flight and was able to reach hotel at around 8:30 am, although regular check-in time is at 2 pm. The lovely lady at check-in counter inform us that our room is ready. This nice gesture allowed me to catch some sleep before heading to my lunch meeting with a client. Location is near MTR station, which make it real easy to travel around. A lot of restaurants in the vicinity. Wish i had more time to spend in this wonderful hotel. Maybe on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Modern styling, food not great”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a premier room on floor 14 which was nicely styled. Indeed the whole hotel has a very modern styling and looks like it was only done very recently. The premier lounge is small but cosy, the food choices were very limited though - only 4 items to chose from during afternoon and cocktails, and the quality of the food was poor. Free wireless Internet in lounge and room (my rate also had wired Internet for free, so hooking up my airport extreme to create my own wireless worked much better than hotel wifi). Breakfast choices were quite limited, food seemed bland. Location a couple of mins walk from MTR and temple street night Market, and much less busy on footpath than compared to lower Nathan Road which was nice, no tailor touts! Very short journey into central - 15/20 mins from leaving hotel to reaching Central. Tip: airport express bus goes to the Eaton hotel which is just 2 streets away and a 3 minute walk, but the bus took 45 minutes from Kowloon station, whereas a taxi will take 5-10 mins and cost only HKD30 - take a taxi! Overall, a nice stay in a very modern clean hotel, close to MTR. If I stay again, I won't bother with the premier floor, and make use of their 2 for 1 happy hour drinks in the bar instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK...”
Reviews.Author: zenno
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during September and I think this hotel is over-rated. It's off Nathan Rd and not actually on Nathan but Saigon St. It is not THAT close to the MTR - if you have to walk everyday to and from for 3 whole weeks. Only close to Temple St market and nothing else that is interesting.. 15-20 minutes walk to the Ladies Market. Staff is not that friendly, service is also not great either - when we checked out with 2 suitcases, 2 travelers bag and other bags to hold, they did not offer to help or what so ever, we would've appreciate it if they at least offered. Not to mention that the concierge is on level 1 with no elevator, just escalator. We had to drag it down ourselves! As for the room - Room is nice and modern, a little small. Air con is too loud, wall is too thin with no soundproof - we can hear people's footsteps from the room upstairs and people talking/arguing. Don't expect any view as all you will see is old buildings surrounding you. The gym looks new and clean, it's 24/7 so it's pretty good for people who doesn't have the time to workout during the day. Will I stay here again? NO. I would rather pay more money to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Avoidable!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately given our high expectations from Accor Hotels and the official internet site promising a fantastic location and excellent rooms we got taken into making a reservation at the Novotel Hotel in Kowloon, HK. The hotel & surroundings and facilities look nothing like the pictures on the website and moreover the rooms are cramped and far too small. The worst part is the view from the room windows which look out into old dilapidated buildings a few metres away making it quite undesirable to open the curtains! The service is very ordinary. The concierge desk was not functioning after midnight when we arrived, and had to unfortunately carry up our bags and children to the lobby situated a level above the ground floor. On the whole given the budget involved one can easily get a better hotel anywhere in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Premier Floor!”
Reviews.Author: EH78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and upgraded to the Premier floor on recommendation from tripadvisor reviews - it was well worth it! Whilst we weren't in the hotel much in the afternoons or early evenings, a few times we did make use of the free afternoon tea and evening drinks & canapes. It is not an overly big room, but if you're staying on the 15th floor you can grab a beer, wine or softdrink and head back to your room. Also the 2 computers with free wi-fi was great and they were always free if we needed to use them. The concierge staff on the floor also provided outstanding service. Location wise, the hotel was quite good. It was further from the Harbour than we thought, so was a bit too far to walk with the kids, but the MTR is so easy for tourists to use so in that respect the location was good as close to the Jordan MTR station. One last tip that I also picked up from TA reviews. If you are looking for good dim sum then do yourself a favour and go to Din Tai Fung, it is on Canton Road across from the Harbour Shopping Centre in a building called Silver Cord - it was simply fantastic and even both kids loved it, so much so that we headed back the next night. The concierge will be able to show you on a map.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for exploring Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JARMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here. The hotel can be a little hard to find, its entrance is off the sidestreet. We caught the Airport Express train into Kowloon, then the shuttle bus drops you off at Eaton Hotel, maybe a 60 metre walk north to the Novotel. There is a 7-11 store right across the street which is handy. You can go down the side street towards Nathan Rd, go under Nathan Road using the subway. walk 2 blocks (maybe 50 metres) and you are in the middle of the night market. Down the first street are lots of really good restauarants. You can catch the bus down Nathan Rd to the Star Ferry Terminal. Buy an Octopus card, makes life so much easier. The MRT station is a 5 minute walk north, we easily found our way to Disneyland on the MRT, maybe a 30 minute trip. The rooms and beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Rd Kowloon Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SusanP32
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel near Jordan MTR station and handy to Temple St night markets. It is worth paying extra for the executive floor to access internet and for breakfast, coffee and happy hour drinks, as well as quick check-in/out. We had an interconnecting room which should be booked ahead as they don't have many. The staff were always helpful; we used their travel service to plan a day trip to Guangzhou which went very well. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport-just take the airport-link train to Kowloon and then the K1 connecting bus to the Eaton Smart hotel and walk down 20metres. The trip is very long going to the hotel and very quick coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business, and ate in the Square restaurant both nights and mornings. This was the only downside to staying there. The staff were aloof, there were many on but not doing anything. Food was poor, I ate off their al a carte menu not their buffet. I travel alot and stay in a lot of Accor properties and was the worst food I've had. On a positive, the hotel is really modern, looks great and one of the best rooms I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very helpful concierge and staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very prompt to reply my email enquiry about the best way to reach the hotel from the airport. Upon this advice, we took the Airportlink - very convenient and arrived at the hotel comfortably. The concierge and reception staff were very helpful and efficient which makes a good start to our holiday. The room was as we expected of Novotel standard - clean with comfortable beds and importantly quiet. Jordon MTR Station is just a walking distance. To our delight, the well-known Nathan Congee & Noodle stall is just opposite the hotel. Taxi is easily available outside the hotel. There is no problem getting around. Would recommend Argle Centre for young people, Ladies Mkt for iphone accessories, soft toys, knick-knacks. The much blogged about Australian Diary Company is also within walking distance. On the whole, our stay in Novotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moosey_goosey
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves a "terrible" rating but the room and location manage to drag it up to "poor". In every other aspect this hotel needs to be avoided. Service is virtually non-existent, the food was often cold, poorly executed or ran out. We stayed on the Premier level which included breakfast but after one attempt decided to eat in the main restaurant which was marginally better. on another night we decided to order nachos at the bar. Whilst I wasn't expecting much, I was expecting more than a bowl of corn chips surrounded by small bowls of salsa, guacamole and sour cream. To top it all, the massage at the spa in the lobby has to rate as one of the worst I've ever had. You're better off going to Taipan foot massage on Nathan Road. Do yourself a favour and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good family deal”
Reviews.Author: famhol4Brisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 18 - 25 September as a family consisting of two teenage daughters 13 & 15. The hotel offered us interconnecting rooms with the second room half price for families which was better than any other hotel could offer. The rooms where spotless and the staff freindly and helpful. The rooms are not huge but we didn't feel cramped at anytime. The only minus was the breakfast, although the children ate free the waffles were floury and they were slow to replenish the food. The hotel is idealy situated near the Temple St Market and access to all other places of interest is a short MRT ride away with Jordan station close by. Get an Octopus card and getting around is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue”
Reviews.Author: 21Summer
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Executive floor which proved to be an excellent choice. Our internet (wired and wireless) was included in the price as was breakfast; we chose to go down the restaurant on floor one every morning. The totals are just taken off the bill at the end. The executive floor lounge was a decent size and the food & drinks selection outstanding: I asked if they had any vegetarian sandwiches and a tray was immediately presented. Lovely little snacks for afternoon tea and cocktail hours, excellent service from the front desk. We were given access to a room for a quick wash in the evening after check out which was very kind. The rooms were more than large enough; the chaise lounge affair by the window was surprisingly comfortable. It is easy to plug in you computer on the spacious desk. The bathroom is well designed though I only had a shower, no bath tub. There is a kettle, cups etc and a small fridge. New arrivals are advised to step over the road to the 7/11 to pick up a few snacks rather than pay for the mini bar. There are two apple macs in the executive lounge and around another four in the bar on the first floor. The bar has a resident singing duo who are good and serves bar snack type meals. The nearest MTR is Jordon. If you like vegetarian food go down the subway underneath Nathan Road: when you come up there is a restaurant on the corner called the Sino-vegetarian restaurant. You will also find another one down nathan road (south facing) turn left on Jordan road and look for a sign that says Light Vegetarian Restaurant. Laundries abound in this location. I used one on the road one block on from the Sino-vegetarian restaurant but i also noticed another one much nearer the hotel: turn left out of the hotel, then right. `You will see Professional Laundry on the corner a couple of blocks on. They all seem to offer about 7 pounds for around 32 HK dollars. If you want a taxi the young men in reception will step out and look for one for you driving past; you can also just walk down to Nathan Road and wave your hand. We didn't use a bus to get from the airport as for two of us the taxi was only 235 HK dollars. An Octopus card is worth getting as it saves you fussing with small change. There is a largish supermarket on Nathan Road called BILT. Look south, cross over the road, cross over the Jordan Road junction. You'll see a sign which points downwards to the super market. You will be offered made to measure suits when you step out but the chaps are very pleasant and will eventually take no for an answer if you don't want to take them up.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Avista_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Hongkong for a few years now and on my last visit stayed at the novotel. It was just perfect for the money they charged. The staff is great and very helpful. Their bar and all day dining was great and the quality of food was nice. Its a very convinient location with lots to do around it in walking distance. Set in between nathan road walking distance to wanchai and harbour centre. Many restaurant options outside the hotel. Though the views can be depressing if you are on a lower floor but thats hongkong for you! Great location otherwise not too far from any place. In particular their croissants were outstanding at their cafe in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: JBasu
Reviews.Content: We took a bus from the airport, which dropped us right in front of the hotel. Many shops of different types right around the hotel! The Jordan MTR station made things far more convenient! The offer free internet on Mac-computers. Food was good, and service was also pretty swift. Rooms were well kept, only the toilet was wet when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: Love the interior design of the hotel Staffs are friendly and the location is great. In the middle of Nathan rd walkin distance to Jordan MTR. During the day, there's lots of local eating places around. Even a wet market selling fresh veg and fruits are about 10 mins walk away. But nothing much in the neighbourhood at night. We shop in HK island till late and and return to hotel at 11pm. Realize there's not much to eat around the area and we travel to mongkok as there's more food option around that area. I stayed and Yau Ma Tei & Mongkok but Nathan is probably more on the quite side during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shriramd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is child friendly, just off Kowloon road, close to many restaurants incl Mcdonalds just a five min walk. The hotel has excellent food. the Room Service is great and the Breakfast Buffet was fantastic and almost like a brunch. We were upgreded with the Accor Gold Status. We got some welcome drinks. The check in was a bit slow, but the rest was great. They have a good airport drop with a very reasonable price. very comfortable if you are traveling in a group or single. Lot of airline crew stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is pretty compact but comfortable with a king size bed. It provides all the usual facilities in the room except you have to pay to use the internet facilities. There are free internet service on the lobby though. Surrounding is convenient with shopping and eateries just outside the hotel. Service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Newbs82
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant stay at the Novotel, Nathan Road. The service is excellent, plenty of choice for breakfast and very clean. There's also plenty of macs with internet access for people staying there to use and printing is free. The only negative thing is that it's a bit far away from the main bits of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Check In”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel in the evening and was in quite of a rush to check in as I had to rush back out for an appointment. I was attended promptly by a front office staff called Mandy (if I remembered her name correctly) and she completed the check in arrangements in less than 10minutes. I was asked if I mind a smoking room, which I did, and a non smoking room was assigned to me without any questions asked or hassle. One negative point, was my non- smoking room smelt like as if the previous guest was actually stealing smokes in the room, due to a lingering smoky smell when I opened the door. Well, at least the sheets were crisp :) Most comfortable set of pillows, all four of them !

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: bleep82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised. It is extremely good value for money. The rooms are clean and the decor was very nice. It is located in an alley and we weren't sure what we were in for walking up to it, but once inside all our concerns disappeared. The travel desk were extremely helpful and arranged 2 tours for us as well as our airport transfer. There is a cosy little bar in the hotel that serves great cocktails. There is also free internet access by the check in desk. The hotel is in a fantastic location with in walking distance to many attractions and just a block from the nearest MTR station. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: KYhorsecapital
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights 3 days at this hotel last week occupying 2 separate rooms for our family. We were very satisfied with our rooms as well as the service and help we got from the hotel staff. It was mentioned in previous reviews that the entrance to the hotel is not easy to find since the main door is on Saigon St. and not Nathan Road but that did not pose as a problem on the day of our arrival. We took the #21 Airport Express round trip w/c was very convenient since the bus stops on Nathan Road and Saigon St. The hotel has 4 computers in the lobby and 3 computers in the restaurant/bar for guests free of charge and we never had to wait longer than 10 minutes every day to be able to use one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish and functional”
Reviews.Author: valintheuae
Reviews.Content: If you are after harbour views, a large room and a top-notch spa, this is not the place for you! But if all you want is a clean and modern room, reasonably priced, within walking distance of the subway, numerous restaurants and shops, open-air markets, the Novotel is a very good choice. It is the perfect hotel for a city break. There is an excursion desk in the lobby and computer stations with free internet :). My room was smallish but very comfortable, with all the amenities, among them an Ipod dock, and surprisingly quiet for such a central location. I missed breakfast every day! There is a small spa in the hotel, it is rather simple and dark. There seems to be few treatment rooms, they are separated by each other by a simple curtain so you can hear everything that is going on next door... There is no sauna, hamman or relaxation room so don't expect any bells and whistles!! I had a 90-minute Chinese acupressure massage which got rid of the knots and tension but was not in the least bit relaxing.... In short, a visit to the spa is not a must... The hotel does not have its own shuttle to the airport but they can book a bus transfer for you, it costs 130 HKG dollars per way. A taxi costs 240 HKG dollars per way.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jumpingJacq
Reviews.Content: I traveled throughout Asia last summer and chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews. it's true, the hotel is in a great location and we walked or took the metro everywhere. The room looks just as they're depicted in the pictures. Keep in mind though that the rooms are quite tiny. We barely had space for our luggage and felt cramped, albeit in a nice contemporary setting. We didn't stay in the rooms much so this wasn't a deal breaker. Quick tip: I left my hotel information at home and just had the name and cross streets that it was on. This created a problem with our taxi driver as he only knew the hotels by their Chinese names. Note to self - have hotel names printed in the local language! If you have time, add a half-day trip to see the world's biggest outdoor Buddha and take the ferry over to Macau. Safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for families, especially those with young kids!! The rooms are comfortable and the inter-connecting rooms are great. We absolutely loved the buffet breakfast each morning. Location wise everything was very accessible. Transport, night markets, shops etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms are nice & comfortable. We had an extra bed in one room, and there was sufficient space to move. The beds are so comfortable that we had a good night's sleep. We especially like the hotel lobby because of the nice smell. 7-11, bus stop and starbucks coffee nearby. abundant shops in Kowloon area. The MTR station is a 5 minute walk, so getting around from the hotel was not a problem for the 7 of us. The concierge n the tour desk lady was especially helpful regarding our enquiries. The front desk provided us street maps the moment we checked in. No room with a view, as our room had a view of the apartment complex next door. But its expected of Hong Kong, so we were not bothered. Just pull down the blinds, we were fine. will definitely stay there again next time in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: barayan
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our stay at the Novotel. Being in Hongkong, location is of much importance and we were within walking distance from shops and restaurants downtown. The place seems to have been upgraded recently and it is quite nice to see that all Accor hotels maintain a degree of consistency and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The key for this hotel is the location, the rooms are small even on the premire floor's but have everything you need, plus the internet in room on the premier floor, and in the lobby and bar for everyone. As with all accor hotel's the staff try to be as good as they can. The food in the coffee shop buffet breakfat lunch & dinner is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you like local shopping (Temple Street & Night Markets)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great location off Nathan Road. It would be even better if they made arrangements with the Hong Kong Airport Shuttle. However, there is a K1 stop around the corner from the hotel. Round-trip from the Hong Kong Airport and using the shuttle service was $24 US Dollars and very easy service to use. When booking the hotel reservation had issues with the Club Break promotion but that was resolved and part of it could have been because I'm an A-Club Platinum member. Room was NYC small and not a great view but didn't spend alot of time in the room. It was a clean room, great shower and very quiet. Staff was helpful when it came to maps of Hong Kong and directions. Had an issue when they wanted me to give them a $30 Hong Kong deposit to use an umbrella but that was quickly resolved. Breakfast buffet was good and alot of choices. The hotel guests come different countries so a very diverse crowd. I would stay at this property again given the location, quiet rooms & efficient manner of the staff in dealing with their guests (customer).

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel for Tourist Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Antonio D
