Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely positioned in the tourist friendly Nathan Road close to major shopping area and within walking distance from MRT station. Rooms are smaller than average in Honk Kong and lack of basic services for business travel although it might be enough for a non-demanding average traveler. Service is in the Hong Kong average, pretty responsive and attentive to customers, restaurants cater a bit of everything although does not excel in anything. Rooms prices on the high side, I think due to the central location in the heart of Kowloon district.

Reviews.Title: “novotel nathan road hotel - good value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel0421
Reviews.Content: over-all we have a wonderful stay at this hotel. the location is fantastic - near jordan station of mtr,near fastfood chains/restaurants, near shopping. good value for money - we stayed for only hk$700/night for two nights and the rooms was so clean! i wil definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends in the philippines. must try!

Reviews.Title: “Happy time in HKG”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was quite ok for me to go out for shopping or easy to find the transportation service. We received a quick service from the front and bell boy even the room that I stayed was not impressed given the smoking smell. However, next time, if I has chance to get there again, I will probably select you as the first priority. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to an Executive Room and was very impressed by the hotel which was fantastic for a stopover. The hotel is well located being near the Jordan MRT Station with plenty of restaurants and shops within the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Brali060310
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice and comfortable but make sure you request a non smoking room if your not a smoker. Staff were good and the breakfast was a good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Can be improved.”
Reviews.Author: sshiyinggg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second time and it was as good as my previous trip. Location is approx 5mins away from Jordan MTR. Hotel is clean and very comfortable, especially the bed. If you are not taking cab that often, I would think its fine, as majority of the cab driver doesnt now where the hotel is. Even when I show them the address, they will still reject the ride and it's troublesome as I got rejections from consecutive 3 cabs. I think the issue lies in the street name. They are located in Saigon Street but address stated Nathan Road which is such a long stretch. Overal a very good stay in there for 3 nights and I would recommend friends to stay in there. One thing which I believe most of the tourists would love is to provide free wifi in the hotel rather than a charge for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Crystal K
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Me and my boyfriend stayed here and it was SOO lovely. The service was great, and you get two free bottles of water every morning and all hotel staff are extremely adept at English. One time we forgot to take off the "do not disturb" sign on our door and so the room service did not call in the morning. And to our surprise in the afternoon about 1 - 2 pm we got a call asking what time would be convenient for them to come. We told them 5 pm and that was no problem. Went out for dinner and it was alll tidy when we came back. They also sell Disney Land tickets and provide very thorough information on times, how to get there etc. at the information booth. If you buy your tickets at the hotel counter (it is the same price as at the door) you get a free HK Disney umbrella! Location is great as well! 1 - 2 minute stop from the MTR and walking distance to the ladies market. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, loved the room.”
Reviews.Author: Ladybird T
Reviews.Content: Novotel in Nathan Road is situated close to many great shops, restaurants, markets and the railway station is only short walk away. Our room was a Deluxe Double Bed, clean, the bed was very comfortable, bathroom was nice and room was large in size. Views were not great but it didn't worry us as we spent most of our days out. The Lobby is large and Internet is free. Staff were very helpful and kind. We would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite in HK, rooms small but has merit for price point”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4C
Reviews.Content: GENERAL OVERVIEW / ROOM SIZE This hotel is very good value for the price point. It is one of the smaller hotel rooms I have ever stayed in (even though we paid for Executive Floor on 14th floor). But realistically, we payed around half/third of the price we normally pay when we stay in HK, so I guess you really do get what you pay for. If you want something bigger, check websites for floor plans or email them and ask. I couldn't find the Novotel's room sizing before we left (probably because it is not a selling/strong point) but would guess it was under 30sqm. If you plan on just visiting your room to shower and sleep and you are on a budget, this room more than fits the bill (ie clean, safe, tastefully furnished, decent amenities in room). If you were like me (on a girl's trip) with a bit of luggage and sharing a twin room with a friend, it would get a bit cramped after 3+ nights. Pick somewhere bigger. Bathroom door shares with the wardrobe (wardrobe shut/bathroom door open and vice versa) which was a bit awkward sometimes, and there was very little hanging space and no drawers. The twin beds were almost touching (a little bit too initimate for friends I thought) so you wouldn't want to choose this room if you did not know your travelling companion well! The room we had did not have a view (perhaps you could ask what the alternates are). We looked out to a pretty old building that looked like it had been fire damaged. I could see water in the distance from the Exec Lounge floor (level 15), so this may be a possibility as there were some rooms on this level. LOCATION and AIRPORT TRANSFERS Location is pretty good if you want to stick to the Kowloon side of the Island - there is food on every corner, 7 eleven on the street, StarBucks less than 50m away etc. If your interests are on the HK Island side, stay closer to the Kowloon waterfront or on HK Island itself (just to save a bit of time on the Metro etc, not because this hotel is particularly far away). Metro is a short walk (and very cheap), and cab rides are inexpensive by Australian standards. GETTING TO/FROM THE AIRPORT Take the Airport MTR to Kowloon (special at time of writing $18AUD for two people), then when you arrive at the Kowloon station walk downstairs to the taxi rank and ask them to drive you to the Novotel which costs approx $4-5AUD plus around 80c per luggage piece. It will take about 14 mins on the MTR and approx 10mins in the cab. This hotel is a fairly close taxi ride to/from the Airport MTR (Kowloon stop) so don't bother with expensive transfers direct from the airport which takes double the time (sometimes more in bad traffic) unless you have small children, heavy luggage (beyond managing on your own) or not very mobile. "Free transfers" offered by other hotels (not sure if they are offered by the Novotel), take 60+ mins as you get driven around hotel to hotel and dropped off when it is your turn. FOOD/BREAKFAST Breakfast was included in our package. If it was not, I would have been heavily disappointed at price/value. It was pretty basic, the juice was warm and a lot of the hot food luke warm/cold. The pastries were stale when we ate (which to be fair was in the last hour of breakfast) Highlights of the breakfast menu would have been the fresh bread (which made excellent toast) and the fact that the Chef happily made me fresh scrambled eggs when I asked (most point to the cold scrambled eggs in the bain marie and basically tell you to go away and will only make omelettes). Service in the actual dining room was quite sparse and meant we were only greeted, presented with the bill for signing and left to our own devices. Plates piled up on most days, but were eventually cleared. STAFF in GENERAL/ CONCIERGE/ CHECK-IN CHECK-OUT Staff in the rest of the hotel were very polite and had no trouble with any requests or questions. They were happy to please and I found them very friendly. Check in/out process was very easy and efficient, so too were the Concierge. INTERNET/WIFI Internet is included on the Executive floor, but you need to bring a laptop. iPad/Wifi use is limited to the lobby and Executive lounge area. There are around 5-6 Macs in the lobby for general use (free) but these are heavily used. There are also 2 Macs on the the Exec floor. WOULD I STAY HERE AGAIN? I'm not sure. I would probably prefer to pay more for a bigger room. If room size is not one of your priorities, and budget is in question - this place is decent value (excl the breakfast) and I would highly recommend it under these circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Clean..convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Blueming
Reviews.Content: Room was good sized by HK standards and beds comfortable. I like the hotel for its location. It is within walking distance to Jordan MTR station and right across from the hotel, you have restaurants, money changer, a 7-11 store and fast food cafes. Didn't spend much time in the hotel as we were out shopping most of the time. So, I haven't got much to say about the pool or F&B outlets. Room was clean and the air-conditioning was a welcome relief from the scorching heat of HK's summer. Bathroom was pristine but towels need to be replaced as some were looking tired. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: 53BLOSSOM
Reviews.Content: You get what you expect from novotel and little bit more. We were offered to upgrade for 440rmb per night for better room, breakfast, afternoon tea and 2 hours free alcohol and snacks in the evening- well worth it. The hotel was clean, modern and centrally located. The staff spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful. I also tried the spa which was nice but nothing special

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cd5collector
Reviews.Content: great hotel We loved the room filled with smart amenities and all the things you need during a short stay in Hong Kong Enjoyed both the bar and restaurant Close to markets and close to MTR will definitety stay here again when we return to HK free internet in the lobby is always nice

Reviews.Title: “As usual - great service and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Sim038
Reviews.Content: We booked the Executive Premier Floor for this visit (as last time it was great!). The Premier room itself (and Receptionist) is on the 15th floor. This time they gave us the 14th floor, which wasn't as close and convenient to just duck down for a coffee or use the internet. So I recommend anyone booking the Premier Floor to ask for the 15th Floor as well. The Room was great and we had a roll away bed for our teenager. The roll-away thin and springy - so not ideal for any length of stay. We alternated using it to save her back. We enjoyed the Afternoon Teas and Happy Hours, even though sometimes there was food we wouldn't eat. The Receptionist on the Premier Floor was usual fantastic and extremely obliging. The breakfasts downstairs were excellent too. The only downfall of this motel is no swimming pool - but I would forego that anyday as you're not in HK to swim.. There is no free wifi in the rooms - no matter what level you are on, The free wi-fi is only on the ground floor and in the dining room - you need to ask for the new code each day. There are four Apples Computers for use on the ground floor and two in the Premier Room - all have free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tattieheid
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here in July, check-in was a bit disappointing, no info was given regarding dining/bars/happy hours/breakfast/free internet .Room was clean, modern and comfortable. We usually enjoyed a couple of drinks in the hotel bar during the happy hour from 6.30/9.30 (I think) , buy 1 get 1 free. Great location, A21 bus stop 10 right outside the hotel makes easy access to and from the airport for 33HKD one way, easy walking distance for MTR Jordan,( take exit ‘B’ at Jordan and turn left walk along Chi Won) , 5 mins to Temple St, 15 mins to Lady’s Market, 20/25 mins to Star ferry. If you walk down Nathan Road which we did frequently, you have to put up with constantly being asked if you want a suit, shirt, tie, rolex, come into my shop,etc

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL NATHAN ROAD KOWLOON”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is fantastic. It's so close to restaurants, shopping and the Jordan MTR station. Temple Street is just across the road and the area is still abuzz past 12am. Rooms are great (but could be larger) and the staff extremely helpful and courteous. Downside is the absence of a swimming pool and insufficient wardrobe space. Other than that, I'll keep staying here everytime I visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “At the doorstep of convenience”
Reviews.Author: pongster
Reviews.Content: Novotel Nathan is all about conveniences. 7-11 is diagonally across, rows of eateries right at the back, stone's throw away from Jordan MTR and next to the bus stop where you can A21 right straight to/from airport (at a fraction of the cost!). There are 6 Mac terminals for guests to use all day long, and restaurant serves a good selection during lunch. I particularly like: the 24-hour gym dessert shop across the road (go by the underground link) its proximity to old school diners like Australian Dairy Company and Yee Shun Milk Company reasonable room size great service What I thought would be good was to have free wifi for all guests as the terminals are always occupied during the day (which is when you need it most!) Overall, an enjoyable and pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised”
Reviews.Author: PaulW42
Reviews.Content: Having decided very late to visit HK, our normal venue of the Marco Polo or Sheraton were off the price richter-scales by then, and so we chose a Club room at the Nathan Road Novotel, up near Yau Mei Tei. Very surprised to be shown into an unltra modern furnished room with flat screen tv and fabulous bathroom! Very impressed! The club room was a little small, but perfectly adequate and the quality of drinks and food offered was impressive. Will definitely return in September when we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Pebs123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a premier room that comes with breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktail served at the premier lounge but the food served is the same everyday with just less than 5 items. It can be boring if you stay more than 2 nights. Do note there is not even a small washroom available so if you need to wash your hands or urinate you need to go back to your room. The buffet breakfast down at the cafe is just as poor same everyday too. The only consolation is the room which is of decent size, well maintained and clean with the exception of the bathroom which is very small and narrow. Only one person at a time is able to enter. I can't say for the other room types as I have not seen it. Also noise from outside the corridor and tap running, hair dryer blowing next door can be heard clearly so sound proofing is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: opergvh
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms (and I have seen a lot); not very big, but functionaly designed and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ding88
Reviews.Content: Novotel Nathan Road is conveniently located close to the Airport Express bus stop and the MTR. It was recently renovated, so our room was stylish and clean, and for a Hong Kong hotel room, it was well sized. However, the view from the room was not the most scenic; a residential high rise across the street was covered in laundry and antenna wire. And I resented not having free WiFi; the public internet access terminals in the lobby were always occupied. A good place to stay, but not exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an excellent location in Hong Kong. Everything is very convenient. Being a gold accor club member my room was upgraded, and it was quite spacious for a Hong Kong hotel room. The room was lovely and quiet. It was very clean and the hotel has made efforts to make their tap water of drinking quality. The beds are quite hard but that seems to be usual for Hong Kong, and I still found them comfortable and got a good night's rest. The only problem I have was with the toilet paper - it was very rough and scratchy! The reception and concierge staff were all very friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel has around 9 computers in the lobby with internet access to use for free for guests. There is wired connection available in the room but for a fee. As for the hotel in general, the one down side of the hotel is it does lack the views of some other Hong Kong hotels. However I think the value for money, convenient location and excellent hotel standard are worthy trade-offs. Overall it was an excellent hotel to stay at and I would easily recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “welcome scent at novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: that distinctive scent in the novotel hk concierge area that greet you on arrival is so invigorating especially after a day's walk in the very hot, very humid climate of hk this time of the year. the room and bathroom is very well renovated and the nice warm showers always felt wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and realy conciliants”
Reviews.Author: cportal
Reviews.Content: Novotel Nathan Road has been attentive of the needs of my daughter that was in Hong Kong in transit after being stolen in Mongolia. They have been attentive and helpful in allowing me to pay through my US credit card in advance. Bravo This is not common indeed and need to be noted.

Reviews.Title: “very poor airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: last year i stayed on this hotel (august) it's very clean and the aircon in the room,hallway is very goood. i am sad to say that it's not that clean anymore and the aircon in the room is very bad (room 1217),and it's only been one year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excelent value for money. Only slight negative it is a little away from the bars & restaurants of lower Natham Rd. Taxis are plentiful & if you like to walk as I do, it is about 25 mins to Knutsford Ter & other nitelife areas in Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: gussiegeelong
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 5 nights in July. The room was a decent size by HK standards. The hotel supplied a power adaptor and ipod station. We were able to open two windows which is fabulous if you are a smoker to help air the room. The bed was king size and comfortable with even better pillows. The bathroom was clean and a good size for 2 people. Free internet in the bar and lobby - can either use one of seven Mac computers or use your own wireless device. Located across the road was a good size 7/11 shop and just around the corner a professional dry cleaner/laundry which was cheap and very professional. The Jordan station MTR is just a short walk around the corner - easy walking distance to golden mile shopping and temple street market less than 5 minute walk. We caught the airport express train then got on the K1 bus which dropped us off out the front of the Eaton Hotel which was then a 2 minute walk to our hotel - very easy even though we had heaps of luggage. Check in and check out efficient and the porters weighed our bags for us before leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and location. Price remains high compared to similar standards and comfort. As an Accor Club member, I always expect something special (upgrades, free breakfast, Internet...) but it rarely happens with Novotel in Hong Kong. Nevertheless, a good service and very customer oriented and nice staff. No regrets and no surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the hotel which sit in the mid of shopping area. The access to public transportation is easy. The staffs took good care. Asian breakfast is not variety but it is OK for full american breakfast. The room was cleaned except some point which we found afterward such as towel and blanket got dirty spots on them.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location is good....however, couldnt find any good food there....the room is very clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the team at Novotel Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed ther twice in 2 weeks and the first time accidently left business documents in my room. the staff did a great job of sending them to me in China. Fantastic !! good work. would definatly stay there again and will be in about a months time. the food in the 15th floor is great however the restaurant down stairs only caters for 1 market (not me) . the massage place is ok but could do with fresh happy people to support it. apart from that its all good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Concierge service need to be better”
Reviews.Author: Haazeel
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in this hotel from 6-10 July. Got a good upgrade to the premier floor and everything was wonderful.. From the service of the front-desk, the premier floor front-desk, the housekeeping etc. They are all polite and helpful. The room were also tidy up properly everyday and we really enjoy our stay there. The food in the hotel were nothing that I would say much, though its really very disappointing for the dim sum part. Being in a country which supposed to have the best dim sum in the world, the "siew mai" served during the breakfast buffet is so much worst than those I brought from the supermarket. :( Just when we were leaving on the last day, I made an enquiry at the concierge while waiting for our 2 luggage to be brought down. I wanted to ask about the taxi fare and whether it's easy for us to alight with 2 heavy luggage and a young child from the taxi to the airport express station (as this is our first time using the airport express). I was met with a very rude and impatient staff (I could not get this name, but he was the tall guy and I made that enquiry at about 10.30am on 10 July). He was so impatient that it made me feel that I had asked a stupid question! But goodness, I am not staying in Hong Kong! I am a tourist! If I had know the answer, I wouldn't be asking right? Even my husband who was sitting at the sofa with my child could not believe the staff's attitude! I understand from my friends that most people in Hong Kong are of such attitude - speaks fast and impatient, but this is certainly not an excuse for someone who is serving in an hotel! I am definitely not saying the whole concierge service is bad. The guy who brought down our very heavy luggage is a very polite guy and even though our luggage were heavy and almost overpower him due to his small size, he did not show any sign of unhappiness nor dump our luggage. Without the rude staff, our stay would have been perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & large rooms”
Reviews.Author: jobbo2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in July, clean & tidy rooms. Very nice and modern. Large rooms for Hong Kong. Great location to the night markets. Free internet in the lobby. Only about 25 minutes to the airport (but that was at 05:30am) Very impressed, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Bed”
Reviews.Author: StefanieLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in end of 2009. The hotel is around 10 minutes walk from the MTR. Room has nice deco and comfy king bed. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and busy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this joint as a hub if you wish to be doing what you should be doing in this world city of HK: that is, shop, eat and drink. It is wonderfully positioned to cater for such. Don't expect luxurious 5 stars service, but everything is adequate and efficient. The free internet of 7 Macs at the lobby is readily available and I found them fast and readily available (if you don't happen to compete with a school group of teenagers!), The room is small enough to swing a medium sized dog comfortably :), but this is the norm for mid priced hotels in HK. The design of the room is a marvel and there are so many space saving features that actually work and also look good. The room was on the 12th floor and sleep quality was excellent with good beds and pillows and quiet. Tried the massage enterprise at the lobby level too, 6 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Too far to go back, but absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nottedestate20
Reviews.Content: Well, it's not "next" to the airport, but transportation is quite easy in Hong Kong. And cheap. Decoration is nice, in and outside the rooms, the reception staff is helpful and the housekeeping is EXCELLENT! Being very concerned about hygiene matters, we found the service wonderful and everything VERY CLEAN. We also have THE BEST to say about the restaurant staff. Those people were great, from head chef to service assistants! The food was good, except for 2 things that need improvement: bacon grilling and some sweets...but excellent choco-banana tarts!!! But they all were polite, helpful and extremely friendly!!!! Located in the centre of the city, there's no view but that isn't really a problem in HK. You can go almost anywhere on foot, and use metro and buses for all other places. Due to swollen feet from long flights, we even booked ourselves a foot massage... reasonable prices for excellent service! So, a really good suggestion for HK!!!! Tip: get the "octopus" card for transportation and small shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonylast47
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean. Bathroom clean and tidy. However, the bar was very expensive and most of the tap beers had run out leaving only bottled. The breakfast buffet was dried up and overcooked and not very good value for money. Staff were pleasant and businesslike.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in Hong Kong, near Jordan MTR station (exit A or B). Just in case you don't have internet access in Hong Kong, this hotel provides 7 iMac connected to internet at the lobby and you can use them free of charge, very helpful to find information before going out to explore the city all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC53
Reviews.Content: Great spot, good room, fantastic staff. Will certainly choose this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days with friends, couldnt have asked for better service. Friendly staff, right near Nathan Road, the bus services and the MRT subway. I would recommend the hotel. An airport hotel shuttle is available at a very reasonable cost. The breakfasts were superb with a very obliging chef.

Reviews.Title: “Nice holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere in the room is nice and the location was strategic.7 eleven is just opposite the hotel.temple street is only a few minutes walk. near to Jordan MTR. housekeeping service is good. -when I asked the bell boy to take my luggage down,cause I will go to the airport in the morning.he told me to queue about 30 minutes,first come first serve.I was angry ,I told him that I had already call them half an hour ago.but nobody came,that's why I called them again.so he appeared in front of the room in few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL NATHAN ROAD, GREAT LOCATION WITH ADV PLUS BENEFITS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Nathan Road which is a bustling street in Hong Kong but you wouldnt know it was there till you walk out the door, then its onto the bus or a short walk to Jordan Station. The 7-11 store can replenish you OCTOPUS car for all travel on Public Transport. The room was well furnished and all the mod cons needed next to the bed and the bathroom was a great size. The staff were very friendly and could speak english and nothing was a bother to assist you, from the Restaurant to the TAKAS bar to the tourist help desk. If you are an Advantage Plus Member your breakfast for two is about 8 AUS dollars each, and the chef will cook you an omlete that makes you want one everyday. They can arrange transport to and from the airport on request and is cheaper than booking it yourself about 11AUS per person. Get on any of the Star Ferry Buses and go to the harbour and explore Hong Kong on your own you wont get lost as the Transport System is easy to Navigate. On a whole I found a new love for Hong Kong after not being there for 15 years and there is even a Disneyland which I will return to next time. The hotel was fantastic and the seven days went quick but did everything I wanted to do, you can even arrange to slip over to China in Shein Shen for some shopping but you need a Visa that the hotel can arrange or get one before you leave, its just a ride on the Train system and your there and they accept all currencies its an experience. I your want a great hotel in a easy location then the Novotel Nathan Road is a great place middle of everything and they cater for all including free Apple Computers in the foyer to keep in touch, if you want it in your room with your own computer about 35 Aus dollars for a week. Oh yes go to the TAKAS bar for 2 for 1 drinks nightly 6pm to 9.30pm and the meals are two for one with your ADVANTAGE PLUS card

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, no negatives to mention”
Reviews.Author: CoastersOnHols
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently and this was our first trip to Hong Kong so I can’t compare it to other similar rated hotels in Hong Kong. However, we were very impressed with the standard of it and the service provided. Our bags were collected as soon as we arrived by taxi and taken up to our room. We had booked an executive floor room so the receptionist personally took us up to the separate check in desk on the 15th floor, where we were checked in quickly and given a full explanation of the additional benefits of the Executive floor package. Our room was very well decorated with good quality fittings in the bathroom and a big shower with a wall and ceiling shower head. All the fittings and furniture seemed very new so I don’t know if it has had a recent makeover or not. Compared to UK and Australian 4 star hotels this felt more like 4.5 or 5 star quality. We had free use of the premier lounge which included breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails in the evening. The lounge is small but comfortable. The breakfast choice was quite good and the drinks in the evening were self service with a reasonable choice of wines, beers and spirits and a small cocktail menu to help you make your own. Some people have said in reviews that the lounge was full for breakfast. We ate fairly late each morning and didn’t have any problem but I could see how it could get full at busier times, although you do have the choice of eating in the main restaurant instead. The restaurant on the 1st floor had a good choice of buffet and a la carte meals at what seemed a reasonable price for a hotel. We ate here twice due to bad weather and we were impressed with the quality of the food. The hotel was ideally located in Kowloon, close to shops and markets and a 5 minute walk to an MRT station. The view from the bedroom window was just of another run down building but we weren’t expecting any views being in Kowloon. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectation”
Reviews.Author: Kayeriser
Reviews.Content: The moment you stepped into the hotel on the ground floor (concierge area), you are welcomed by a soothing aroma which is very refreshing. But this is not so in the room as we found that there was a stench on the pillows. Understand that the hotel supports green movement but we find it a hassle to call up housekeeping to change the bedsheets as we were rushing to go out everyday. Housekeeping was not up to standard as they did not keep the iron back to cupboard but left it on the bar counter as what I did. Shelves in the bathroom are not wiped. They also did not pour the water away which has melted from the ice in the ice bucket. I have purposely left it there for 2 days and nothing was done until I threw it away by myself! No WIFI in the rooms but they provide Mac in the lobby with 6 terminals. Did not expect such service from an international brand of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Insult on Check In”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel many times and probably my judgement is still clouded by the awful experience I had on check in. I had pre-booked and pre-payed for my room. On arrival on the executive floor I was asked to pay a deposit for any potential extra expenses i.e. laundry, bar, mini bar etc. However, when I gave my card it was declined although I had already used it in China about 6 hours earlier. I called my bank in UK who advised that they had a problem with Visa and they hoped to get it resolved within an hour or so. Their problem not mine. The young man then told me that it was Accor policy to take such a payment and could I not pay with another card or cash. My only other card is a debit card so I didn't want to use that. I had cash but I didn't understand why if I had already pre-paid he could not trust me for another hour or so and give me the keycard to my room and wait until the problem with visa was resolved. he then advised he could do this but would have to lock the mini-bar and put a stop on any other services within the hotel! I was so insulted and told him so and demanded to see the manager. The manager did not come to see me because she was too busy but they did decide to allow me access to the room I had already paid for in advance! The manager called me and gave me all the usual rubbish about Accor policy etc. The way I feel at the moment I doubt I will stay at this hotel again or any other Accor hotel. They can have back my A-Club card. It stands for nothing especially loyalty or trust.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near to the midway point of Nathan Road, it is within walking distance to various attractions in Kowloon. With taxis and the subway located nearby, we were able to conveniently travel to places that were located further away. Not only were the staff highly efficient in their duties, they were also knowledgeable and willing to provide assistance in various ways. Staying at the Novotel Nathan had contributed to the success of our family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “First leisure visit to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've been "Accor Advantage Plus" members for some years and we've always had a great time at locations around the world - however - our stay at the Novotel in Nathan Road, Kowloon was exceptionally good! The hotel is very well located, close to bus and train services - get an Octopus travel card at the Airport and travel is easy and cost-effective. The hotel is immaculate, the service is efficient and friendly, our room on level eight was very comfortable and we slept very well. Although the hotel was busy, food service was quick and the food was excellent - no time to waste waiting around in the restaurant, there's much to do in Hong Kong! We are planning another visit to Hong Kong next year and if the Novotel has a room available, we'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aussie's stay in Novotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value for money - especially in terms of Australian dollars. It is conveniently located a few hundred metres from Jordan MTR railway station and the pickup point for the free MTR bus to Kowloon airport railway station . The rooms were a little small and beds a little harder than what most westerners would be accustomed to but those features are common throughout Asia. Western diets were well catered for and the free internet worked well - unlike the People's Republic of China were Facebook is banned and Gmail is interfered with by the government. Of course, unlike "mainland" China, one can drink the water in Hong Kong - a sign in the hotel bathroom pointed this out and it is a feature of which Hong Kong should be proud.

Reviews.Title: “owner”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed to have. To pay for internet connection as most all hotels today have free internet otherwise. Very pleased service was very goodthe location could be better but all in all ok

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our first Hong Kong visit.”
Reviews.Author: Brumer
Reviews.Content: Was most impressed by this hotel. It was my first visit to Hong Kong, so was not sure what to expect, however I was very impressed by this hotel and it's location was perfect. About a two minute walk to the Temple Street night markets, Jordan metro station, and so many cafes and restaurants most of which are quite good to eat at. We tried many little local restaurants and didn't get sick at all. There is a convenience store right across the street (great for buying milk, a packet or Oreos and a bottle of Aussie wine, they even had Cadbury chocolate). About a 15 minute walk to Ladies Markets and other great markets. Breakfast was fantastic with a full international spread! Loved the chicken congee for breakfast! Minbar was well stocked even with condoms.... King size bed was so comfortable and there was even pillow a la carte Chose what firmness of feather pillow you want. My husband travels for work and has stayed in hotels such as Shangri-La in northern China and this hotel impressed him! Very good value and nice staff. Qantas flight crew stay here too, so that says something too! Will definitely return to Novotel Nathan Rd if I visit Hong Kong again and have already recommended this hotel to quite a few people Since our stay. Kowloon is the place to stay, nice to visit Hong Kong Island, but Kowlo

Reviews.Title: “Was great but still have some areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've always consider novotel brand as i've had a pleasant stay with novotel citygate the first time we were in hk. Novotel Nathan is definitely with edge over citygate in terms of location hence we picked it this time. Same great service, clean and modern rooms which is great. What was somehow lacking was the variety of food choices offered in the breakfast menu compared to that of citygate. Another item that is now a necessity nowadays is having a wi-fi connection (not necessarily free) in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: OnVacationSg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in Jun 11 and it provide all that it should for a hotel. It's highly value for money for a standard room with king bed and the best thing is it's not small at all! The bathroom is well-stocked and served us very well. The location is less than 5 mins walk to Jordan station and there is lots of food choice nearby. Getting around from Jordan station is convenient and I hardly need the cab for my stay in HK. Highly recommend this hotel against the rest of the hotel in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: emmaandtom52
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and nicely decorated, very comfortable and quiet. Staff were friendly enough. We chose to have the buffet breakfast which was worth doing to keep you full for the rest of the day, especially as for our first time in Asia we weren't really sure what to eat for breakfast! There is also free internet in the lobby. The bar/restaurant seemed pricey, we only had a few drinks. So overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised that the Novotel hotel at Nathan Road was new and clean. It was a refurbished hotel & unlike some of the hotels in HK, this was really modern, new and most importantly clean. A good choice indeed! No regrets bat joining Accor Club!

Reviews.Title: “Edges of Bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The edge or the bed is a real pain. I travelled with my families, we have booked 3 rooms. All the adults, 6 of us were cut by the edge of the bed on the sheen. The person who put the bed into this room should have thought of the design due to space constraint. I believe in the U.S., Accor have long been sued for medical compensation!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, free usage of internet with mac comp in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: milyvels
Reviews.Content: Novotel is in good location with lots of store surrounding the hotel, convenient store just right across the hotel, jordan mrt station and temple night market, just a few steps away from the hotel. The hotel doesn't provide the free wi fi, but the guest can use the free mac in the lobby, they have 6 in all, very good service. check in is fast and the room is completely spotless, good service of the house keeper, give the new slipper everyday and toiletries. We had the booking through the website, and we got the promo rate for 3 nights stay, all i can say, great rate.We stay there for 3 nights and had our breakfast in the hotel, they have the same menu of breakfast buffet during our stay for 3 mornings, would be better, if they can do some variations. Would like to stay here again, when we go back to hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel that I went in Hong Kong - Novotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum member and I did not receive any beneficts. The room it was so small and the rate almost USD 200,00 per day. not incluse internet neither breakfest. The people from the front desk not so polite. I did not receive neither the room upgrade!!

Reviews.Title: “It was good, functional, just what I expected really”
Reviews.Author: Faye47_11
Reviews.Content: WE got wheat we expected really, a modern, clean, decent hotel, with an average room. The staff quite helpful and nice, but the whole hotel is impersonal - big, American style hotels always are. The food was lovelly, we had 2 breakfasts and a dinner there, just lovely. I was not well on the day we were due to leave, and they kindly allowed me to stay in my room for 6 1/2 hours past my check out time. I thought this was very kind, and quite unusual, and we weren't charged at all. It was difficult to get on to the computers, and there were quite slow I thought. But the location was good, not great, but good, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Hong Kong holiday”
Reviews.Author: planewatch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novotel Nathan road from 4th of June for six nights, after a 12 hour flight from London. It turned out to be real oasis is this colourful city. The entrance to the hotel is down a side road off Nathan road, so could be missed easily. The area itself seemed reasonably safe with some street hawkers in Nathan Road trying to steer you towards fake watches ,handbags and express tailoring .We had booked a premier room which was of a very good standard although no lock on the sliding bathroom door was a bit odd ! The view out of the room was of a very typical Hong Kong high rise flats in various state of repair, but you do not come to Hong Kong to look out of the hotel window. The premier room gave us complimentary breakfast in the dining room, which was a very good wide ranging buffet catering to most tastes. An alterative to this was to have a continental breakfast in the premier lounge, which also had a small range of hot food .An added bonus with our room rate, was afternoon tea, and early evening cocktails also served also in the premier lounge. Afternoon tea was sandwiches, cakes, soft, drinks, tea and coffee. At the early evening cocktails there was also a small range of hot and cold food .We found the evening cocktails a great time to meet other guests and share the day’s experiences. The bar in the lobby also had a food menu offering a range of food for most tastes, and was a quiet place to eat and drink. The staff throughout our stay were helpful, friendly, and courteous I could not fault them at any time from check in to check out. The hotel was a great base for our holiday and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel, but not 4 star service and amendities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Pullman, Mecure, Sofitel and Ibis, and this is my first time in Novotel, which is supposed to be 4 star hotel and have very respectful branding already. They did not provide toothbrush, no bathrobes were in the room untill request.Bedroom slippers were not good quality. Service was average only. Also, the bags were not delivered immediately and still did not come after the first call, it was only after the second call and around 20 minutes later that the bags arrive. The location where the door faces were also a small alley, and not suitable for a 4 star hotel. Location was however super good for this hotel, very convenient to get to Mongkok, and temple street, as well as any parts of HK and since it is only 5 minutes away by taxi ride from the Airport Express Kowloon station too. Will reconsider to stay there all the same....

Reviews.Title: “Need more training”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only one thing to comment, the receptionist needs more training. When I arrived hotel and would like to check in at around 2.30pm - 2.45pm, the receptionist told me the room is not ready for a Non-smoking room, which I stated when I made booking for the room. And their officially check-in time is 2pm. I am so surprised that my room is not ready (I already paid). After all, I found out because I request some thing like "Non-smoking" or anything, she will first tell you NO, then only check for you if you insists. So please ask more than 1 time if you need anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neung_neung
Reviews.Content: The temple night market, Tsim Sha Tsui, and Mong Kok are in the walking distance. If you'd rather take a train, the Jordan Station is not too far away. I stayed in a superior room; the room rate I paid included free unlimited landline internet, which was very convenient. However, the rate I paid did not include breakfast. I was told that breakfast was 99 HKD. Very good internet connection, though. The room was also clean. The hotel is eco friendly .The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good service; no window view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location was ok. Hotel was relatively easy to locate but easy to miss if not alert. Service was good, Internet stations were avail at the lobby. Internet charges for room was not free but affordable. Con: no window view. My room was facing another old building which was really close. Hence we kept the curtains close most of the time. Not a sightly view.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: Located on the Nathan Road shopping strip on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong, the hotel couldn't be better located! Convenient to shopping, restaurants, and the Star Ferry terminal is just down the road. The service was second to none; the decor is very clean and modern; the well equipped gym is open 24 hours; and the buffet breakfast is fantastic! I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but below average everything else”
Reviews.Author: devbk
Reviews.Content: For the location, the hotel deserves a 5 rating but almost everything else seem to bring the experience down. One word to describe my impression of the place was "Impersonal". The lobby is crowded and resembles a transit lounge with too few seats. We stayed on the 14th floor ; the room is well furnished but extremely small; internet access is charged but despite this the wifi signal doesnt reach the room, the bathroom has no tub. The buffet was extremely good. The concierge is the weakest link in the assembly. They were impersonal, unfriendly and just short of being rude. When requested to arrange a taxi to the airport, I was pointed one on the road and told "He can take you". That from a Novotel is not acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CSquared11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Novotel Nathan Road in May 2011. The hotel was very nice, proved excellent service, and was in a great location. We had a normal room with a single king sized bed. The room was medium sized, very clean, and had great air conditioning! Our view wasn't the greatest, but who goes to Hong Kong to look out of their hotel window? We didn't hear any street noise either. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and the staff was helpful. They took our luggage, arranged cabs for us, and safely stored our bags on the last day. Our only complaint is the lack of wireless internet in the rooms, but they provided six computers in the lobby with free internet, and we never really had a problem getting one. Occasionally we had to wait, but only 5 minutes or so. The locations is excellent. It's only a short (few blocks) from the night market, plenty of street shops to buy snacks and drinks, and there is a great bakery close by. Nathan Rd. is buzzing with activity, so its fun to just walk and look around. The hotel was very close to the MTR station, so it made for a quick walk in the rain or heat. The MTR is easy to use and takes you everywhere. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: shah_zada80
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is a busy and vibrant place, and Nathan Road is no different. However, with this hotel being just off the main road, you could not wish to stay in a better location. The hotel is modern and well finished. The staff are polite and helpful. The free internet on the iMacs in the lobby are ideal for online check-in etc. The rooms are a delight - comfy beds, good TVs and nice bathrooms. Excellent Air con and control system in the rooms, meaning you can manage the lighting, TV and temperature from just one panel. The breakfast is very good with excellent choice - don't forget to pick up your free 20% off card from reception! The only downside to the hotel is a distinct lack of views - but that doesn't matter. Being in Jordan and an MTR just down the road, you can get pretty much anywhere in a short space of time. Overall, wonderful hotel and this WILL be where we stay every time we visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Lay over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th floor (Executive room) and excluding the lingering smell of smoke was very well presented. This was only a two night lay over on our way back to Oz but found the amentities, staff and executive room privilages met our expectations. This hotel is located in Kowloon and close to everything and only two minutes by bus (two minute walk from hotel bus numbers 2, 6, 6A) to Central Harbour for touring on Hong Kong Island. This place is so easy getting around after one day you feel like a local. We did the Big Bus open top Bus tour (320HKD each for 24 hours) this gave us three bus tours, one night tour and lots more benifits. We would recommend this hotel on the Executive floor, not sure what the other rooms were like.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: MikeDaegu_SouthKorea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, just five minutes away from Jordan Station and the Temple Street Night Market. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The only thing I didn't care for was that I had to pay extra for internet service in the room. Many hotels that I've stayed in offer free wifi, so being wired and having to pay for it seems a bit old fashioned. However, this minor inconvenience was overshadowed by the overall positive experience that I had while staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Situated in a handy location, in the heart of the tourism strip, and within walking distance of both the harbour, and popular markets, or a short taxi/bus trip from these. The Temple St. night market is only a few mins walk from here. Conveniently, the A21 bus from the airport, stops virtually at the front door. Nice sized clean, rooms, which unfortunately, overlook the neighbouring rundown apartments. Service is good, and staff are very friendly, and will go out of their way to help -they insisted on securing a taxi to the airport for us, with a driver that would not "take the long way round". A big disadvantage was the poor insulation -we could hear every conversation of people passing in the corridor, & all their comings & goings, plus the noise of the tv in the room above, was as if it was in our own room. Buffet breakfast was plentiful & varied -good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at Majestic Hotel which is the same building but afther changing to Novoltel, I have a seen a big change, very excellent change, no noise like before, the service is excellent, the interiror, rooms are also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short trip stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second time stay in this hotel, it is distance walking to Jordan MTR. The room is not that big but one thing I dislike that is no lock on the toilet door. If you are flying back from Hong Kong Airport, the hotel can arrange Airbus to pick you up at the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but hard to get a drink in the bar”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is the first time i have stayed in The Novotel on Nathan , it was a great experience except that the bar staff were too busy doing anything else they could find but serve drinks , once you managed to get their attention they were friendly and atttentative.

Reviews.Title: “my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: with the superb location, this hotel will be my first choice. I am surely go back to this hotel again. It is in the center of shopping area of Kowloon. We can walk to Tsim Sha Tsui or Mongkok within just 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small with no great view but you cannot expect a good view from all the rooms. the service and location is central and 2 min walk to the mtr. On the main rood right opposite the Temple street night market. One stop from the harbour by mtr or a nice walk of 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent hotel to stay tour desk excellent and helpful, close to train station, and walking distance to all markets. The premiep longe was excellent with evening drinks and nibbles afternoon tea good alays had heaps of food and drink available. Pillow selection for rooms a extra bonus which was terrific, its called a pillow menu and indeed it was.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Primer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Novotel Nathan Rd. As it was my first time travelling to HK and my booking was done over the internet any difficulties were swept away by their helpful and considerate service.The room and facilities were exceptional as was the food and wine selection available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cramped and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: WillowGreen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading a lot of great feedbacks from other fellow reviewers. I am sorry to say that I don't like it. It's clean, modern, great location. But, and it's a big BUT, very small and cramped. It's true that all HK hotels are cramped to some extent due to the scarity of the land on the island. But this hotel is so cramped that you can't walk to the window without knocking either your bed ends or the furniture on the opposite side of the bed. And it's £176 a night! you could get better hotels for that price! Apart from that, the reception which stores clients' personal information is located at the noisy bar. We booked a double bed but were given a twin bed instead because that's the only bed left available Staff are very friendly and helpful, great location, close to local markets thus give 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “My first impression at Novotel Nathan Rd”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our family members comprises of 6 adults and 2 young kids ( 5.5 and 2 years old). We were staying at Novotel Nathan Rd for the first time. We booked the rooms only and our first impression was that one day before we arrive, there was a call to confirm our booking from the hotel. When we arrived there, the front staf was friendly, we requested for three rooms on the same floor and she managed to get them for us. The room is spacious, modern and clean. The bathroom with shower room was very well arranged and very clean. Our kids enjoyed the flat TV screen and there was also a comfortable sofa next to our king-sized bed! So in total, a thumb's up for this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, Good location”
Reviews.Author: milescollector
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. Stay was nice and comfortable. Very centrally located on Nathan Road. 5-10 minutes walk to the nearest MTR station. The check-in process & check-out was very quick and the staff was efficient. The room size was small but considering the average room sizes in Hongkong, it was ok. The breakfast in the hotel was good and they had an elaborate spead. The restaurant was also good and the staff friendly. There was no internet in the room, so had to use the computers kept in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Summ
Reviews.Content: Room on Floor 15 - Premier Room This is my 12th trip to HK and my first time at the Novotel Nathan Road. I stayed here for 6 nights, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Great service right from the pick up point outside the hotel, the porters whisked my bags inside immediately. I went to the foyer with a collegue and we we escorted by a lady-staffer up to the 15th floor book-in. Book-in was fast, efficient and friendly. Free internet access was great, plus the free wi-fi. We could also use two free internet computers on the 15th floor lobby with no hassles. The "complimentary" breakfast, afternoon snacks, and drinks were well worth the little extra paid. One slight negative was that I had two A4 photostat copies done which cost me HKD$10, but I made up with that with the free beverages in the happy hour times. The room was very comfortable, lovely king size bed, great tv (but could do with a few more English language choices), spacious bathroom, and nice decore in general. I imagine with two active people it could have been a tad squeezy. Next time I'll visit with my wife. Jordon Road MTR about 2 to 3 minutes walk, go under the steps at the roadway and you can bus it to Mongkok and beyond. Tips for new HK visitors. 1) Get an Octopus card at the Airport for HKD$150. That will save you time and energy when on the MTR trains, buses and ferries. 2) For a fun trip with great sightseeing and shopping, go up to Shenzhen (China border) and bargain at LoWu Commercial Centre. There you can offer up to 33% of the asking prices. Hold your price (with a smile) and you'll own the goods. It takes 10 minutes to get a Chinese two day visa at the border. I'll certainly be back to this hotel, next time with my wife - a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & cozy stay in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cookie25
Reviews.Content: Just back from HK a few days ago and had spent 4 nights in Novotel Nathan. My first time staying in Novotel Nathan and it was a good experience. Reception staff and concierge was pleasant and courteous, and housekeeping did a very good job everyday keeping our rooms neat & replenished whatever toiletries we needed. Good service! Rooms were quite small, but were really comfy and cozy. In fact, we felt very much at home, it was like a home away from home. Absolutely no complaints about the room. Modern facilities, large TV, comfortable bed, they even have an iron and ironing board. We booked two connecting rooms, one room had a bathtub in its toilet and the other just a shower stall, I specially like it since one can choose to either the bathtub or the shower. For those who need internet though, unless you use their computers on the reception floor, you have to pay for internet access. The computers were quite useful, as many times, we need internet access to check out some of the places to visit while in HK. The only drawback is you have to wait for your turn if all the computers are occupied. Location wise, it isnt exactly near the MTR, but it wasnt too far either, just a few small streets away is the Jordan MTR. Very good & convenient location! There are many shops near the hotel too and a 7-11 just opposite. There are many good shops and eating choices down the stretch too. Opposite the road is the bus stop for the airport bus A21, so its all the more convenient to travel to the airport. The only complaint i have is that there are no lift from the concierge level to the reception level. It is especially troublesome if we have heavy luggage and elderly people with us. And it is really not safe to ride the escalator with heavy or bulky luggage. I really suggest they do something on this part, maybe install a lift to the reception level. On the day we checked in, there was quite a strong smell while we walked along the corridor to our rooms, but after that day, the smell disappeared, so it was not a problem. I dont know what happened to the carpet along the corridors but there was patches all around, and on the room doors too, it didnt really bother me, but i guess it may be time for some refurbishing or repainting. Room prices was quite expensive, given that there are many similar hotels within the same location with more competitive and lower prices. But I guess the high price is due to the fact that it is part of the Novotel hotel chain. All this little things dont quite bother me, because I really love the rooms! I will definitely be going back to Novotel Nathan again the next time I travel to HK...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good bed and pillow.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Good bed and pillow, for me, it is very comfortable. But the room and door, could not keep the sound in. Somebody talking on the foyet, you could hear sound, and makes somebody could not sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Was invited to upgrade to Club Room package on checking in which we did which we thought was excellent value, We could not fault any of our stay at this Hotel. I have an advantage plus card so help makes things more affordable also. Great Location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: GCake1105
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights and loved it. Note this hotel is on the Kowloon side (not HK island) but it's a great location for sightseeing. It is not far from the subway station (Jordan station) and so on the red line it is only 2 stops away from HK island. It's also very close to the night markets and wonderful shopping (1 stop away from TST station) where you can also find the Avenue of the Stars and the Star Ferry. The hotel room was nice and quiet. There is no view as you are in the middle of a bustling, busy city. However, it was very clean and quiet, we were never disturbed by anyone. Bring a plug adapter though because the rooms are equipped only for British plugs (HK uses these). I think the hotel offers adapters though not converters. Amenities in the room lacked a separate hair conditioner and body lotion. The lighting system can be a bit confusing, but you just have to control it from the nightstand. Also no free-wifi anywhere in the hotel, it is all pay as you go. There is no real business room, just 5 or 6 MAC computers in the lobby which are almost always being used. The fitness room was better than expected, with free weights and exercise machines (treadmill, bike, etc...) and it was always empty. Check in and check out were easy. The TV in the room is a bit on the small side. Bathrooms do not have a bathtub, only a shower, which was fine for us. There is no swimming pool. If you are looking for a quiet, clean, affordable hotel room in the middle of the city, this is it. To get here, take the airport express train to Kowloon train station, then take a taxi from Kowloon to the hotel. Hotel lobby was always bustling with people, it's a popular hotel. Never had to wait very long for an elevator, however.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My special request was being on the 15th floor or higher and I even received a confirmation.But when I got there they told me there was no 15th floor. I still have not been refunded. I'm very unsatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RayBeatricetravel
Reviews.Content: We Traveled to Hong Kong for the very first time. I didn't know to what to expect, but one thing I knew for sure and that was the standards of the Novotel Hotel chains. Last year I stayed in a Novotel hotel in Monte Carlo and was blown away with their service and the reasonable pricing. In Monte Carlos nothing is cheap and this Hotel provided first rate service just like all those costing hundreds more. When we arrived in hong, the room was very clean, modern and spacious. All the amenities were provided. Any questions I had about tours were explain even doe I had previously book with another company. The breakfast was included and this was a big plus. The restaurants had excellent choices of varies ethic meals. On checkout I wasn't catching my flight until 7:00 p.m. and they held our luggages for us until said time. I highly recommend this hotel. Oh I did not mention that the hotel is location right on the most desirable area in Hong Kong, centrally located to all the tour sites. It's called the "Golden Mile".

Reviews.Title: “Good location, over price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel on 3-5 may 2011 when I arrived at the front of hotel no one go to help me pick the laggage. I and my family go to our room by ourselves. No one go to help us all time i stay at this hotel. So I think it charge us more money than service

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: earthsinger
Reviews.Content: Hotel service and room were very good, comfortable large room, large tv screen, modern fittings throughout. In-house bar pricey and choice of drinks limited due to lack of stock. Live entertainment excellent. We wouldn't recommend the hotel restaurant for breakfast unless you're a very early riser. Most of the food was very dried out and almost inedible by 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location We stayed at the Novotel on the Premier floor. The check-in and out is completed on the 15th Premier floor. The room is the standard Novotel size (not big). The bathroom is great with plenty of hot water and the rooms are serviced each day. The location is fantastic, the A21 CityFlyer bus from the international airport delivers you almost right the to hotel door (Stop 10) at a cost of $33 per person. The MTR Jordan is a 3 minute walk, the trains are great and efficient and takes to you anywhere you want to go. A Premier floor booking entitles you to a continental breakfast in the Lounge or a full cooked breakfast in the Main Dining room. We enjoyed a daily breakfast in the Dining room. Staff, they do their job. Other Accor properties, like the Novotel in Bejing and Singapore have much more attentive staff whom make you feel more welcomed. However, that said I would return as the Location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “my review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room is very good, location also very good. Room rate is quite expensive during my stay period,maybe is peak season. Another point is hotel didn't provide free internet service, internet fee was expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been there only a night,but during that I was faced with the problem about my luggage's Key. It was broken, and I tried many times to open but It didnt work. Then finally I asked for help from the reception, after the called just only 5 mins or less, hotel staffs had coming with a tool that could make my luggage opened. Thank for you help on that night after I had got the very tired day. About the room, It's really cleanliness and modern as posted on the website. I do recommend to choose this hotel for your choice.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at novotel, nathan road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: our stay in novotel was splendid. The staff were very courteous specially Derek who assisted us when we arrived and checked in. They are always smiling and ready to assist us in our every need. We stayed at the 14th floor, the premier floor, the room was very neat and clean although not as spacious as i thought it would be. The amenities were terrific (specially the free internet usage at the 1st and 15th floor) and so was the buffet breakfast served at the Square Restaurant. The location was just right for us, located along the commercial district so it was walking distance to all the shopping malls and the food stores. Starbucks, bread talk, 7-11 and even KFC are all walking distance to the hotel and so is the MTR (Jordan Station). Our stay in Hongkong was really a grand experience specially for my children and it helped that we stayed at Novotel who really made our stay more relaxed and stress free. I will definitely stay again at Novotel if ever i will be given a chance to go to hongkong again. To the staff of Novotel i say thank you for being so nice to us. More power.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY IS OK, VALUE IS NOT MUCH.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel, but value wise it is not attactive. If the room rate could be better and service could be better, then it will be a superior hotel. The location is quite convenient, though it is not in the actual area of Tsim Sha Tsui, but it is quite convenient to the tube station. The surrounding is quiet and could have good sleep. Room is a bit too small, no space to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “greatest hotel in kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great hotel with excellent services , luxurious room , with so many shopping , eating & entertainment experience around the hotel . and the location is only minutes walk from Jordan Station Subway .

Reviews.Title: “comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel is like visiting a McDonalds... their high standard of service and food quality is always 'as expected' and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and other Novotels to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great location with lots of shops and eateries in the area. The staff were very polite,helpful and friendly. It is not far from the railway station and taxi transport is very convenient and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Kowloon Nathan”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent and having the ability to have ajoining rooms for the grandchildren made it possible to stay at this hotel. Service was excellence as were the meals. A much better experience than a recent stay at a Mercure Hotel in Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this Hotel since afew years ago. It was a very good & clean hotel but during my recent trip (April 2011), I realise that the Hotel is not as excellent as before. They have stop providing toothbrush and my husband & I have to rush to the nearby Seven 11 store in the middle of the night to get 1 and the slipper that they provide is really horrible. It gave me a feeling that i'm putting on a pair of paper slipper. Hope that the hotel will improve rather than cutting cost.

Reviews.Title: “Extra mile ...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After 2 nights with this hotel, I moved to Novotel Century at Wanchai. A night mare began when I need a taxi transfer. I asked for help to arrange for the transport (taxi) in advance during my reservation and check-in. It seems like there wasn't such service. The customer service officer explained to me how to take MTR to Wanchai etc etc . After I checked out, I asked the concierge to arrange for a taxi. I have luggage therefore I preferred not to take MTR. The concierge guy was friendly and walked me to the main road. Perhaps it was not the right timing, I flagged more than 10 taxis and all refused to pick me there because have to cross the tunnel and traffic jam. Ended up I struggled with the luggages and staircases up and down to MTR stations plus 10 mins walk from Wanchai MTR to check-in to Novotel Century. The least I would have expected was that the Novotel could have done something for me since I am moving to another location within the same hotel group. I called it extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Nathan Road, is perfect for the both the business/leisure traveller, location is just right, not quite in the hub but not too far from it all. MTR is two minutes away. We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and not once have we had a bad experience. From the houekeeping to front office all the staff are extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around 10 mins walk to the nearest MTR, Jordon. But its quite a far walk to the main shopping belt in Mongkok. Service was not bad but the reception was on the 2nd level with no lift access. If you are carrying bulky stuff and luggage, it might post some inconvenience cause there was a night when we went back, the escalator was under maintenance, we had to climb the escalator with our stuff. Overall, the stay was pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for the Temple Street night markets and shopping on Nathan Road. Probably about a 15-20 minute walk to the ferry terminal and harbour city. Restaurant is excellent - the buffet lunch and dinner is really good value and is very popular with the locals, packed every night. Reservation recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: vmessy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road for 3 nights from Monday 11th April. We had planned to stay longer however apart from the location there was nothing else going for the hotel. Situated on Nathan Road, everything is nearby. There is Jordan station within a few minutes walk which lets you pretty much get around most places quickly. The downside to this hotel is the condition of the rooms, the staff and service. We was not impressed by the quality of the room. We had fixtures breaking in the room, noisy air conditioning and the staff claimed we had one of the better rooms.We constantly had to ask twice for things to get done including our rooms cleaned. The rooms are also very small. Paid for the internet which is about £10 for 24 hours however its not very fast. if you want somewhere that is in a good location then the hotel is ideal. We left after 3 nights and went to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: dojies
Reviews.Content: Quick checkin, friendly service, good location, comfortable bed. What more can one ask from a hotel in the middle of Nathan Road? Perhaps a toilet brush in the loo? We were on the 15th floor with free wireless internet with a weak signal but the lounge on the same floor had a strong signal, free drinks and nibblies as well as its own check-out facility. The Hotel is close to Jordan station with it’s fast MTR service and one of the night markets is, unfortunately, far to close when accompanied by shopaholics.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff at a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: ITC57
Reviews.Content: This is my third year staying at the Novotel Nathan Road and every year the service just seems to get better and better. The rooms are spacious, extremely comfortable and have all the bits and pieces you need either on business as I was, or for leisure. Do try and book of the rooms on the premier floor as the added extras in the Premier Lounge make all the difference. Don’t miss the breakfast buffet in the Square Restaurant on the first floor of the hotel it is excellent value for money for the enormous selection they put out. Wonderful staff, great location cant wait for next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “=)”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
