Reviews.Content: the room is nice, almost everything you need is there. the hallway smells bad though because of some rooms that allows smoking but it won't reach inside your room. the location of the hotel is great but a little expensive. i usually walk from the hotel to mongkok or tsim sha tsui. its on the center of everything. i will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A new hotel with very good service .”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good hotel with new facilities , e.g. the electric boiling vase , and the new furniture . The two female receptionists at the counter impressed me for their politeness and patience to deal with my problems with clear explanation and very good service . I think the staff here respect every customer and provide their best quality to us . Besides , the location of this hotel is good , it is near the MTR station , with bus and taxi transport available . There is only superior room and premier room , but no standard room in this hotel . I wish I can try the restaurant and the premier room next time .

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jynn77
Reviews.Content: Was super duper impressed by the service of the staff at the concierge and the front desk, they were very helpful with recommending where to eat, where to shop etc when I had accidentally left something pretty valuable in the hotel room, they immediately passed my item to the concierge where i had left my luggage after checking out :) Very accessible to jordan mtr too (5 min walk from the hotel) you might want to check out Cheers Restaurant nearby which serves delicious dimsum at affordable prices Comfy beds Nothing to complain about this hotel, would definitely stay here if I visit Hong Kong again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for Business & Leisure Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier_on_Holidays
Reviews.Content: When I found this hotel online and I thought this hotel is fabulous and after checking reviews on tripadviso, there are a lot of good reviews about this hotel. So, I had decided to book this hotel for my Hong Kong business trip. True enough, when I arrived the hotel and check-in to my room, everything went well. Hotel looks clean from the lobby all the way up tp the room. But, I must comment that the room does look smaller than it shows in the website though. Nonetheless, there's this huge LCD TV in the room, it is probably a 52" in size. But, I suggest they would probably need to add in more English movies channel than too many Chinese channels. Hotel is walking distance to Temple Street Night Market and a lot of eateries around the area. It is also near to a lot of shopping malls along the Nathan Road. One afternoon I walk blindlessly to the local wet market and I saw juicy sweet corns are on sell, risking that I don't have a cooking facilities in room, I bought some corns and got back to the hotel and ask the restaurant if they are willing to cook the corns for me, and without hestation, the staff say yes but will charge me for a minimum fee, which I think is fair enough. One thing ths hotel really needs to improve is their breakfast at the Chinese restaurant up at 15th floor. The food is seriously unacceptable for a 4-star hotel. Instead of serving something western, they should probably serve more of local dim sum for breakfast and have more selections. I am quite disappointed with the breakfast. But thank you, there's a Starbucks right next to the hotel's lobby. Housekeeping staffs are very efficient and I was staying on 10th floor, there's this Chinese lady whom I see almost work around the clock. Generally, I am very happy staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: JohnC060
Reviews.Content: Good location for seeing Hong Kong and short cab ride to airport railline terminal (Kowloon stop) Service was excellent (of course there is a built in service charge) Stored a couple of bags for me for a week while I went into mainland China with no extra charge or hassle Rooms are Hong Kong size (smallish) and view is of the side of a building but well equipped, clean with comfortable beds. Restaurant was pretty good too

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I where on our way back from China and we stay there over night waiting for our connecting flight back to Perth. It is in great location. Close to Kowloon Station to connect with the train to and from the Airport. Very close to the Temple St markets and a nice walk up too the Ladies market.

Reviews.Title: “would not consider it value for money”
Reviews.Author: christinec16
Reviews.Content: good points: room itself was ok, stylishly modern and not too small. there is a free airport express shuttle stop very near if you are using an airport pass. not so good points: view in the room was an old mass housing building, so we kept the roller blinds down the whole time. surrounding area was also kind of boring. went back to reception when we got our luggage from the concierge (which we left after checkout) to ask housekeeping to check on a hairband i forgot to pack (i remember placing on top of the side table). a receptionist went with me to check the room which has been cleaned but hairband is no longer there and housekeeping said no hairband was found. ok i know it's just a hairband but i can't imagine how it wasn't found when i know i left it there. location isn't that near to jordan mrt and at the time of writing there is no escalator or elevator so you have to carry your bag up a flight of stairs if you are coming from the mrt. overall i wouldn't say it's value for money, i think there are better hotels in hong kong with the same pricing somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “very comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: sshiyinggg
Reviews.Content: very comfortable stay here. you feel practically at home. they shld improve their front desk service. check in check out took me 15mins each. assistant mngr/trainee coaching each other/vice versa. its just very lengthy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: petporter
Reviews.Content: excellant hotel, rooms were modern, clean, had everything you needed in a room, beds were so comfortable as well as the pillows, space was fair, bigger than the rooms at the Eaton (which is also a good hotel). Location is excellent, free internet access in the foyer, gym is modern with all the equipment needed for a workout. Staff were friendly and helpful. Like i said, you can't fault it. I just hope they maintain their prices and dont' increase them due to good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: n5371856
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, the hotel itself is a little old and smelly. But when in HK if you're looking to be in the hustle and bustle of the tourist district and great food, markets, etc, then this hotel is the place. Buffet breakfast is good, beds are comfy, all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “The room is fantastic! Worth the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ean-Ean
Reviews.Content: Room is very clean & sound proof, bed is very comfortable & the shower is very powerful!!! Really enjoyed my 3 nights stay in this hotel. Good location & friendly staff. MTR from airport to hotel is so easy, though we have to change lines but thats ok, it's better than taking the bus or taxi. From the airport, take the Airport Express to Tsing Yi station, then get down & change to Tung Chung line to get to Lai King station, then from Lai King take the Tsuen Wan line to Jordon station. From Jordon station to the hotel is only 5 minutes walk. All in the journey is about 50 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. I have stayed here before when it had a different name. The Novotel has done a wonderful job of revamping this hotel - everything is clean and modern and the reason I like to stay here is it is quiet, near the MTR, the night markets and lots of choices for eating. We spent 2 days exploring Hong Kong Island and Lantau Island and were glad we had such accomadation to return to each evening. We will be staying here again on our next visit to Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kelwez
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights from the 23rd Feb 2011. We requested a king room on a high floor prior to arrival and we were given room 1209. This room was right next to the elevators, we could hear some noise sometimes but nothing that ruined our stay. We got the airport train to Kowloon and then the free bus that dropped us off on Austin Road, this is about a 10 min walk from the hotel which was easy to find. The hotel is in a great location, 2 blocks from the Jordan MTR which will get you everywhere you need to be. You could be over in central within 10 minutes. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, my only complaint is that there was not a mirror in front of the dressing/work table for getting ready. The shower was huge and the room was cleaned every day. (There are English plug sockets in the room). We had drinks in the hotel bar a few times which was reasonably priced considering its a hotel, we didn't actually find any bars in Kowloon so this was handy - there was a great selection of bars over in SoHo though on Hong Kong Island half way up the escaltors (a lot of the ex pats hang out here). We had ordered a package to be delivered to the hotel whilst we were there which we subsequently cancelled but it still arrived at the hotel, the staff there was great at helping us to sort this out, they held onto the package until we got home to the UK to arrange a re-collection. You could also get free internet in the lobby where there are 4 pc's and 2 in the bar. Overall if we went back to Hong Kong we would definitely stay here again, the service and value for money is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Tasmaid
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Novotel, staff were very helpful and friendly, We are currently booking a return stay for May, could anyone give us information on train from the airport we used bus last time but would like to use the MTR as I believe the station is very close by, we only had 2 nights last time so we were rushed this time we have 8, any help would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have stayed at in asia!!”
Reviews.Author: Franger28
Reviews.Content: This was one of 7 hotels i stayed at during my 4 week trip in asia and this was the best by far for location, service and cleanliness. The staff were very helpful in recommending local attractions and how to get there. We took taxis to most places and they didn't cost much at all. There are many shops and restaurants nearby within a short walking distance. The temple street markets were a very short walking distance across the street and there are plenty of goodies to be found there. There are about 6 free computers with internet to use at the lobby but you may have trouble finding a free computer during busy times. The bed was very clean and comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “did the job nicely”
Reviews.Author: AW_LK
Reviews.Content: All in all very good for the price we paid. £70 ish a night if i recall correctly. Check was relatively smooth and quick. The room was small but served us well. Cant comment on breakfast as we chose to eat elsewhere. Generally a great place to stay for convenience and cost. There is a "spa" to the side of the reception. Although more like a little booth the massages we had eased our aches and pains. Again very reasonable price Only thing that we a disappointment was the £50 charge for a 6pm check out time for our 2315 flight.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2011. The hotel location is in the middle of Nathan Road and it's good 20 minute walk down to the Star Ferry terminal and over to HK island although there is an underground station close by. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities as there is so much to do and see in HK. The bed though was heavenly and we both slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location,”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel really great, from the time we arrived to the day we checked out, the staff were fantastic and really helpful. We arrived ealier then the checkin time to just drop our bags off and we were checked in early which was a nice surprise. The room was really comfortable and had what we needed and was clean. The hotel was in a great location which was great as we were relying on walking and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: KimmieRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon for five nights and had an excellent stay. The hotel is in an excellent location, easy to get to from the Airport by train and shuttle bus. The shuttle bus drops you off at the Nathan Hotel which is next door to the Novotel. Easy access to the buses and MTR subway. A few minutes walk to the Temple Street and Jade markets. Lots of restaurants and shopping close by. The Hotel staff was very pleasant, polite and courteous...especially the concierge. Easy check-in and check-out. The rooms were clean and comfortable...newly renovated...with modern furnishings. The bathroom was very nice with plenty of hot water and good shower pressure. Lots of clean towels and good sized toiletries. Excellent hotel, great staff, great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - To recommend”
Reviews.Author: Juliennoise
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 6 nights and were on one of Premier floors. Everything has been excellent. Service, cleanliness, amenities, great value with breakfast, internet access and cocktails all included in Premier Room rate. The concierges were very helpful. The hotel is close to all you want. Do not miss the Kowloon Park, one of the nicest urban park close to the hotel. Perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: weecindylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in a premier room on the 15th floor which is well worth the extra money as this gets you a larger room than the standard and access to the premier lounge for afternoon tea and drinks and snacks early eveningtime. We only used those facilities a couple of times but were impressed by the drinks and snacks on offer. The premier room also got us access to unlimited wired internet which was great for keeping touch with home. The room was on the small side but then its in Hong Kong which is to be expected. The breakfast each day was good and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is centrally located in Kowloon - 2 streets away from the Night Market which is a must and a short walk to Kowloon Park which is unbelievably quiet considering the built up location. The buses and MTR are literally less than 2 minutes walk from the hotel entrance and are very cheap - I would definately recommend getting an Octopus card which can be used on all buses. the MTR and also the ferries!! Very cheap transport and great services. We travelled to loads of sights ourselves straight from the hotel - the staff in the premier lounge were most helpful with directions/maps etc.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: 5StarsFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid online in 3 months in advance for 2 rooms with adjoining doors. When we went to check in we were advised that the "price had changed". Thinking the worst, the staff member advised that they had an advertised a special recently and they would automatically credit our credit card the difference ! On top of this, the rooms were very clean and well appointed - the bed was wonderfully firm. The staff were courteous and helpful, they even refused to accept tips ! Great location - can not fault anything with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location : easy access to the trains, surrounded by choices of restaurants, supermarkets and various shops of different markets. value for money : clean, good looking, comfortable room, and at the lobby, excellent extra facilities such as internet access and concierge services. tip top service : friendly, knowledgable and efficient staff. overall great great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and hotel. Everything you need is in the room. Good location, right at the heart of Nathan Road. Near to HK MTR station. Lots of location to eat and shop at the area surrounding the hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zharne
Reviews.Content: The staff are what make this an excellent place to stay. Free internet is available in the foyer, the buffet breakfast is excellent and the Spa is definitely worthwhile trying. Best massage ever!

Reviews.Title: “FEELS LIKE HOME! EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: mzfinah
Reviews.Content: Check in- Arrived at 12am after a late and long flight, staff were extremely efficient and placed us on the 11th floor. Rooms - People are complaining about the small rooms, i don't understand why people are complaining, these rooms are spacious and well equipt. The bed was king size and just the way we liked it, got a better sleep in this bed then i do at home! The pillows were so good! i wish i could bring them home. Room Service/Cleaning - My god every day we came back from an outing our room was extreamly spotless, clean sheets every day, clean towels. It was just amazing, Novotel went up and beyond everything! Location - Located on the corner of Nathan Rd & Saigon Streets, MTR Jordan Station is 3 minutes walk! And very efficient, compared to australia! Train comes every 3 minutes! Located 3 minutes walk to Temple & Jade Markets. Theres also a 7-11 located right outside the hotel! Which came in hand! Value - At first when i first booked this hotel in australia i thought it was expensive, but now i know why! This hotel is like a well oiled machine! Everything just works! The service, the rooms, the facilities, the food, the room service gosh just amazing! We stayed 11 days in this hotel although we initally booked only 7nights we could not fault this hotel and opted to stay for the remainder of the trip. We went to book at the desk, however we went to check on the internet and it was $300 AUD cheaper so we booked on the internet and we were upgraded to the 15th floor. Not much difference in the rooms but there was an upstairs premiere room which offered drinks and snacks through out the day. Also the staff member Jason went up and beyond everything we asked for and made our trip really great, he also made good suggestions to places for shopping etc and was a great person to talk to! Food - We had buffet breakfast everyday and was really great! Everything you could eat is here! We also had their buffet dinner, one night, and OMG it was PACKED. We were lucky to even get a table as it was FULL to capacity. They had seafood, crab, beef and they were cooked wonderfully! i was so full, but we kept eating cos it was just so GOOD! Also if you are going to eat outside the hotel, DO NOT AND I REPEAT DO NOT go to the restaurant across the street, the one with the fish in the tanks, IT IS HORRIFYING! cons: the only thing bad i can say about this hotel is that, laundry is expensive. if you need to do laundry then on the next street (Cheong Lok St) there is a laundry called the "Grand" and they do laundry starting at 32$HK for 7pounds of laundry. Comared to the $600HK novotel wanted. overall EXTREMELY impressed and i will defiantly be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejseattle
Reviews.Content: There's nothing special about Novotel - it's a hotel just like any other. The location on Nathan Road on Kowloon is great, but other than that, nothing stands out about this place. We were really disappointed that you have to pay to use internet in the rooms. If you don't want to pay you can use a computer in the lobby, but there are only 4 of them, and they're always occupied. We had our laptop with us but they made us pay to use it. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Good and Reliable as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Chung1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good and reliable as usual. The rooms are large by HK standards and sound proofing is good. Despite of being a very busy hotel, the staff are helpful and attentive. Cleanliness is excellent. However, they were doing some upgrading of the locks to the rooms in the pm and some minor noise was caused but this is no issue as I was not too disturbed by it. Please keep up the good service standards!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: saffron63
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. The room was little bit tiny but it was very clean and comfortable. There was very nice Congee restaurant in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the heart of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Jovizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January 2011 on our way back from a 3 week trip around Australia and from the moment of arrival we loved this hotel. We are not usually big fans of large hotel chains, and we didn't realise that Novotels could actually be so stylish and comfortable. We were immediately greeted by friendly helpful staff from the concierge to the reception. We had booked a superior king room and even though the room wasn't massive, it was spacious enough - especially for Hong Kong. And I loved the 'a la carte' pillow options, soooo comfy. Very clean, modern, stylish bedrooms with a fabulous bedside 'dashboard' to control the lights, music, heating and even the electronic 'do not disturb' sign! The hotel is located just off Nathan Road so it's right in the hustle of Kowloon and the night markets such as Temple Street. A 15 minute walk will get you to the harbourside (along the way you will get lots of men selling 'designer watches and suits' but just don't get eye contact with them and carry on, no problem). It's really easy to get there from the airport - from the airport terminal definately use the Airport Express to Kowloon Station, even with lots of luggage, it's very spacious, clean and quick. Follow the signs for MTR and there is a large ticket desk where 2 single tickets cost us $140 which is approx £10/11, then catch a taxi from the most super efficient taxi rank we have ever seen for just a few pounds to Novotel. Easy! Upon return you can do the same, book a taxi with the concierge to Kowloon Station or they can book you on their own airport coach transfer service for approx the same price. There is a slight language barrier when you flag your own taxi down to get around HK, they act as though they don't understand you, take you the long way round to your destination and charge you more - but at the end of the day taxis are extremely cheap anyway. Just go prepared with a map to avoid getting ripped off! We are not your typical 'cheesy tourist' but I would definately recommend going down to the harbour and having your picture taken at one of the many photographer stalls during the evenings Symphony of Lights - it only costs a few quid for a photo that you wouldn't be able to do yourself! With regards to trips, we were going to book the Lantau trip through the agent in the hotel, but it's just as easy to do yourself using the super efficient public transport system at a third of the cost, and you can do it all in your own time. But an absolute must is to buy your cable car tickets for Lantau/Buddha from the hotel agent to avoid the queues! Also, it's quieter to get the peak tram earlier on in the day/midday - come late afternoon the queue is massive. If you are young and enjoy a drink we would definately recommend making your way to Soho and Lan Kwai Fong on the island, lots of bars and restaurants (and Soho is a great place in the day too with the steep street markets) and in Kowloon head down to Ashley Road for the bars. Overall we would highly recommend Novotel for a hotel based in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned, very comfortable and provides good value for money. Have stayed with family on a previous occasions and was as happy with the stay as we were the first time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: isaykenn
Reviews.Content: a hotel that you will always remember beacuse of a good service, a friendly staff, and clean hotel so you will always love to come back and stay for vacation.... GOOD LUCK NOVOTEL KEEP IT UP......

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: friendly staff and excellent service, will come back again

Reviews.Title: “'Value for Money'”
Reviews.Author: b_tsandpiper
Reviews.Content: As a Accor Member we frequently stay in Sofitel Hotels, however on this occasion there was no Sofitel so we stayed at The Novotel. To be honest it was pretty good for the price you pay in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “mr nan zhao”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very good,excellent,service ,location ,rooms,value,cleanliness ,sleep quality everything,perfect

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: DIJC124
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at novotel with a connecting rooms for the 2 rooms we checked into. The rooms were small but still very clean and modern. The buffet breakfasyt was also very nice. Internet access in the lobby was also convienent. The hotel is situated on Nathan Rd so just outside was a range of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Retired470
Reviews.Content: The Novotel on Nathan Road (Kowloon side) is a very good choice for Hong Kong. Others have commented on the small rooms - but just fine for a single business traveler or a couple, and the less than stellar breakfast - not much fresh fruit but a just OK breakfast, anyway. The location, near the Nathan Road/Jordan Road junction, is great - just two blocks from the Jordan MTR station (which gives cheap, rapid access to all of HK) (use Exit B when you arrive) the hotel is nice, clean and friendly. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and, of course, good to great shopping is just a few minutes away on foot or on the MRT - try Mong Kok for bargains or Tai Koo for a modern mall. Rooms a a bit small and a bit light on amenities but, in all respects, of a very good standard. We did not eat any meals, other than breakfast, in the hotel. The internet is $(HK)300 ($(US)40) for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: wartling
Reviews.Content: Handy to see Kowloon sights, and short (frequent) bus trip to the Harbour/ferry. Good food choice from buffet or fixed menu in very popular restaurant (lower prices for residents). Check for deals eg upgrade with breakfast, which can be good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no frills, smart rooms, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: live÷e
Reviews.Content: Renovated property, rooms were not large but well designed and styled. Good location and easy access to many parts of Kowloon. Easy to get taxi from driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services!”
Reviews.Author: NAJEI1232
Reviews.Content: Extremely impressed and pleased with the service here. The staffs were very helpful, and friendly as well. Me and my family have stayed for 4 nights. By the time we arrived, we were extremely tired and it was nice to have the staff opening the door and settling our luggages without us further asking. What i appreciate most is when i didn't have enough change for tips, the staff kept on smiling. This attitude is commendable. Another thing that i like the most is the tour information that the staff at the concierge desk gave. They were really useful. We enjoyed the restaurant ( Tim Ho Wan ) that they recommended very much. For me, good services worth more and the services here are splendid. This is our first time to Novotel and i guarantee this would not be our last !

Reviews.Title: “Valuable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's very valuable hotel with clean, good designed and properly size room. It's good that there's no annoying sound at all. Just only it's a bit far from subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYLA2627
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon for 4 nights. The service staffs were helpful and most can speak English.The location is good and is just a walking distance to Jordon MTR. There are so many shops located very near the hotel. It is easy to get around even if you decide to go public. eg. taxis,bus, mtr. The bed was soft and interior of room looks mordern. The room was bigger and of course very clean with very good housekeeping. However, it was hard for us to find 'halal' food near where we stayed,But we manage to find one when we explored further down the small roads opposite of the hotel. To conclude we had a pleasant stay there, and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends or families.

Reviews.Title: “Adequately mediocre”
Reviews.Author: treju
Reviews.Content: The Novotel on Nathan Road was a disappointing end to our trip, although admittedly it came after some pretty impressive places to stay (including the Shangri-La in KL and Sojourn Villas in Siem Reap). The room was fine, and the location of the hotel was good. The external soundproofing was great, but unfortunately it was non-existent internally so you could hear everything going on in the corridor outside. The hotel breakfast in the Square restaurant was the lowlight of the stay – the hot food was cold, all of the breads and pastries were stale and the so-called ‘fresh fruit’ was from a tinned can in syrup. The breakfast waitstaff were also the worst I have encountered in Asia. In contrast, dinner room service was good, quick and well-presented (and other than in the Square at breakfast, all the other staff we encountered were good also). Overall, the hotel had some good points and some bad points, but in its price range there are much better places to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very convenient with excellent service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “How I rate the hotel and what I think are areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would suggest that regular checks and maintenances be made e.g. water is slow to drain off in the bath-tub in Room 517. And perhaps the Management can consider providing free daily newspaper to the room upon request.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay for holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall its a perfect hotel for holiday, good service, good room and perfect location. It is a little expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Special”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff and comfortable bed, pillows and sheets. Too much furniture. Removing a table/sofa would make the place more roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road..great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and both times was excellent. Qantas crew stay here so that says it all! Staff very helpful. There are transport links close by and only few minutes by taxi to Kowloon station for train to airport. If you prefer to walk as I do only about 10 minutes walk from Star Ferry down Nathan Road

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our stopover in Kowloon!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The minute we arrived at the Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon we were impressed and pleased with our choice. The lobby, bar, restaurant and check in services are all excellent. Many of the other guests staying here were Qantas crew which we saw as a good sign. There was a desk offering tourist advice which was very helpful and was not the type that tries to sell you tours - in fact they were more than happy to explain the best way to get somewhere and draw on a map for us to go and explore independently. You can get a massage (which we did) or hot stone therapies, beauty treatments etc. at a good price within the hotel. The room was great with a large shower (no bath) and nicely laid out with good decor. The bed was HUGE and so many pillows. We have never slept so well and since we got home my husband has bought us a range of new pillows to try and recreate this! We ate breakfast in the hotel each day we were there. You can get a buffet style breakfast or you can order off the menu. The food was excellent. The bar has 'happy hour' for a few hours each evening (until 9.30pm I believe) and has a jazz singer or other performers - the bar was quite popular with guests. Jordan MTR station is a few minutes' walk away so this was very convenient for us to explore both Kowloon and other areas such as Hong Kong Island and Lantau Island. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Hong Kong and at the Novotel. Only slight downside perhaps was that we weren't able to check in early when we arrived at 5am as there were no rooms available. I would definitely stay here again if visiting Hong Kong and would strongly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JulieLee75
Reviews.Content: Worth upgrading to the premier package for the two hour cocktail package each night!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was a nice stay at this hotel i would recomend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: msnobusy
Reviews.Content: It's a good choice to stay, all staff are nice and helpful. Very convenient location, only 2 blocks from Jordan subway station. I would indeed come back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: beecon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Novotel and enjoyed our stay. Quite a good location to witness the hustle and bustle of Kowloon. Very well placed for the night market and not to far from the harbour. Beecon

Reviews.Title: “It was really ok”
Reviews.Author: EPesel
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was a little stiff, but nothing to worrie about. Food in the restaurant was excelent, and many types of food (chinese, indian, western, japan). There wasnt a shuttle to the airport, but close there was a subway station, that could take you there. In front (2 blocks away) is the Night market (bad quality and poor selection), a couple of blocks away is the ladies mart, same terribel quality but a lot a people. Better to buy from established places (same prices).

Reviews.Title: “Slightly off the beaten track but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kebuh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road as part of a Cathay Pacific free and easy package with family. As far as location goes, the Novotel is at the wrong end of Nathan Road but very close to Jordan MRT so not too much of an issue. It's a brisk 15 mins walk to the Star Ferry terminal on the Kowloon side but probably easier to take the MRT onto Hong Kong Island. There's a 7-11 directly opposite the hotel and quite a few decent restaurants around the hotel. Cheers Restaurant around the corner for traditional Cantonese food and Eki's next to the hotel for dimsum were both quite good. Check in was fast and efficient. The main lobby is on the 1st floor with 6 computer terminals for complimentary Internet access. Wifi is available in the lobby but chargeable as part of an Internet package that gives you cable access in the room and wifi in the lobby. Rooms were tight but pretty well appointed. The iPod radio dock was a nice touch. Note however that the only view you have from the window would be the dilapidated building next door! Had the buffet breakfast one day which was simple but quite good. Having said that, if you don't make a practice of stuffing yourself first thing in the morning, consider ordering off the menu ala carte! The hotel is quite close to the Jade Market which is a great place to buy trinkets but do bargain. All in all, a typical Novotel where everything is kept simple but more importantly everything works well!! I would definitely recommend the hotel for someone reasonably familiar with Hong Kong but not prepared to pay the astronomical rates at the typical tourist locations

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: luppytoons
Reviews.Content: What a hotel should be. Stayed seven nights. Prompt service in all areas. Obliging staff. Spotless rooms. Quiet although in heart of city.. Good beds. Excellent breakfast choices. Good location with easy access to transport and shopping. Good computer access. Great christmas trees from recycled bottles. All - round great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Michichan
Reviews.Content: My only real gripe would be the service. Some of the staff are very friendly and helpful but there are a few who seem snobby and aloof. Apart from the 'hot & cold' staff, I found the stay quite pleasant. The rooms are clean and modern, and the water is potable. The hotel is quite focused on the environment, which is a big plus to me. Just wish the service was better.

Reviews.Title: “Families get 50% off second room!! What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: beanthereoz
Reviews.Content: 'This hotel is very beautiful, quite spacious and best of all is the price for kids. All Novotels have a special rate or children 15 years and under where you get the second interconnecting room for 50% off. That means we paid 1750HK for 2 rooms. That work out at only $100 per night per room for us, brilliant for Hong Kong. It was also cheaper than the YMCA Salisbury hotel. Location: It is only one MTR stop away for Tsim Sha Tsui and walking distance to wonderful Jade Markets, Men's markets and outdoor Temple street restaurants. You get more of a flavour of Hong Hong around here. Across the road from the main entrance is a great restaurant called Sik Yueng? I think, run by a family. Also blt supermarket on Nathan road for night drinks, 7 free Mac computers on foyer to use 24/7, travel lady who help with anything, Starbucks around the corner, Maccas across the road, airport bus out the front. Will stay here again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: KL2012
Reviews.Content: It is handy to be located in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui. I was there for 3 nights, for leisure and to do a bit of shopping. This spot was excellent for this purposes. I can start shopping the morning and pop my goods back to the hotel room after a couple of hours and then go out and got more shopping done. Breakfast was great quality. It is noted that it is an old hotel, but recent renovation works was a success. Because it is an old building, therefore the hotel rooms are a lot more spacious than many other hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My third stay at Novotel Nathan Road in December 2010 not only disappointed me, but also, caused me inconvenience and a rather hefty phone bill. I had booked my stay as an accor member via the website. As I had two free nights, I used it to redeem the nights. Upon my arrival, I was told by the reception staff that there wasn't any traces of records of my booking and that there was nothing they could do about it and was told to go to the counter again later in the evening. In the evening when I was back, they said I had already redeemed my free night in one of the Ibis hotels in Korea in October; but the thing was that I was never in Korea at that point in time. It was obviously the mistake on the Korean side and I told the staff I could show her my passport to prove that I was never there, only to be waved off half-heartedly saying that she doesn't want to see it. She also insisted that it was impossible that we had 2 free nights each and that each member was entitled to get only one night free. The next moment, she claimed that it was up to the salesperson who sold us the membership to give us the number of nights free, and that my card was only entitled to one night free, which was already redeemed in Ibis Korea. On top of that, her tone was not only rude and snobbish, but condescending as well. She openly showed her irritation about the whole matter and kept saying that there was nothing she could do about it and that we had to settle the issue ourselves by calling the Singapore accor office. In the end, we had to make several calls back to friends who helped us get the membership, questioning the number of free nights, as well as making calls to the Singapore accor office since 'there was nothing the hotel could do' and that 'we had to settle the issue ourselves'. While waiting for her to settle some stuff in the room behind the counter, a gentleman walked over requesting for a bucket of ice to be sent to his room. This other gentleman was waiting for him by the side as he was at the counter. When another counter staff called to request for a bucket of ice to be sent, she started gossiping about the two gentlemen, and was also giggling about it, not caring that there were other hotel guests around who could hear what she was saying. That issue aside, the room was quite disappointing too. I entered the room noticing that a part of the sofa seat was missing and asked the reception about it, only to be told it was meant to be this way. The previous 2 times I was here, there were two parts of the sofa. Next, I noticed a burn at the side of the sofa. I didn't think too much about it as I'd spend most of the time outside. Although the location of the hotel is very favourable, if this is the kind of furniture and service you provide, I don't think I will have pleasant stay. In conclusion, the service of the hotel staff has disappointed me greatly. Never have I encountered such unpleasant and unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here purely for its excellent location but the hotel certainly has its faults”
Reviews.Author: BangkokPhil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Hong Kong five times in the past six years and this is our third stay at the Novotel, Nathan Road. We choose it basically for one reason - the location. You're a five-minute walk to Temple St market and many good restaurants, and Jordan MTR station is on the doorstep. Once you're on the underground line, you can be anywhere in Hong Kong (either the mainland or the island) within 10-40 minutes. The location of the Novotel Nathan Road really can't be faulted. Decent hotels are generally expensive in Hong Kong and I feel that the Novotel is definitely overpriced for what is basically a smallish room with an uncomfortable bed (I started to get backache on the third day) but on the plus side, it's nice to see a hotel room with a very good selection of cable TV channels. I haven't been impressed with the staff attitude on previous stays at the Novotel. I've found the reception staff a bit surly to be honest, but things have definitely improved and the concierge staff were the epitome of efficiency and the reception staff always helpful. My major complaint about this hotel - and probably the reason I won't stay here again - is the absence of wi-fi in the rooms. You can't make guests mess around with LAN cables in this day and age. The better hotels all have wi-fi in the rooms and that's the way it should be. Wi-fi is available in the hotel lobby but it's prohibitively expensive. The hotel does provide about six computers in the lobby for guests to use free but as you would expect, guests - particularly teenagers - often abuse the priviledge and 'hog' the computers with little consideration for other guests. Although the spacious bar area is quite a nice place to relax, the hotel really does need to do something about the rather pokey lobby area, which has seating for barely a dozen people. It's always nice to relax in a hotel lobby for half an hour after a day's sightseeing or to make your plans with maps and guidebooks at the beginning of the day. However the Novotel lobby is not a place you feel like spending time in. It's busy, noisy and far from comfortable. In conclusion, it's rather a no-frills four-star hotel that enjoys an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMaramara
Reviews.Content: The Novotel on Nathan Road was great! Perfect location for shopping, good local food around every corner and a short walk to a train station. My husband and I got an Octopus card and made the most of walking to and training to discover this bustling city. The concierge staff were brilliant. We found that the taxi drivers weren’t able to understand much English, so the concierge staff would write our destination in Cantonese for us – so so helpful!! The food on offer was great, especially the breakfasts. The bar staff were very attentive and the singers were very good. Our room was a little bit small, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower was nice and big. We would definably stay here again when we next go to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good but otherwise unremarkable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Adam_5703
Reviews.Content: The hotel seriously is unremarkable. If this review comes across as nit-picky, its because I have to say SOMETHING... PROS: -good location: it is close to the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island, shopping (Nathan Road, night market, etc) and transit options (MTR/Subway). -my room was quiet (but did have a terrible view of an alley) -Bed was slightly firm but still comfortable. -free internet in the lobby CONS: -far from the airport -the lobby was kind of hectic and noisy with lots of people coming and going. It wasn't the peaceful welcome that most hotels offer. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers going to Hong Kong. Although I don't have much bad to say about it, this certainly wasn't a stand-out hotel. The location is probably its best selling feature.

Reviews.Title: “A great Place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the service and the staff were extremely friendly. Nothing was too much. The meals were excellent and value for money. Would recommend this hotel for any one wishing to enjoy the comfort and location for everthing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The check in staff is excellent. Helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: tatonka
Reviews.Content: My plane schedule was changed by the airlines at the last minute, so instead of the three days I had already reserved, I would need an extra day. I figured there would not be a problem as I was already going to be staying there! WRONG! They wanted me to pay over $350.00 to add one night to my stay! What a rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 small children and 2 teenagers. We booked 2 rooms and on arrival were given interconnecting rooms. The rooms were what was expected from Novotel. Staff spoke fluent English and were very helpful and pleasant. Happy hour and live music was a bonus after a day at Disneyland and a day of local shopping. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, food and staff”
Reviews.Author: gcrefs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten days. Was fortunate to book the Executive Level rooms for $150AUD per night including taxes. Executive Level included continental breakfast each morning on Level 15 or full buffet breakfast downstairs. Afternoon tea with some pastries, sandwiches and fruit and drinks. Open bar from 6pm - 8pm nightly with some hot snacks included. All very good and supplemented the stay. The rooms are typical of Hong Kong standard being small but space is used very well. Being on the Executive Level we had our own check in point (Level 15) and basically a concierge for ourselves from 6am - 11pm daily on this level. These staff had a great knowledge of the area and can offer some expert advice to make your stay in Hong Kong memorable. Less than a 2 minute walk to the Temple Street Night Markets from this location. I do believe these markets to be superior to those at Mongkok. Laundry facilities located close by and charged at around $2AUD per pound to have washed and dried. Very good service. This hotel service was very expensive so do take the time to get the location off the concierge. We found the man near Temple Street to be very efficient with a 4 hour turn around if you dropped your stuff off early. The room had a daily turn down service, complimentary shoe shine, robes, slippers and daily paper included. The room came with internet facilities (free) and if you did not have a computer with yo - two computers are provided with unlimited internet access at the Premier Lounge on Level 15. Very close to Jordan MTR station. Great resturants close by. The hotel buffet was around $35AUD (including taxes) whilst we stayed here each night. This included a great selection or chinese, international and western foods. A great carvery and lamb cutlets each night (yum!). This was a special deal whilst we were here. 30% discount to non hotel guests and 40% discount to hotel guests. They have an awesome day spa as well. Very nice facilities and very reasonably priced for the services offered. One final tip - shop around for your dollar exchange when you get here. We could have secured $7.20HKD to the $1 AUD before leaving Australia. When we got here on the street we could get $7.20 - $7.64HKD (no commission) for our dollar. These money eschangers are everywhere and will sometimes negotiate for your business!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Very good location”
Reviews.Author: WordTraveller007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for 4 nights, check in was quick and room was nice. The location of the hotel is also very good as it’s about 2-3min walk to Jordan station. The hotel is around the corner from Nathan road, where you have starbucks and a 24hrs McDonalds (also a supermarket outside the hotel seven – eleven). Temple street market is about 5min walk and also you could actually walk to TST station in about 20mins walk. Overall the hotel was good/clean/very good location, hotel has 4 pc’s where you can access the internet.

Reviews.Title: “So hard to find”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: Wow - don't walk to this hotel from the bus....it was very hard to find. The main entrance is on side street and you need directions to find. After finding the place things were better. Checkin - too slow due to my last minute reservation not yet in their system. Staff seemed nice, but marginal training. Room - I liked in. Internet was costly extra on top of a insanely high nightly room rate. This was the one big negative. The hotel is not worth over $300 USD that was charged. I would recommend this hotel for a reasonable rate as the location is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for the quality of rooms”
Reviews.Author: vyomesh
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Excellent staff. The drawabck is tiny rooms, but then you are in Hongkong so cant crib a lot. The downside was the rooms were heavily carpeted leading to difficulty in getting too comfortable with all the dust that comes in along with the carpets. A room of this size should be either wooden floored or tiled to give the feeling of crispness and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel....a GREATOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November with my wife for a couple of days as i was attending a conference in the area. Excellent location, right on Nathan Street (Hong Kong's Main street) 3 mins walking distance to Jordan Metro station which takes you all over HK. I would advise walking down Nathan road all the way to Tsim Tsha Tsui admiring all the high-end stores along Canton Road and taking the ferry across the harbour to HK island. The room was clean and very well equipped and we got free internet for our stay. Very friendly staff, got upgraded since i am an Accor member. Booked last minute so the price was steep, must book in advance to avail great discounts. Lovely hotel, excellent location. Will definitely stay here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Kowloon - Good Value Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Buffet meals were very good and popular so booking ahead is recommended. Location in Nathan Road was good for both shopping and access to site seeing transport. While the hotel facade fronted Nathan Road, entry was in a side street. We appreciated the complimentary bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were tiny. Check-in was delayed as the reception staff asked if I could accept a room for the handicapped as the hotel was running low on double-bed rooms, even through my room was pre-booked 3 months back! I had late check out of 2pm due to Accor membership, but was disturbed on check out day by reception to indicate that I had overstayed my checkout time of 12pm. Poor communication among staff.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Nahthan Road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is good for those who want to be away from the busy mongkok area and is convenient with the Jordan MTR, easily accessible to many other locations nearby

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location location location! This hotel is in a great location. Other reviews have commented on nearby sights - all within walking distance. We stayed in a Club room - well worth the extra expense. Room was very stylish - very pleased with services provided in club lounge. Don't bother using the tour desk in the main lobby - we found the staff member to be quite unhelpful. Concierge staff in club lounge were much better informed and went out of their way to make sure our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it's a great hotel, with a great distance and location to central Hong Kong,although the neighbourhood and surrounding little bit messy with shop and traffic at nathan road..but overall this hotel service is excellent..we had travel with child,arrived in the early morning but the hotel staff provide us to get early checkin at 10.00 AM

Reviews.Title: “spacious, friendly, convenient, stylish”
Reviews.Author: kewpielovesyou
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel! forget the average exterior, the hotel is very modern, clean, friendly. the rooms are spacious - amenities are very complete. the hotel is also conveniently located 5mins by taxi from Kowloon Station - where the airport express stops. I went from getting off the plane at HK airport to the hotel in under an hour. free wifi in the lobby area too. an excellent hotel. I would definitely recommend to anyone and I would return myself. Added bonus: hotel is across from a precinct of food! you won't go hungry. 7-11 downstairs if you need anything and food, food food and shopping is just down the road - one side is Tsim Sha Tsui, the other is Mongkok. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great location and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: F_B_SSydney
Reviews.Content: I stay in this Hotel very often sometimes up to once a week with my work travels ....... The Hotel has small but very comfortable rooms......They have a good breakfast and Lunch is very popular in the Hotel ......The concierge staff on the Ground Floor (Bee and the Boys) are extremely helpful and if they are not flat out ....Nothing is a problem .....Excellent service ...... The great thing about the Hotel is its location ....You can walk to the Night markets from the hotel ..The Jordan MTR (Train station) is a short walk ,,,,,,And so the hotel is Very convenient to get anywhere from .........Also the bar has Live entertainment every night and it is very easy to get stuck in the Bar and not get to dinner till late .......!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: JowenKL
Reviews.Content: The front office and concierge staff were very accommodating and helpful with our queries throughout our stay. I love the fact that the hotel provides free use of computers (iMac at that!) at the hotel lobby. My only gripe is there's no free wifi in the hotel. The room was a tad bit tight but more importantly it was clean, comfy with a chic and modern outlook. Really nice. Love their toiletries! Excellent location; local food and shops all around. There is a decent porridge and noodles restaurant right across the road from the hotel. The nearest MTR station, Jordan station is only about 10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I frequent this hotel for the past few years. I think facilities need refurbishment. Some of the tables and cabinet are really worn out! But I like this hotel nonetheless and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was very busy the staff went out of their way to help, very very pleasant. The room was a bit small but comfortable and clean. The location was very good to most things you want to do. The food was excellent a great range for breakfast and the buffet at night was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Money for value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good. But the service and the size of room is only average. The money for value ratio is not high at all. For the same price or even a lower price, I can get a better room and service at the Regal Hotel at Causeway Bay, which is also a very convenient area in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the premium floor with free breakfast, tea and cocktails. Clean rooms, great location; short walking distance to Jordan MTR. Hotel within walking distance to Yue Wah and Wing On Departmental Store. Will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “stay at novotel nathan road”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this compact standard room comes with comfort bed. location is the prime point for this hotel, just next to Nathan Rd shopping area near Jordan MTR station is the next key point for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that provides good quality, convenience to Hong Kong amenities and services then you can not go past the Accor Nathan Rd. The hotel provided the full complement of services at a high standard and was so close to all that I was looking for in a short stay in Hong Kong - ready access to great shopping, restaurants and the MTR train service. I would have no hesitation in staying there next visit to Hong Kong. Greg Tomkins

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, excellent place to stay, good service and i surely will come back again. Thank you. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: NipaT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nathan Hotel for 3 nights with my spouse on vacation, with a room on the Nathan floor. The room was small but well laid out with a LCD TV and complimentary internet (we used wireless and the access was troublefree). In the bathroom bath robes and complimentary slippers were provided. The hair dryer however had seen its better days. Buffet breakfast was included in our room rate. There was a good selection of fruits, juices, breads, pastries and a hot buffet including some Chinese specialities. A chef would cook the eggs the way you like it. The hotel is in a good location, only some minutes walk from Jordan subway stations. Getting to/from the hotel is easy with the A21 bus.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dewskit
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday following a 2 week stay at this hotel. Unfortunately I was travelling whilst recovering from a ruptured Achilles trendon which made getting around difficult. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, showing me how to use the Service Lift thus avoiding the escalator to the first floor. Someone always appeared to hold doors open with a smile and friendly greeting. The room was immediately changed on arrival at reception to one with a shower as it was impossible for me to get in and out of a bath, and the bathroom was very well laid out. The bedroom was plenty large enough for the two of us and the beds were extremely comfortable. Air conditioning kept the room comfortable and double glazed windows kept traffic noise on a very busy road outside to an almost inaudible level. Everything was spotlessly clean and the hotel seemed to be maintained to a very high standard. The dinner buffet was almost bewildering in its choice and everything was served at its very best. I would unhesitatingly return here at any time in the future

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed on at Nathan hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyronn
Reviews.Content: Our stay started badly to say the least. We did not arrive for check in until 4:30 and our room was still not ready we complained to management who gave us a token food voucher for the buffet the following night which offset dissappointment a little. We were also on the upper superior rooms floor so certainly expected better service. Positives: - great location, lounge bar for superior floor with free nibbles and alcohol is a great touch, free Internet. Negatives: entry level had awful musty damp smell the whole time we were there - no chef made omelets at breakfast - rooms are tiny and look tired - service at breakfast is terrible , all staff look miserable and everything is a chore for them

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tristar500
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the novotel for five nights at the start of october. we paid the extra to stay in a preimum room which we found was large enough for the two of us. the bed was very large and very comfatable. best nights sleep for a long time. the bathroom was large with a large walk in shower. every morning we availed of the contiental style breakfast with plenty of cornflakes toast ham cheeses and cakes to be enjoyed. in the afternoons being able to avail of afternoon tea in the preimum lounge was a good way to relax after a busy day out and about and in the evenings back to the lounge for drinks before dinner was a good way to have a chat with fellow travelers. also by staying in the preimum rooms you had free internet connection. the hotel is located centrally in kowloon. handy for jordan mtr. it had bus stops near by and only 15mins away by taxi from hong hom train station for a trip to china i'am planning to go back to hong kong early next year i will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to see Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: theleavers_03
Reviews.Content: Being a Novotel it lived up to expectations as a great value hotel. It was in th middle of Kowloon close to the Jordan MTR which got us everywhere we wanted to go. The restaurant was great for breakfast and dinner - they gave us a 40% discount card which made eating in very affordable. It was a busy hotel with tour groups and Qantas staff. The rooms were small with the three us of - but we only used them for sleeping! Cost of a taxi is about $HKD235 with one large suitcase from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to Nathan RD and the shopping areas. Its well located to public transport buses and trains. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel is clean. Overall was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, spotlessly clean, well equipped, breakfast not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: jammydodger0905
Reviews.Content: You couldn't get a more perfect location than this hotel. It is modern, wonderfully clean and the rooms are very well equipped. They even have decent sized mugs with spoons for your tea and coffee, unlike many hotels that give tiny cups and those awful stirring sticks!! The one and only thing that lets it down is the breakfast, which on first glance looks great, but when you get up close and personal, its rather boring and basic! In it's favour again are the decent mugs for a lovely cup of tea! :-) No free internet, but it is reasonably priced for 24 hours £7 (€10). Sleep-wise, the beds are nice an comfy, however one small gripe is that the housekeepers could do with being a little more considerate! Banging trolleys and chatting in the hallways doesn't aid restful sleep! All in all though a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Lambe8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Kowloon for 4 nights and we´re quite positively surprised as it is a nice hotel at a good price. The rooms are small but nice. The interior is modern and makes a good impresion. The bed ist very comfortable. The staff was very nice and friendly. We received a lovely honeymoon package, which we apreciated a lot, as it was a very nice and attentive gesture. A big negative point is that there is no free internet, however they have 6 IMacs in the lobby where you can use the internet for free. I would say that during day Kowloon is the better location but during the night not so much as there is much more going on on hong kong side and the last MTR to Kowloon departs before 01:00 a.m. A cab from Central or Wanchai on Hong Kong side is a little expensive. So depending on whether your focus lies more on day or night life I would or wouldn´t recommend the Novotel on Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service, Great Staff, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: globalman1234
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels in Hong Kong but for me this was by far the best service experience. Even better than some of the five star hotels. The location was ideal for us for shopping on Nathan Road. Kowloon Park was nearby for the kids and the concierge recommended the Evening Market which was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The closest MTR station is Jordan, a 3 minute walk. Jordan is 2 stops from Central on Hong Kong Island. The best part for me was the friendliness of the staff. It was always postive, supportive and helpful. In particular, the concierge team could not have been more helpful. There are also Mac stations in the lobby and they give you free internet access. On a final point, the bar has live music every evening - worth paying a visit and enjoying the relaxing and lively atmosphere. Will only stay here on my next visit to HK. I recommend everyone to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Andy123Northampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and upgraded upon check in to a club room which gave us breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails on the executive floor. You also get the services of the concierge, which was good as we were able to check in online and print boarding passes for our return flight. Our room was a good size, with TV, tea/coffee making and a mini bar fridge. The view was not good but the alternative was to overlook Nathan Road and maybe this would have been noisy? The bathroom had toiletries and shower. Breakfast buffet in the club room included tea, coffee, juice, cereals, yoghurt, toast, meat, cheese and pastries. The club room was not overly large so did get busy as did the 2 computers up here. There were also 4 Macs in the lobby which were usually busy. Afternoon tea included sandwiches, biscuits , cakes and soft drinks. The location of the hotel is great (actually the entrance is on Saigon Street just off Nathan Road), very close to Jordan metro station (if you don’t mind walking then maybe 20-25 minutes walk to star ferry etc), and also close to Temple Street night market. The CityFlyer bus from the airport A21 stops just around the corner on Nathan Road (you need to buy a ticket before boarding or have the correct money 33HK). We needed to ring the bell when approaching the correct stop, which was a little tricky but thanks to fellow passengers do able - ask on the bus if you aren’t sure. We ate in the bar once as the restaurant was fully booked but the menu was the same and the food was good (we also got 2 for 1 drinks after 6pm which was a bonus). We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay especially after 2 weeks in Delhi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good service and a lovely clean room, even though compact. Service was excellent and location very central to everything. Walked most places but handy to transport. Just spent 2 weeks in Delhi so things are bound to seem perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the upgraded rooms on the 14th level. It has it's own checkin area and breakfast area. The hotel is clean, modern and in a great area close to the Temple St night markets and jade markets. There are also shops and easy access to taxi's out on Nathan road. The only slight issues we had with this hotel was that the porters did not bring up our bags (we had to fetch these ourselves) and the breakfast area was poorly serviced (they ran out of plates, didn't clear tables) and there was only toast and some sliced cheese or smoked salmon to choose from. Very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Novotel”
Reviews.Author: munna50099
Reviews.Content: One thing that has bothered me at all Novotel's is the quality of service and the friendlyness of the staff. Maybe I am wrong, but the Novotel's do need to learn to train their staff better in attentiveness and warmth which i feel is lacking. Situated in Tsim Sha Tsui the bustling area of Hong Kong the hotel offers a good location for being in and around the hot spot of Hong Kong. The food and service at best can be described as so-so. The rooms are quiet, cozy and comfortable, but for the price this hotel commands, Im sure travellers can get a better choice. The lobby of the hotel is minimalistic and the overall ambience keeps you wondering (about the money you paid)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the first-timer”
Reviews.Author: Chris186493
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 9-night stay at this hotel. As first time visitors to HK the location was spot on. The staff were helpful & friendly and the free internet access a huge bonus. From the airport we took the Airport Express to Kowloon station & then the complimentary shuttle bus (K1) to the Eaton. The Novotel is just 1 block away - literally a 2 minute walk even with cases. Entrance on Saigon Street. With the MTR being so close by, the world is your oyster (or Octopus) with everywhere easily accessable. As well as taking organised trips to Maccau & Lantau Island, we took ourselves off to Hong Kong island to ride on the trams (Ding Dings), see the Convention Centre where the handover took place in 1997 and Ocean Park (MTR to Admirality then follow signs to Ocean Park bus no. 629. Bus tickets + admission fee can be bought at the kiosk. Well worth it for the Pandas alone. For the non-too adventurous of the local cuisine, try the Knutsford Steps area. From the Novotel, go down the left hand side of Nathan Road and left into Kimberley Road. Turn left again at Ben & Jerrys and follow the sign. All tastes catered for, Italian, Spanish, Indian,Thai, Australian and American. Something for everyone. We hope we manage back one day and would definitely consider the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: p_pebbles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to get to, we took a bus from the airport and it dropped us 100m from the hotel if that. We also caught a bus back to the airport - all you do is catch it from the other side of Nathan Road - it was the cheapest option and for 3 it cost us around $80HK each way. We splurged and went for a premier rm. The check in on the 15th floor is great. Staff were very polite and helpful. The free breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks were great. 2 computers with free intenet access as well. We had a 6 year old and he would often fill up at afternoon tea and it meant we could go out to dinner without him being unhappy about our choice of food. The room although spacious was fine. Very clean and tidy, nice decor - don't expect an exciting view from your hotel window! Rooms were very quiet, great kingsize bed and your choice of the type of pillow you wanted. The spa on the 1st floor was great - I recommend a massage or two, especially after walking about all day. The hotel was really well located. The MTR was not far away - just get an Octopus Card - we used this to get about all the time, you can even use it in shops and food places too. The night market and ladies market are not too far from the hotel. We found it so easy to get about from this hotel. Langham Place is worth going to and so is the Festival Walk mall. It was great being able to shop until 11pm at night. We found a great all day dim sim place just up from the hotel on Nathan road - left hand side of road just past the McDonalds. Although the selection is not vast it has all the staple dim sim and cost us less than $20HK for dinner - we had lots to eat. Although we ran out of time to go into China I would recommend you use the hotel service on the 1st floor to book this tour. They do all the work for you on your visa and you don't have to wait at the border. You can also get your tickets for dineyland and Ocean park at the counter too. We stayed a 10 days in HK and had a ball, the hotel was perfect for our stay. The only disappointment is it does not have a pool. The ma

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carey37
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive room and the service was excellent.The room was beautiful. We had our own check in area and in the evening enjoyed the complimentary canapes and drinks in the cosy executive lounge on our floor.The gym facilities are excellent.The hotel is in a great location.Really appreciated the complimentary internet in the lobby and never had a problem getting access to one of the PC's.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location (near MTR and Temple street night market)”
Reviews.Author: Vaporiser
Reviews.Content: We took the Airport Express to Kowloon station. The Novotel is on a small side street from Nathan Road in Kowloon and close to Jordon MTR Station. Check-inn is on the 1st floor up the escalators. Our rooms were not ready yet so we had to wait a bit. There is free internet in the lobby and paid internet in the room. Our room was very small but nice and just comfortable for 2 people. There was not much room for our luggage so it had to go on the sofa, this is Hong Kong! The hotel only has one restaurant in which we had our breakfast. Breakfast was good with hot and cold items. The only thing I personally missed was some cheese and cold cut meat. At 09:45 the buffet was half emptied and we were told it is closing in a few minutes. Many tables still had cups and plates on it of guests who already had left. I felt staff were prioritising closing the buffet instead of looking after guests. The hotel is close to Temple Street (Night Market) so you’ll never be hungry. Food stalls are open from the afternoon to 04:00 in the morning. We had some food and beers in the night market after midnight and it was still busy then. We had a very nice stay in Novotel Nathan road and will stay there again. Top points for location and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: NEMandPJE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 8 nights on a room only basis. It was our first time to Hong Kong and the whole experience was fantastic. The hotel was extremely good - we had a superior room and could not fault it. The staff were friendly, efficient and helpful, and room service was speedy. The two meals we had in our room were very nice. The hotel is well located and literally a stone's throw from some great shopping, two MTR stations and loads of bus routes. I would certainly return to Hong Kong and would not hesitate in staying at this hotel again. My partner and I would highly recommend visiting Victoria Peak - try it during daylight hours and when darkness falls if you can. Shopping is to die for, if not a bit overwhelming! The best market we found was the one at Stanley, but the others are fun. We also liked Toast Box on Nathan Road for coffee and cake! Oh, and do get an Octopus card..... The freedom that gives you really does make the holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LCS2010
Reviews.Content: Travelled with two children,ages 10 & 12. We had interconnecting rooms which was great. Bathroom was clean, beds comfy and breakfast yummy. Great location as you can get the MTR close by, 7/11 across the road, super market up the street and all the life of Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a long haul stopover”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitravellersx2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here on route to London. Central,easy to get to from airport and because on (or just round the corner from) Nathan Rd easy walking distance to shops/amenities/sights. Found the room compact but absolutely ok and comfortable for 2 people. Good shower. Staff pleasant and helpful. Restaurant fine for dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel in a good Kowloon location”
Reviews.Author: BB_in_BJ
Reviews.Content: I had a 5-day family stay here this year, booking two adjoining rooms. The hotel has a pretty good location, with famous Nathan Road around the corner and strollable (20 min or so) to the harbor. We couldn't decide between this and the Mira (which is much closer to the harbor) and chose this because I was A-Club Platinum, which as it turned out didn't even get me an extra smile. I was hoping for an upgrade, and when I stayed at the Novotel Century a while back before I was A-Club elite I got upgraded even then. Oh well. Check-in took an extraordinary long time, not sure why. Noticed that an entire flight crew which came in five minutes after me all got checked in during my wait and I still had to wait another five minutes after that. Rooms were small but comfortable. Felt modern and clean. We had two rooms on a low floor and our views were of an apartment building that was very close. Lobby has four macs with free internet (expensive in rooms).
