It being Hong Kong we ate at a variety of places, but did spend one afternoon in the adjacent restaurant--looked like it was part of the hotel but not. Dim sum there was terrific, and even though it was packed we got served relatively quickly. There is a taxi queue right outside the hotel and we cabbed it everywhere. If traveling alone I prefer the subway and the Jordan stop is only a few minutes away. I would say that service was subpar (check-in) but the bellhops were nice and good with directions. There is a tour desk in the lobby and the girl here was very helpful with answering questions about Macau visas. So overall it wasn't too bad. I would say this is a 3.5-star hotel but I bumped it up because we got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: G0dL0vesU
Reviews.Content: Since I have had the privilege of using Tripadvisor for many of my travels, I figured it is time that I contributed too. My most recent hotel stay in Novotel Nanthan Road in Kowloon, Hong Kong was a really good experience. The hotel nice, clean and convenient. My extended family and I stay in this hotel for 2 nights, and I must say that it was really a pleasure stay. And I must add that I am impressed on how the hotel staff dealt with my complain, as they gave us a room with a King size bed, when we had booked for twin beds. Since they did not have any other rooms available, they offered to put in an extra bed. The only drawback is that, like most Hong Kong properties, while the entrance may be on the street level the actual reception is on the 2nd level. Here there is only one set of narrow escalators that allow hotel guest to go up and down. During our stay one of the escalators was being repaired, this mean that the guests had to take turns to walk up or down the escalators.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: bossladyPerth
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at the novotel. spotless,well appointed rooms. great decor. arrived early morning was given a room six hours early. staff extremely helpful. would definately stay here again next time in hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: ravensilvers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room for 3 nights in September 2010. The hotel name is somewhat misleading; the hotel doesn't face Nathan Road, despite its address and name. The entrance is at the end of Saigon Street. (If your taxi driver drops you off at Nathan Hotel, the Novotel is about a block away.) Check-in is on the second floor (known as 1st floor in HK). Staff were quite friendly and always willing to help. Across the street, there is a 24 hour 7/11 and lots of small eating spaces; right across the main road is a large department store. There are six computers in the main lobby with free Internet access, which was much appreciated - otherwise we would have to pay for the Internet in our room. We'd requested a room on a high floor, no smoking and we got it (14th floor, below the Premier Floor on the 15th). Make sure you request a no-smoking room when booking, because we could smell the cigarette smoke on other floors when the lift door opened on them. As one of us has asthma, this would have been a issue. The room was relatively spacious for the two of us. There was a great big TV with a great selection of channels in several languages, and also a nifty iPod dock clock-radio. The hotel is near Jordan MTR station, but for us it was more than 2 mins walk; this is probably because we couldn't find the closest exit. Temple Street is 15 minutes away by foot. Disneyland is about 45 mins away by MTR (tickets are available at the tour desk). The HK Cultural Centre, where you can watch the evening light show at the harbour, is 15-20 minutes away by taxi. It's a pretty good hotel, despite the somewhat misleading address. Would stay here again when we're in HK, because of the good location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, great location in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: wwwales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for 7 nights in Sept 2010 - the hotel is in a side street off Nathan Road so the entrance isn't on Nathan Road itself. The hotel staff are excellent - very polite and friendly, the rooms (I had a room with king size bed) were a good size and the bathrooms very nice. The rooms (and hotel) is spotless, very clean with flat screen Sony TV. The window in my room looked out onto a back alley but by the time I'd got back to the hotel each day I was so tired I didn't need a view. Across the street from the hotel entrance is a small cafe which does meals from morning till night - cheap prices and good quality and a 7-11 a couple of doors down. There is a starbucks around the corner and plenty of other places to eat within walking distance. Across Nathan Road and then 2 streets away (5mins walk) is the Temple Street Night Market....you have to go see this! Also 15-20mins walk up Nathan Road is Ladies Market....the markets alone are great evening entertainment. If you want a good value spotlessly clean hotel with great staff and in a good location (MTR train station is 2mins away) then you can't go wrong with the Novotel. TIP: if you are coming from the airport buy a MTR Tourist Pass - you get a return trip on the airport express and 3 days unlimited travel on the MTR system - the 3 days start from the time you first use the card so if you start at 1pm it finishes at 1pm 3 days later. The card although it doesn't say it is also an Octopus card which you can charge up with money and use in shops (saves struggling for change).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location, good value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: btandrmb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Nathan Rd, in the centre of the Kolwoon district in Hong Kong. Step out the door, turn right and within 20m you are on Nathan Rd. It is a clean, comfortable hotel with reasonable sized rooms. We stayed on the 10th floor, right on the front corner and while it was a fantastic view, I wouldn't want to be any lower as road traffic might be an issue. We used is as a shower and sleep base and didn't spend too much time in the room, but is was modern, clean and comfortable. The price we paid was very good as well. The staff were friendly and always willing to assist. Didn't use much of the facilities so I can't really comment, other than to say breakfast was good enough and the happy hour cocktails hit the spot. There is a 7/11 across the road so you can get all your supplies and fill up the fridge. If you are looking for a reasonably inexpensive hotel in the centre of Hong Kong, I would definately put the Novotel on your list. Overall score for this hotel woulb be a 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: CYKL
Reviews.Content: This review is late. I actually stayed in July 2009. I booked the rooms on its official website. The rooms were not ready when we arrived after the check-in time. So we were offered a free breakfast for the following morning. The rooms were pleasant and of a good size. Bathroom was also clean and adequate. The nearest station to the hotel is Jordan Station. And there are eateries near the hotel, so finding something to eat was not a problem. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel with pillows selections!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerokero
Reviews.Content: A splendid hotel and a near perfect experience staying here. the only blemish is due to the check in staff which isnt friendly at all. She didnt bother to ask me for a twin bed or a kingsize bed eventhough i am checking in with a female companion. when i go downstairs to change room again, she did help me change but the unfriendlyness is still there. other than this, great, clean room, 5 minutes walk from MTR and 5 minutes walk from temple street. I would greatly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent deal.”
Reviews.Author: nikkisue79
Reviews.Content: We stayed one the 14th floor (Premier floor) for 1 week in August-Sept. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We found the staff to be pleasant-check in and out were both very quick. We took advantage of the cocktail time (perk on the Premier floor) only 2 times, but it was very nice each time. For breakfast, we choose to dine in the restaurant downstairs-the buffet was perfect for our family-and included as part of the Premier floor. The room was a decent size-smaller than American hotels for sure, but typical of Asian locations. (Our family is American, but live in Japan, so we are accustomed to things being smaller than is typical in the USA.) We traveled with our 4 and nearly 2 year old sons. A rollaway was provided free of charge for our 4 year old, and the chaise lounge was the perfect size for our younger son to sleep on. We just pushed them together to avoid the younger one falling off. I highly recommend staying on the Premier floor-free breakfast, free internet, dedicated check in/out desk, free cocktails-all worth it! We got a great deal on Expedia, so we were extremely pleased at all that our room included for the price we paid! While this is certainly not a luxury hotel that caters to your every whim, it's nicer than most "typically" affordable hotels are-and certainly one of the nicest places we, as a family on a budget, have stayed. If you are expecting white-glove service, and someone to attend to your every need, no matter what, book somewhere like the Peninsula and suck up the price. If you're interested in a very nice, affordable place, go here. It might not be quite white-glove service, but it's definitely not anywhere close to Motel 6. Overall, we were extremely pleased with the hotel-the location was perfect (near shopping, and more importantly, right near the Jordan MTR station), the room was great, they were quite child-friendly, and overall made for a very pleasant stay in Hong Kong. We will definitely seek out Novotel Hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the Jordan area but not my favourite Novotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Globebugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and that was pushing it! However I had to give it a go just once so I could compare it to other Novotel's stays in Hong Kong. Stayed on the Executive Floor here, as this hotel is cheaper than Century and Citygate . Cons: Check in was divided into Exec level and lobby reception. We should have gone straight up to Level 15.... our mistake as it took a full 20 mins to check in at the lobby. It was excruciatingly slow even though there were no other guests checking in at the time. The other perks associated with Exec Level are the continental breakfast, afternoon tea, evening cocktail hour and free Wi Fi in the room and lounge area. The internet came in handy as the terminals in the lobby were always occupied. The eating area was quite small and crowded in the morning if you chose the wrong time to turn up. The standard continental fare got you started for the day but was a little repetitive after the first day. Be wary, the reception guy pointedly looks at his watch before letting you in the lounge for the 1000 am cut off. We turned up at 0945! Did not get back for tea but tried the cocktail hour which did save some money on drinks and a few snacks. The room seemed no different than the floors below. Although the room was contemporary with space saving ideas, it felt small and closed in. Too much detail around the bed, a chaise lounge that we used to put clothes on as there was not a lot of space in the sliding wardrobe. This is a strange; dual set up as the door served to close the bathroom but left the light on in the wardrobe (not a very green idea). Also it flooded the room with light in the middle of the night if the bathroom door needed closing. Pros: Nice LCD TV on the wall, a great rain shower in the oversized glass area (although again, not a very water saving idea). Except for the drone of the lifts, the 15th floor was ultra quiet for a good night's sleep (a must for me in hotels) Other than the internet and drinks, I don't know that this level is worth the extra money. There is a range of eateries on Nathan Rd that may be more appetising for breakfast. The hotel location is great for the A21 CityFlyer bus from the airport. Stop #10 just a few metres from the side entry of the hotel in Saigon St. There is an underpass adjacent to the hotel that takes you across Nathan Rd to the A21 bus stop, # 8 back to the Airport (HKD $33.00 per person each way). Look for the yellow and red sign. We had an Octopus card that gives you access to this bus plus the MTR, other buses, trams and ferries. This saves time looking for exact change each time. Apart from a small handling fee, any excess left over can be refunded along with the HKD $50.00 deposit. This card is valid in so many other areas, (McDonalds for one) and it can be value added at most MTR stations. In a city this crowded, it makes a difference on how quickly you get from A to B. We kept ours for any future trips to HKG. The shopping from this hotel is an added bonus. If you turn left along Nathan Rd then you get to the main tourist area. Turn right and you can walk to Mongkok including the ladies market. Across and along a few streets is the Temple St night markets. This is not your typical tourist area and is crowded with local shoppers. There is a frenetic buzz all around. Would I stay again? Probably not as I do like to have some kind of view. If you like being off the beaten tourist track, this hotel and area has it in spades.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: blueandblonde
Reviews.Content: Currently staying in this hotel...what can i say. Well placed, food excellent, rooms fantastic comfortable and very clean. In fact it is our first time in a Novotel and it certainly will not be the last. Here for a few more days yet and really making the most of it. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Decent Four Star City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siera1408
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for three nights here last week for our weekend gateway. We stayed on Premier Floor so were asked to check in separately at Premier lounger. Check-in was fast, staffs were friendly and helpful too. The room itself was small ( we didn't expect much since this is an acceptable size for a four-star hotel in Hong Kong ) but surprisingly comfortable enough. Free wi-fi was included in the room as well. We wished there was a bathtub in the bathroom though.. Location was not bad, 5 minute-walk to Jordan MTR - which was the main transportation throughout our entire stay in Hong Kong. We didn't have the chance to try the restaurant but it seems packed with local people dining for diner (a local friend told me the hotel's buffet was "not bad" and quite popular along the locals ) The thing I liked the most about this hotel was its gym. It was spacious, well equipped and has a good ambience for workout. We had no complaints about this hotel and enjoyed our short stay. We would recommend this for people who are looking for a reasonable city hotel in Hong Kong.. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: Dara58
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel. So that says a lot. Round the same time last year, for my birthday. Our room was on the 15th premier floor. The room was clean and comfortable. My only complaint would be that there was no bath a double shower instead. I do like to soak in a tub after lots of walking around. But no big deal. Check in was quick. My husband had ordered a birthday cake for me which was lovely and no charge. Can't remember the guy's name on reception, but I asked for some ideas on a good place to eat. He came back with Cheers Restuarant which is located just about 5 minutes if that, from the hotel. Great food and great price. Didn't get a chance to tell him thank you. If were do go back to Hong Kong, will stay here again. Also great location.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: gecentral
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that is close to all amenities (food, shopping, sights), unlike most comments for hotels in HK, Novotel provides a decent size rooms compare to some others we’ve stayed in. If your after a hotel with a nice view of the harbor or night scene of HK then this isn’t a hotel for you. But if you’re after a decent well maintained hotel with cleanliness then you may want to consider this hotel. Stayed there back in March 2010 for 10 days, this was based on trip advisors review and visiting a friend who stayed in this hotel last November when we stayed in the Eaton hotel on the next street. Was impressed with the size of the room and the cleanliness of the rooms. Check in was relatively painless, Transport: Several ways you can get the main area where these hotels are (Nathan, Eaton, Novotel). We chose the airport transfer bus, this took about 30mins and the stop is about 2mins walk away from the hotel which is pretty easy and cheap, I think it was about $15 one way. If anyone is considering the hotel coach service from the airport, you might want to consider getting a taxi instead. As it’s about $200HKD a single journey, compared to about $140 pp on for a return trip on the coach service. Slightly dearer but on your own time and no need to rush, plus long distance rides taxi’s tend to offer discount if you haggle. Being HK, your never far away from any public transport, with the location of the hotel it’s close to the main mode of transport for us which is the subway (2mins walk away). Room: Large enough room with modern amenities, everything kept pretty clean and in good condition. The only down side is if you get a room on the lower floors then you’re facing the apartment blocks opposite. The bed are very large and firm which is a change from other hotels in the area. Used the gym several times as well, nice set up with a variety of equipment for cardio or weights, open 24hrs! Only down side is the charge for use of internet in the rooms, it’s about $300 for the time we spent there. For a country where high speed internet is a common place and majority of hotels around the world provide free WAN internet for their customers, this little money making project that needs to be reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Padare
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the The Novotel Nathan road for one night and was very happy I did so. This is a great hotel, well located in Kowloon, close to the MTR and not far from Kowloon station, from where you can get shuttle buses to the airport. The hotel is slightly tricky to find though at first as it is on a side street and not well sign posted. The hotel is stylishly fitted out. The staff were very helpful and offered us a free upgrade on arrival, to a very nice, spacious room. Free WIFI is also on offer. The breakfast was good and the hotel also has a nice bar with live music. The only downside is that it was a slightly impersonal, but I guess that is to be expected in such a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromCardiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The location was good for buses & the MTR and fine if you are happy with the hustle & bustle of Nathan Road every time you step out. We had a room on the executive floor, which while being very compact, was comfortable and was of the standard you would expect of a four star hotel. Initially, we were a little disappointed with the service in the executive lounge, however, after the first day it improved greatly and we think that our first impression was just a blip. Indeed, we cannot praise the service enough on check-out. We were able to leave our cases in the morning, and when we returned in the evening they gave us a room for 30 minutes, which allowed us to shower & change.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (near MTR underground train)”
Reviews.Author: Taar
Reviews.Content: Novotel in Nathan rd, has a good location as its near the MTR walking distance about 2 mins (Called Jordan Station). If you didn't buy a hotel breakfast or don't have...don't eat at the hotel, only opposite the hotel there is a restaurant which have noodle, wanton, Rice Porridge which I would recommend to eat Porridge (Pork, Chicken, Fish can choose) and don't forget to order the yellow bread to eat with the Porridge or you can call PA-TONG-GO. Inside the hotel downstair is the conceirge to check-in must go up 1 fl. and there will be the lobby which also have MAC computer waiting for you to use free internet. Inside the room the room is bigger (compare with Eaton hotel) staying 3 person is fine, the room is clean and nice and have dryer for you!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: FromtheEast
Reviews.Content: 9/10 Very attentive and pleasant service, nice rooms. we liked the premiere service on the 15th floor as an extra. Bar food was varied' from good to poor. All the staff were only too pleased to help- nothing was too much trouble! The escalator to main reception from the street can prove to be a problem if it breaks down, as there is not a lift from the ground floor. An excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: CazBUk
Reviews.Content: After much searching through reviews, and asking friends for recommendations, we finally settled on The Novotel Kowloon. What an excellent choice! The location was very good - easily accessed using the Airport Express train and free shuttle bus K1 from Kowloon station (the stop being just a couple of streets away outside the Eaton Hotel). The MTR was also only a short walk away. Many sights were within easy walking distance. Staff at the hotel were very welcoming and helpful. Our room, on the executive floor, was very comfortable, with the added bonus of free internet access. Breakfast in the executive lounge was good, although sometimes a little crowded. We also enjoyed the afternoon tea and cakes, and free drinks and snacks in the evening - it was great to return after a days sightseeing and sit with fellow guests chatting about our day.

Reviews.Title: “Location = Awesome, Service = Lacking”
Reviews.Author: MezMoo74
Reviews.Content: I had a booked four rooms on the executive level and our check in was an absolute NIGHTMARE! We arrived after a long flight all very tired we lined up at reception 4 deep of people. Only once we get to the front of the line to be sent upstairs for check in!!!! Once upstairs the check in staff member took forever to get organised after 10 minutes (no joke) of waiting I asked what was the problem? We were advised that the hotel had been overbooked and he was juggling rooms to be able to ensure our group was not seperated to another hotel! At this point steam was coming out of my ears...... He then allocated us rooms that were incorrectly configured from our orginal booking. So after 40 mins of our arrival at the hotel we finally get our keys! The rooms were small but they were modern and comfortable enough for short stays. The location is awesome so close to everything you need in Hong Kong.....markets, transport, restaurants etc Our room included breakfast on the club floor......we sat at a table and waited for the rest of our group on the first morning. We waited and waited and waited......we finally called them and on entering the breakfast room the staff told them it was full and they had to come back later or go for breakfast downstairs. So they went downstairs and had to pay for a buffet breakfast!!!!! Honestly this was a frigging joke.......there was two tables near us that were empty and 4 seats at the higher bench table. The staff seemed lazy to me the meat platter was empty on the buffet and on asking them to top up it took them 20 minutes..... they advised they had to get it all from downstairs. Then when I tried to make a cup of tea no teaspoons and not a staff member to be seen..... So other than my experience with the executive floor staff everything else was fine..... I also used the Gym which was one of the best I have seen lately most hotels dont seem to upkeep there gym equipment but the Novotel must be praised for this.....I was impressed. Basically if you pay extra for the executive floor don't expect and executive experience. There are better hotels in Hong Kong willing to give you the service.

Reviews.Title: “Location.. Location.. Location”
Reviews.Author: B1shonen
Reviews.Content: I was here last weekend.. the main reason i chose to stay at novotel nathan due to its location, close to shopping arcade.. few minutes walk to jordan MRT., night market and foremost NIGHTCLUBS hahahh I found the bed abit hard but for asian people it's ok but it will create a problem with westerner, i love the breakfast, so many choices as typical of novotel around the globe, and thankful for the free internet at the lobby.. cant live without updating my facebook :P The room is small like other hotels in hongkong but had no difficulty to mobilize inside, standard amenities, kettle, minibar, hairdryer, plus they have flat screen tv. the staffs are very helpful and friendly.. some people might find them rude from the way they speak.. but that's the way cantonese.. actually they are really friendly. what they should be improve that not to mumble about guest among themselves.. you will never know that some guests might understand cantonese.. If you stay here.. try the yum cha from the next restaurant.. so yummy..

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value for Hong Kong, Kowloon side”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: I was on the Premier Level, the room was not real big, and i think they are the identical size to regular rooms. They are a bit more stylish, with slightly better amenities. The PRemier Level has free internet. THe premier lounge has a continental breakfast, afternoon tea with a few snacks, and evening cocktails with a few hot and cold items, not really enough for a full dinner for most. THe bedding was very comfortable, big size t.v. and quiet location on a high floor. THe location is just a few minutes walk to the Metro/subway. Lots of restaurants and convenience store nearby. Staff very polite and friendly. Free internet terminals in the lobby. Not a bad location to visit HOng KOng/Kowloon. I think closer to the harbor can be double the price for something similar. Nearby is the Eaton Hotel which also has a good buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean.”
Reviews.Author: dognamedrudy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night before catching a train to Beijing. It was clean, reasonably priced and the location was good. We were coming back to Hong Kong for site seeing at the end of our Asia trip, so we didn't spend much time trying to access major sites from this hotel. The metro was pretty close by. Neighborhood fine. Rooms roomy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a first time visit”
Reviews.Author: Mcknight11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my spouse and her folks. We arranged most things on our own. As walk in's, we were treated quite cordially. The Staff were very helpful and knew when to give us our privicy. The rooms we received were spotless adn they even up graded us to a better room than orriginally requested. Great place for a good sleep. The Metro station's not too far and the hotel lobby is clear and quite from ' Group package tourists' mingling around screaming and yelling like in other hotels we have been too. They also can arrange tour for you to Macau. Star Bucks is just downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Half a Block Off Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: CelineCeline
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for one week at the end of June. The hotel exceeded all our expectations! It's clean, modern, the service was superior, the rooms were large and comfortable, and the locations could not be beat. It was less than two blocks from the Jordan MTR station and only half a block off Nathan Road. Walkable to the shopping districts in Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui (although a short cab ride is probably more comfortable in the 30+ degree weather - usually about 20 HKD). Our package did not include breakfast, however, this was not a problem at all. Literally across the street from the hotel is a well known local congee and noodle place that we frequented often for our breakfast. It's also pretty tough to walk 2 blocks in any direction without running into any restaruants, and so there are many many eating options for you. No need to eat at the hotel, although the dinner buffet was very busy and looked very good with unlimited fois gras! Even some of the locals who were not staying at the hotel would come to eat the buffet dinner . The bar was also very popular, especially with world cup happening. The hotel was very kind in offering us free drink vouchers as our rooms were not ready upon checkin even though we showed up at noon, before our check in time. Our friend's had to change their rooms due to a maintenance issue, and they were given some more free drink vouchers. The computer stations that were available was very handy, allowing us to send emails to our families. Finally, the gym was very well equipped and I believe opened 24 hours a day. This hotel was awesome and we are back in HK, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hong Kong Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MTLSteve
Reviews.Content: Entirely renovated from A to Z, it's a stylish Novotel in the heart of Kowloon on Nathan Road. The rooms are fairly small but functional. No problem at all for two people, they managed to get a roll-away in our room for a 3rd person but it was tight. The beds were very comfortable, nice wall-mounted tv with wide selection of channels, nice workspace, very clean. Bathroom was very nice, and relatively roomy. Nice, large walk-in glass shower. Housekeeping replenished everything every day and we never had any problems. In-room safe was large enough for a laptop. Good size closet in the room but no drawers. Location was great for exploring Kowloon - just a few minutes walk from the Jade Market and the Temple Street Night Market. Less than 5 mins walk to Jordan station for subway. Getting to/from airport was easy with an Airport Express bus, I believe it was the A21 - it stopped right outside. Did not use the hotel restaurant, so many other choices around. Lobby is nice, there are 4 computers there for public use, which was very handy. Staff was polite and efficient. I would not hesitate to return here when visiting Kowloon. The price is very reasonable, and the accomodations were modern, up to date, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bchris08
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at cosmo hotel at Causeway Bay (just brings on claustrophobia if you try the superior room) last year, this hotel was ideal in terms of space. There was ample space to place our luggage and we could move around freely without having to step on each other's toes! The king-sized bed in a deluxe rm was a rare bonus. The pillows provided came with 3 different types of cushioning - which we couldn't tell apart. The bath and toilet were clean and had good supply of hot water. The hotel is newly refurbished so everything looked new and modern. Wanted a good and decent hotel this time as we were staying longer. Really, Novotel Nathan did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ChiragAmla
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the kowloon island, this hotel rocks!!! Walking distance from the night markets, avenue of stars, metro station, ferry terminals... The hotel has swanky rooms without compromising on comfort. Get drunk LKF and take a ride back to this fab hotel for a good nite sleep !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjohnson116
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and loved it! The hotel is not much to look at from the outside, but it is a pleasant surprise on the inside! The decor is clean and modern and decorated with rich colors. The hotel staff is very polite and spoke both Cantonese and English. The rooms were pretty large for HK and very comfortable. The location is also very convenient. There are plenty of nice restaurants and Dim Sum places near by. There is also an open air night market a few blocks down from the hotel that is a must see! If you are new to the area, I would recommend taking one of the guided tours offered in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good for those staying in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy
Reviews.Content: Had a good trip to HK with my partner last Feb, we opted to stay in the Kowloon part of the city since we wanted to stay in the more traditional area. This hotel fitted the bill with it's central location, well located near to the underground system. Since this was a while ago now.... I'll summarise the main points: GOOD -great hotel bar with happy hour (good to take advantage of in a city with expensive drinks) -fitness facilities were good -some UK/US tv channels in the room -polite reception staff -clean -good location, near to underground, about 15min walk to star ferry BAD -quite noisy outside -rooms very small Would I stay there again? Probably not, as i'd stay on HK Island if I was to return

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCT22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, waited more than 10 minutes to check in and the staff that check me in is a bit rude. The hotel is in a good location with plenty of shops and restaurant around. Only a few minutes from the MTR however, average room and service for the price we paid approx £130 per night. I will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: tuktuujaartuq
Reviews.Content: I was travelling from Australia to the UK so I decided to stop over in HK for two nights. However my plans changed and two nights became one. Since I prepaid my room (non-refundable), I knew I was going to lose out on my second night. When I checked in and told a gentleman named Shinyu at reception that I will be checking out a day early, he explained that I won't get a refund. To my surprise, he also upgraded me to a Club room. The room I got was on the 19th floor and was modern and clean. The bed was soft and the bathroom was also nice. It was a very comfortable stay. Note I was only at the hotel for less than 12 hours so I was not able to explore the area or the premises. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and if I need to stay in the vicinity again, I would choose the Novotel Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gmaverick
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location on Nathan Road with the Nathan and Eaton hotels next door. It's a 5 minute walk to the Jordan subway station and just 2 blocks to the night market. The rooms are very tight, which reminds me of New York. It doesn't leave much room to move around but it's clean and the showers were great. There is no tub for those who want to take a bath. It did have a musty smell in the rooms which we thought was the air conditioning but discovered it came from the air outside which was drawn in. It went away on a windy day. The Octopus Pass bought at the airport made it easy to move around Hong Kong's subways. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the subway was so easy to navigate. I give it a "A" for ease of travel and transfering. If you decide to take the airport train from the Kowloon transfer station, be sure to have $90 Hong Kong dollars each for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “I was disheartened when I finished my breakfast and was handed a 150HK bill!”
Reviews.Author: whileitravel
Reviews.Content: Overall quite satisfied with this Novotel. Location was good, but unfortunately found ourselves traveling to the island frequently! Second time I've spent more than $100/night at a Novotel with breakfast not being included! What gives Novotel? The rooms are on the smallish side, but up to date and clean. The bed was very comfortable with quality pillows. Free Internet access was a plus, though it can only be accessed within the main lobby/bar and it expires after 30mins, at which time you need to request for another password. Check out was quick and efficient!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Chung1234
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel and convenienly located near the Jordan Station. There is even a very nice gym. However, the free internet terminals at the lobby seem to be always occupied. Room size is decent by HK standards.

Reviews.Title: “Just as we expected”
Reviews.Author: island085
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Nathan road was a great base for our trip to Hong Kong. Rooms are what you expect when staying at a Novotel. The rooms are clean, modern and quiet. Bed was large and room was a bit small but fine for the 2 of us. We found a little restaurant across the road which had great egg noodle and wonton soup! Tried the breakfast on one day and it was just OK... Walkable distance to Temple street Markets and Ladies Market. We will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from the Novotel - nice hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: ourmaizcay
Reviews.Content: Similar comments to others. Well located to MTR, buses, 7-11, Temple Street Night Market. Hotel, spotlessly clean, hotel staff professional, efficient and friendly. The rooms aren't the biggest but it was no problem for me. The hotel is well priced and exceptional value if you can get it during the sales. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: magislayer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights from 28 - 30 May, obtained a standard double room on the 9th floor. Room was very clean and quiet, perhaps the room beside mine was unoccupied? I think the hotel is quite new. The room is modernly renovated, and the bathroom door and the clothes hangar / safe box door are interchangeable (ie. only one door for both). The shower was not that powerful. In the room there is a 32 inch Sony LCD on the wall. Apart from that the room is quite small but good enough for me. The amenities include lounge, restaurant and a gym. The location is fine and it is barely 5minutes walk from Jordan MTR. Above all is quite a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, A Smile Won't Hurt!!”
Reviews.Author: MiMetwally
Reviews.Content: Great location, literally 5 minutes from the MTR Jordan station, Star bucks is less than one minute away, 2 money exchange shops right beside the hotel and a 7 eleven store right infront of it. Despite the name of the hotel it's not directly on Nathan road, but on a side road from Nathan called Saigon road, the building is 50 meters from Nathan road. following the advice of TA members we booked only the room without breakfast, and turned down the offered upgrade to executive floor on arrival The free internet access proved invaluable, and when I used the printer they offered it free of charge (hotel policy 5 HKD per paper) We stayed at a room on the 8th floor, Knowing that size is a problem in HK, the room was ok, but after adding the baby's cot which the hotel supplied almost immediately upon checking us in, the room had no space to move in. but considering we had a king size bed we were not bothered. The TV had around 30 channels, only 3 or 4 of which were in English, not an issue for us as we only stayed in the room to sleep, but woud be an issue for someone spending some time in the room everyday We felt that we received our money's worth, and the staff were very professional and helpful, but only in a robotic way, I've seen many some complaints about the friendliness of the staff by TA members adn I found it true Great hotel, will definitely stay there again if we went back someday

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: KMH21
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect having booked this hotel as an Accor member. We found the staff very helpful and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was spottlessly clean and most comfortable. The ensuite only had a shower, and we would have preferred having a bath, but if this was the only problem, we could deal with it. We certainly will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location 3 star hotel In Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: pumpapple2002
Reviews.Content: Check in was too long 30 minutes but luckily they provide us with 2 welcome drinks. Stayed in 6 th floor.Room was small and a bit outdated. We need to ask for our 2 bottles mineral water every single day. Walking distance to Jordan MTR station (5minutes). Tried the lunch buffet promo for 2 person only HKD200.Very good quality of foods. If you wanna visit Hongkong and not spending too much of your time inside your hotel room,this is the best hotel.(We only stay in our room for 6 our sleep only coz the rest of the day,we were exploring the great Hongkong). Will stay here again if visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, clean and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 2xshi
Reviews.Content: There are many eateries, restaurants and shops conveniently located around the hotel, all within walking distance, including Jordan MTR which is a 5 mins walk from the station. The famous flea street, Temple Street, is just few streets away. I stayed for 4 nights with my family. We requested for an early check-in and connecting room, which the service staff did tried to arrange for it when we arrived at around 12noon. The service was prompt; the service staff was already waiting for us with our luggage when we went up to our room. The rooms are small but stylish and very clean. So that actually compensate for the little walking space in the room. My only disappointment was with the internet connection on the PC available for free usage. The internet connection was very slow and I could not use it to do some research on my itinerary and to do an online check-in for my flight. Moreover, one pc was down for 2 nights during my 4 nights stay. Overall, the stay in Novotel Nathan was a pleasant experience. I would still stay in the hotel again and recommend this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: oz_yasdnil
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel doesn't cater for large families it was more than adequate for us, 2 adults, 10yr old girl and 3 yr old boy. The suites are very well appointed, and thoroughly cleaned each day. Room service was very prompt when eating in, and with a selection of western and asian catered for, likewise in the dining room. Breakfast was light with no hot food, but a good variety to select from. Staff in all areas are very proffessional in attitude, manners and being helpful. Location of the Hotel is a little distant from the main shopping areas on the Golden Mile, but there is adequate transportation available, 3 min. walk to MRT, 5 min. to Jade and night marketsaxis and buses are virtually at the front door. I feel this Hotel is extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: zodiacasia
Reviews.Content: The hhotel is new as it has been fully renovated with modern design making good use of the space in the room.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: qilin037
Reviews.Content: Despite being in a less busy area, this property is still very convenient: the MTR (HK's extensive subway system) is just 2 min away by foot, along with several restaurants, two 7-11s, a Starbucks, shopping, laundry service, supermarket, etc all nearby. Hotel is one of the few in HK that are environmentally friendlier (Green Globe certified). I liked the free stuff: apples in the impressive fitness room, newspaper, and 2 bottles of water per day. Room has safe, mini fridge (not very cold tho). Wi-fi in lobby, wired internet at reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in HK!”
Reviews.Author: Ceri007
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 5 night stay here. The rooms are small, but that's to be expected in HK. Well located in Kowloon, which is a much more authentic Chinese experience than staying on HK island (which we spent quite a bit of time visiting, but it was great to have our base in Kowloon). My only complaint is with room service. We called to get a bottle opener and wine glasses, and it never came, even after a reminder call 30 mins later. We didn't have any meals at the hotel or try the spa, as both seemed quite expensive. Overall, good value. I will return if I ever go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: Throstle
Reviews.Content: Had six nights here and loved it - very modern and a perfect haven in a bustling city. Superb staff, very helpful and obliging. All in all an excellent hotel and good value for HK

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Kretek1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off Nathan Road. From the airport you catch bus no. A21 and is the 10th stop. After alighting, I got a bit lost in finding the hotel. I later realised the hotel is not directly on Nathan Road (despite advertising so). It is located on a small street, Saigon Street, just off Nathan Road. Upon alighting bus, just walk in the same direction as the bus, and immediately you find a Saigon Street and turn left. The hotel is very pleasant and in a very convenient location to public transport. It is within a walking distance (less than 5 mins) to Jordan MTR station and lots of buses ply Nathan Road. Temple Street hawker food stalls is nearby and you can walk along Nathan Road to Tsim Tsa Shui (about 20 mins depending how fast you walk). Along the way (on the right hand side, behind a row of shops) there is a public park with birds and fish in lakes. Rooms and bathrooms are on the small size, but these are standard in Hong Kong because space is at a premium. Despite this, they are clean and modern. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: fairywings2507
Reviews.Content: I booked a room that I'm pretty sure included breakfast, but upon checking in, they said it didn't, even though it was on the receipt I had. Having just arrived after a long haul flight, we weren't in the mood for an argument, and when it was suggested we could upgrade our room to 'Executive', which would give us immediate access to our room (it was 8.30am, and we had intended to just drop our bags off and go shopping), free wifi (which wasn't wifi, we had to be attached to a cable), breakfast, afternoon tea, and 'cocktails' for an additional AUD$70 per night, we agreed. There wasn't any real only real value in paying the additional amount, as the afternoon tea, was basically a cuppa and a bit of stale cake. On each of the three nights the so called cocktails were on, we couldn't even get into the room, although we did notice it wasn't cocktails, it was a few bottles of liquor and mixers - not sure if beer was available. Breakfast was passable, only just, but not a huge selection. On the upside, although not huge, the room was nice and clean, and the beds comfortable. Very central location for shopping in Kowloon. My suggestion: don't get talked into the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free visit”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller55
Reviews.Content: First visit to Hong Kong, the Novotel Nathan, a great location near the shops and markets.Stayed on Club floor which I highly recommend, club lounge served breakfast , afternoon tea, cocktails and free wireless.Staff friendly and helpful nothing too much trouble.Room was spotlessly clean, comfortable, well appointed and bed quaranteed 3 great nights' sleep.No need to eat out, there was a selection of options both for lunch and dinner. A tour desk in lobby sorted out a helicopter flight and day tours both of which I would recommend.A most enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room, free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Trave11er101
Reviews.Content: Midway up the Nathan Road, location is in central Kowloon, close to night markets and a 20-30 minute walk to the Star Ferry (depending on how many suit and watch hawkers you have to negotiate!) Comfortable well equiped room, clean rooms and good service. Free Wifi in the lobby very handy if you have your own laptop, otherwise there are a couple of computers to use for free. We were able to check in at 6am after a long flight from NZ which was a bonus. Handy for the airport bus too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and location for the price”
Reviews.Author: room103
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during volcano disruption when we had to move out of our previous hotel which was far more expensive. Only researched for about 3 minutes but it turned out to be absolutely fine. Decent rate on laterooms.com, modern place built a couple of years ago - fairly standard mid range. Location is close to Jordan MTR station - so takes less than 10 minutes to get to Central I'd say. Don't expect any views though, and be prepared to fend off suit and fake watch salesmen as soon as you get outside the door. Efficient rather than friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Clean, Good Location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Teagan89
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a girlfriend of mine in September 2008. Good Hotel, Close to Shops, Clean, Good Service, Large Rooms. 5min walk to nearest train line. Banks near by. Taxi's easy to get from Hotel. Resturant a little expensive but GREAT food. Overall, Good experience. Recommend to people on the go & want to see the city,

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JackiMac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Nathan Road Hong Kong recently and found it to be quite nice. The location just off Nathan Road was good and a few blocks from MTR station which was great, very easy to get around on MTR. You could also walk to harbour front in about 10 - 15 mins which was handy. There is night market nearby though not many nice places to eat locally. The hotel offered good food and the buffet dinner was amazing and pretty well priced. Rooms were neat, clean and modern if a little on the small side. Staff very friendly and accommodating - Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good clean and convienent”
Reviews.Author: Joffaboy_66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in late March early April. Two rooms on the fifth floor, one for my wife and I, one for the kids. Rooms were a good size, with a very comfortable bed. We originally thought because of the location, it may be noisy, however the hotel is more on a side street and the noise was not a problem. Service was first class. The tour desk was very helpful and saved us time and money for Disneyland, Ocena Park, the Big Buddha, and a night cruise to watch the evening light show. If you want a massage,there are plenty of places close by that may be cheaper, was really impressed. We main ate out (there are some very reasonable restaurants across the road, much cheaper) however the food we did have was in the Bistro and it was high quality. Happy hour in the bar was very enjoyable most nights after a long day being a tourist, and the free internet was heavily used, but you could get on most of the time. If you are coming from the Airport A21 stop ten, stop almost outside of the hotel. Highly recommended for cost, comfort, and convienence (night market is just two streets down, and Jordan MTR is about three minutes away).

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable, worth belonging to Accor card to take advantage of benefits.”
Reviews.Author: TillyHavelockNorth
Reviews.Content: Most hospitable hotel - staff friendly and helpful, efficient, hotel very clean,meals good, Hotel central to most tourist needs - trams, buses, rail stations. We used the airport to hotel transfer instead of the Airport Express, found this good, as we got in late at night and didnt want to have to find our way changing from train to bus etc at night when not knowing your way around. Night market a quick walk away. Even good restaurants in near vicinity. Overall a great place to stay. We do have an Accor Advantage care which does help with the cost overall for staying and dining. We had all our breakfasts, and most evening meals here for this reason, couldnt fault the selection for Europeans.

Reviews.Title: “Definately stay here again next time!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2010England
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hong Kong, over the last 4 years we have stayed in 5 different hotels. Novotel this time was by far the best in location, cleaniness, value for money and good size of rooms. We also had a 2 year old with us and found that this hotel was also very child friendly. We have already decided that we will be staying at this hotel again next time we visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneShopaholic
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 8 nights on the Premier Floor which included breakfast, light afternoon tea and evening drinks. Hotel staff spoke good English and were very willing to help us. Premier Floor was worth the extra money, we met so many people from all over the world in the Premier Lounge during breakfast and evening drinks. Hotel restaurant and bar was also nice and priced very good. Housekeeping staff were friendly and our room was lovely although my bed was a bit hard. Jordan MTR station is close by and we travelled all around Hong Kong by train, very fast and efficient. Thanks to Dino and his staff for a very memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Busy”
Reviews.Author: ahalvors
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel to be well appointed but very busy and you lined up for everything.Apart from that the hotel Staff were very helpful the rooms were good the food of which I only had breakfast was as good as any where I have been

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient - But Please Smile”
Reviews.Author: nathanv23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of March. Good location in Kowloon just a short walk to Jordan Station. Nice clean rooms. Very comfortable beds. Bell boys downstairs were helpful. A few points that need improvement: 1. Breakfast is not up to par. For the price they charge, there should be a cheese platter, more juices, more fruits. If you just want some toast and cereal, it is fine. 2. The receptionists are totally efficient, but they are like robots. Why not smile when the guest walks to the counter? Why not wish them a pleasant stay? Why not ask them how their stay was as they are leaving? 3. In this day and age - and in a city like Hong Kong, every room should have wifi and it should be free. Charging for internet just makes you look cheap - kind of like charging extra if I want to turn on the TV. As it is, you can get 30 minutes free wifi in the lobby and that's it. 4. The fitness center is on the ground floor below the lobby. Unless I am missing something, there is no bathroom. This can be a bit inconvenient. When these things are improved, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: ZdenkaAussie25
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel for 7 nights, in a Club room, on Executive Floor. Club room was nothing special, we expected more, as we paid more money to be in this room but we feel we paid too much for what we got. We had continental breakfast included in our room rate but it was disappointing. We had 7 breakfasts, every morning the same, no variety what so ever. Every day same ham, same sliced sausage, same cheese, couple of cereals, salmon and that was about it. First 2 or 3 days we had a choice of 3 cereals, after that was only 2, without cornflakes which we love the most. Be aware - no paper serviettes or serviettes of any kind, there was a box of tissues placed on the table which we were using instead!!! Never saw that at any previous hotels we've been at. Club Lounge is small and was couple of times so crowded that we have to come back later to have our breakfast. Complimentary afternoon tea ( which is complimentary with Club room ) was another disappointment. 1 choice of cake and every time same sandwiches with a bit of sliced sausage or ham and a cucumber. At the end we didn't bother anymore to go to afternoon teas! Cocktail Hour ( also complimentary from 5 - 7 daily ) was not too bad compare with Afternoon tea but we missed bread! Sample: there were marinated chicken wings or sliced roasted meat but no bread rolls or bread of any kind. We found it difficult to eat meat on its own so we usually bought some bread and took it with us. But we have to say there was plenty of drinks and as we don't drink much, we were happy with the selection of wine, beer and soft drinks. Highlight of our stay was room service which was great, room was always clean in tidy and so was the bathroom, always enough of shampoo, soap, conditioner, toilet paper and so on. Very good service indeed! Reception staff was polite if you spoke to them but it hardly happened that they will say "Hi" when they saw you. Usually they just looked at you without a word. The position of the hotel is great, Nathan Rd is great for shopping, many great shops and small shopping centres around as well as many restaurants, also close by is Ladies market and Night market which was great. Public transport is great, train and bus services all at your door step and also it is very cheap! We never used taxi, traffic is terrible and if we needed to go somewhere we went with train. If we are going to come back to Hong Kong one day we won't be coming back to Novotel Hotel, there are many good hotels around for same or less money we paid so next time we'll do something new.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND CLEAN HOTEL...LOCATION IS GREAT”
Reviews.Author: s_n_m2010
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to HK... first stay was at Salisbury Hotel.. Room- got 2 adjoining rooms for us and the 3 kids. rooms are clean and fresh, beds are so comfortable so are the pillows and duvet. room is already modern with a sony LCD TV. a nice headboard and lighting fixture. Bathroom - soooo clean, complete with bathroom amenities, towels are so clean and white. amenities are replenished everyday, with two complimentary bottled water. Internet access - free at the hotel lobby using their 4 IMac units. use is for 30 minutes but can stay longer if there is no waiting guest. password to your own PC is also available for free from the reception desk.... so nice and comfy to have.. you can check your email anytime of the day Staff - friendly and accommodating. we requested for late checkout of 4pm and our request was granted. most of them staff are conversant in English so it wont be a hassle to request for many things, from the screw driver to plate and knife and extra coffee & cream. Location - very near Jordan station, 10 mins away from the Kowloon-Macau ferry station. so accessible to Disney and Ocean Park too. 7-eleven, Starbucks, McDo, KFC stores are everywhere. Happy to have checked this hotel from Trip Advisor. Rooms are small but ok for us Asians with less luggage. The reviews helped me a lot in choosing this hotel from the Cathay Pacific package. Opps, will avail of our welcome drink now, now that we are checking out hehehe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service; Inaccurate Room Description”
Reviews.Author: bibilar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia two days ago. The room description stated " Wired high-speed Internet access (complimentary)" . After I checked in and figured there is no internet in the room, I called the front desk and was told "wired high speed internet access at lobby, complimentary for 30 mins" I argued "this is in the room descriptions so this can't be right!" Then I was transfered to another staff. He mentioned" we no longer offer free internet!" So I mention I just booked this hotel 4 hours ago through expedia, he answered " We already updated our homepage. You booked through expedia and we are in a different server (I have no idea what he means by different server) so we are not responsible for it." I was liked Nowadays who would actually book a hotel through the hotel homepage and pay a full listed price?? He then got very rude and said "This is not our problem, you should check our updated website, you should call Expedia and ask them!". I checked out the next day and moved to Hyatt. I suggest the hotel hire some professional staffs instead of an amateur who talked like gangster. I felt like this wasn't a 4 stars hotel instead, a ghetto place.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaGSingapore
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a small hotel which is far from amenities. How wrong was I. I took a public bus A21 from the airport n alight just along the main road of the hotel! A mere 2 mins walk to the hotel - very convenient. 5 mins walk to MTR station if you want to go around Hong Kong. Good n cheap food is easily available around the hotel. The room is spacious and very comfortable for my family. Will surely recommend to my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: kinzan
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. Checking in was fast, checking out was even faster. It is clean, modern, and have well appointed rooms. The size is decent for HK standards too. I have no complains about this place at all as the staff was polite and do their best to accommodate my requests. We esp love the numerous plug points available in the room as we have a number of gadgets to charge each night. The location is not too bad, not far from the nearest Jordan MTR but not as close as described by most of the reviewers here. It's definitely NOT behind the hotel, but about 3 blocks walk away. The pillows however, could be firmer.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon or Hong Kong Island??”
Reviews.Author: LTS1Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Nathan Road for 4 nights. Had a premier room - if you book this type of room go straight to the 15th floor to check in. We were not advised this and went to the first floor and the staff were pretty unhelpful. It is a good location for Kowloon, very close to the MTR at Jordan Road. However, Kowloon is pretty tacky and Hong Kong Island is much nicer. The bathroom and room is modern, very clean, although the room smelt musty. The continetal breakfast that is free with the premier room was very good, lots of choice. The evening drinks that were free were great if you drink alcohol. Must sees are - Sik Sik Yuen Wong Tai Sin Temple , Victoria Peak Lantau Island & Big Buddha via Cable car, Stanley, go on the Star Ferry & Symphony of lights. Don't bother with Jumbo Kingdom -service appalling!

Reviews.Title: “Practical but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: OzScotty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time on a 5 day business trip. Difficult to find entrance which is on Saigon street not Nathan Road. I booked a room on Executive floor (top floor) which has its own check-in. Rooms are basically the same for the whole hotel as I asked to look at the non-exec floor rooms. Rooms and bathrooms are not bad (recently refurbished I think) but quite small. No alcohol in mini-bar. Exec lounge is also on the small side but has a meeting room which can be booked. Breakfast on exec floor is continental only so if you want hot food, its downstairs and you have to pay extra. Ipod dock in room but no DVD player. Free cable-internet for exec floor. Gym is pretty good. Location is not quite central to Tsim Sha Tsui but close to Temple Street and Mong Kok markets. Clientele is very Novotel - lots of older people!!! Not my preferred Kowloon hotel options are limited for Accor members and Exec floor gets it over the line so will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL!! TRULY ONE OF THE BEST~”
Reviews.Author: yu234723
Reviews.Content: Everything was good here. Great location, VERY clean, super luxerious looking when I went in... 2 bottles of water was complimentary, and room was cleaned each day... Close to Jordan Station, just 3 minutes walking distance. Shopping, food, mcdonalds, KFC etc were in every corner. Would certainly recommend the hotel to those I know... Very comfortable pillows!!! Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, Novotel Nathan is what most people could appreciate!”
Reviews.Author: riamiranda3
Reviews.Content: Novotel - nice small room, the bathroom was 10x10ft or smaller and the shower cubicle was 1/3 of it but the rain shower felt great after a long day out. We stayed for 3 days, checked in at noon and room was ready, front desk speaks english and was very helpful and attend to all our needs except no one takes your luggage which wasn't a big deal. The cleaning ladies were also very friendly and they don't touch personal belongings and leftover food if it's still on the table and not in the trash bin. We booked a smoking room but the room smell other than cigarette, seemed like they don't use fresheners most likely due to possible allergic reaction of guests. It's on a busy part of Nathan, jordan mtr station is just round the black and the night market is about two blocks accross the street but next time we'd most likely opt for the ones located on tst or hk part. There's also an ice dispenser right outside the door which was perfect for the beers before calling it a night. And you may have your luggage's stored even after check-out if you need to do some last minute shopping. All in all it was very clean, tastefully designed and was very convenient staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Disability Accessibility with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wheelytrippin
Reviews.Content: As a paraplegic, travelling can be an ordeal. Often what has been advertised as wheelchair friendly results in me putting my safety on the line every time I utilise the amenities in my room and the other facilities within the hotel. Novotel was not one of these experiences. I have rarely experienced such a well thought out accommodation (shower could be tweaked to make it perfect for my needs) that made me feel safe to go about my business. The service was impeccable with concierge department consistently and genuinely working to meet my needs. House keeping were on the ball, attending to every request I made from them and the restaurant staff always willing to assist me with the breakfast buffet. I don't think I have used the words 'thank you' so many times in such a short space in time. 5 stars from me Novotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: LisaSSSydney
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean and efficient hotel centrally located on Kowloon side of Hong Kong. Jordan station is only a 2 minute walk away and is the red line that goes direct to Central (Hong Kong Island side). Alternatively, you can always catch the number 2 bus just outside on the Nathan Road doorstep which takes you direct to the Star Ferry terminal and you can catch the ferry across for peanuts! cheap as chips.. The hotel itself is very clean, offers a wonderful breakfast selection (both Eastern and Western) and the staff are all very efficient, and friendly. All speak excellent English so we had no problems getting around at all.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anneandfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in one of the hotel's premier rooms and had a great time. The room was very nice - I agree the room was small but we had enough room for the 3 of us and it was very comfortable. The upgrade to a premier room with access to the premier lounge was well worth the extra we paid. We had a lovely breakfast each morning, afternoon tea and drinks between 6-8pm in the evening with snacks as well. The range of drinks provided was very good - the wine was very good and there was a choice of beer, spirits and soft drinks as well, which my son was very happy with. There was also a very nice seating area and it was quite quiet when we were there. There was also free internet access in the premier lounge, which my son used. The staff were very friendly. We found the hotel was busy but in the premier lounge area it was nice and quiet so well worth it after a busy day. The hotel was also in a convenient area right by Nathan Road so easy to get to all the attractions. Overall we had a very enjoyable time there and would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Excellent Service and another great stay”
Reviews.Author: BBFunny
Reviews.Content: This as my 5th stay at the Novotel Nathan Rd and I keep on coming back! This time I came with a group of 20 people for a 1 week holiday/business trip. From the front door to the room we were met with friendly greetings and excellent service. Nothing was too difficult for the concierge guys and the receptionist staff were also efficient and knew exactly what I wanted. The trip took over 6 months to plan and with the help of the friendly sales department staff at the novotel it made the trip one of the most enjoyeable and welcomed one. Everything I requested was delivered. Thanks again to all staff at Novotel and will be seeing you again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: torpilot
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at this location under its previous owners....GHASTLY. Novotel's recent acquisition and complete renovation of this property, combined with the mainly excellent Tripadvisor reviews, persuaded me to make an 8 day booking. I was not disappointed. From the moment we checked in on the Premier Floor to time of check out we were made most welcome. The staff at Premier reception and in the lounge area was uniformly good and went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The room and bathroom are, as many reviewers have noted, quite small but modern and spotlessly clean with all amenities you may require. My only reservation - I found the bed a bit hard for my aging bones. Asked for an extra doona to place on top and this was supplied promptly. I liked everything about this hotel that we utilised. I especially commend staff attitude and would also mention the very helpful in house travel desk. Access from the airport is easy using the A21 bus which drops you off at the Nathan Road end of the hotel. The entrance, however, is just around the corner. We found the location quite suitable for our purposes with the convenience of buses on Nathan road or a 5min (depending on fitness) walk from Jordon MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Meet my expectation”
Reviews.Author: JerryOu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and parents. I booked 2 rooms, one double and one twin, and got exactly what I asked for. Check-in time was 14.00 but I arrived there around 11.30 and decided to try my luck. The line at reception was long and I had to wait around 10 minutes. When it was my turn, process was swifted and I got my rooms (not on the same floor since I checked-in early). The room itself was Hong Kong's standard, not roomy but efficient. The cleanliness was great and mattress was soft and comfy. Hotel offered choices of pillows, too. 2 complimentary bottles of water was located in bathroom as well as hairdryer. I've never set my foot in it's dining facilities since I'd love to experience HK taste, so no comment in this section. The location of the hotel is great. A short walk to MTR Jordan station. If you use the subway in front of the hotel to cross to another side of the street and walk about 5 minutes along Saigon Street, pass the market, for a few blocks, you will find a local roast goose and roast pork shop. Just walk straight down Saigon Street and cross the Canton Road and there it is!!! Shop owner can't speak English but you can point what you want. Its roast goose and roast pork are to die for!!! All by all, I love this hotel. The location is great. Nice staffs (by HK's standard) and comfortable room. Definitely will return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean safe stay at Nathan Road”
Reviews.Author: cestella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 907 for 10 nights between the months of January to February. Positives: • Free gym facilities with modern and clean equipment. There were flat screens everywhere, towels and water for gym users • Complimentary bottles of water every day • Room serviced every day with different room service options. • Wardrobe with safe to keep valuables, iron and board, bath robes and slippers • Rooms are small but good apparently average for Hong Kong. • Rooms have modern fit outs with flat screen tv, small couch and desk area. • Modern bathroom stocked with essential toiletries. • Internet available but not free in rooms. Can use the mac facilities or connect to the free wifi at the lobby. • Close to Jordan station and as everyone else has mentioned easily accessible to either Mongkok or TST areas. Across the road via the subway you can also access the markets (4pm onwards). We usually went there for dinner lots of cheap, fresh eats. • Bar down stairs has a two for one offer during the time we were there this included all types of drinks – including cocktails yay! • Bed and pillows were very comfy. We were trying to see brand of bed cause we were so impressed and pleased with our sleep. Negatives: • When we first checked in the front desk staff was not very attentive. While we were in the process of checking in I think they were trying to find an available room. After 10 minutes of just standing there I asked him if everything was okay? He mumbled some response and didn’t even look at me while he spoke, I was not impressed. I asked him again – same response. In the end he gave us a complimentary drinks voucher for the bar so i guess that made up for it. • Limited cable channels • No exhaust fan in the bathroom so room would fog up if you took a really hot shower • At times you can hear people from other rooms eg. very loud tv, loud conversations, people walking through the hall. Overall I would stay here again. This hotel is clean, modern, safe and close to public transport and key areas in Kowloon area definitely won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “beyond my initial expectation”
Reviews.Author: vincelo2
Reviews.Content: This is Novotel so you more or less expect a certain standard in the Accor chain. Room size The room is clean, average in size. Remember this is HK where space is a premium. The room I stayed in had a king size bed, a sofa on the side and a desk and a average size bathroom using a shower. Happy with this category. Location Less than 5 mins walk to the "Jordan" MTR station. Food is only minutes away and literally everywhere. You can either take bus / MTR or take a 10-15 mins walk to the Ocean Terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui for shopping. The location is fantastic and you don't pay Tsim Sha Tsui prices. Food Initially I was planning to go down to the lobby for breakfast / lunch as they have specials on. I am glad I didn't. This is HK which is food heaven, the last thing you want to try is hotel food. For breakfast, I went to a cafe opposite the hotel enterance (5 secs walk). That place has been there for over 30 years according to the owner. Ham / Egg sandwich with milk tea / coffee cost HK 22. Ham / egg Noodles with tea / coffee cost HK27. And it's actually nice. Walk an extra 5 mins and you can experience japanese food...etc Service The people are very polite and helpful and they speak decent english. There isn't much to elaborate here. There are 4 internet terminals (apple) that people can use. You can also apply for free 30 mins wifi access if you have laptop / iphone. Shopping Go to Citigate if you are after outlet shopping. Most of the stuff was 50% off when I was there. Ocean Terminal in Tsim Sha Tsui can help you in retail therapy if you are after a big shopping centre. Take a walk along nathan road and there are lots of invidual shops that might be of interest. Price The price I had was very good. I stayed for almost 2 weeks and the rate range from HKD 770 to HKD1540.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a premier room. Was definitely worth the extra money to get all the little extras such as express check-in, breakfast in the lounge, evening drinks and nibblies (if you are not hungry you don't need to go out for dinner), free WIFI in rooms, slippers etc. Rooms were larger than I expected and very clean. Would definitely stay here again. Also ate buffet dinner in the restaurant which was very nice. Staff on premier floor were very helpful, especially when we asked for a late check-out due to one of us being ill.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in very good location, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: nutrifit22
Reviews.Content: Had no idea what to expect when arriving in Hong Kong. We were travelling with our 11 month old infant and my Mother on our way home to London from Australia for a 3 night stopover. We took the Hotel bus to the Novotel cause all our luggage wouldn't fit in 1 taxi and we ended up taking it back as well since it was so easy and luxurious! The rooms are very modern but small. We barely had room to walk with our babies tent and our luggage but the facilities are very nice and we weren't spending much time in the room at all! The bed was super cozy and they had great pillows to choose from as well. We booked tours through the concierge which were very helpful. We went on the 1/2 day Hong Kong Orientation which was okay. Victoria Peak is Stunning but we had less than 30 min there, then onto the Fishing Village was wasn't really much of anything and a disappointment really and to a jewelery factory which we didn't realize was written in tiny print on the bottom. This part was ridiculous as nobody was rushed along here! Waste of time! We then finally went to Stanley Market where we only had a 1/2 hour again and no time to shop! At least we know where we want to go see again if we ever go back to Hong Kong! We went on the Sea and Land Whole Day Tour which was better than the previous day although the HArbour Cruise was longer than need be and the Dim Sum lunch albeit good wasn't proper Dim Sum where you could choose your dishes as they pass by. The Cable Car to the Big Buddha is a def do not miss! Stunning ride! The trip to the fishing village on the way home was really good too! We had breakfast at the hotel twice so we would only have to get a small lunch. The buffet is expensive but very filling and pretty good. Free internet in the lobby was really nice and the staff all warm and accommodating. We opted for 45 min back neck and shoulder massages before going home but don't bother, not sure the people are qualified and the "spa" is a little closet sized space. Don't miss the Jade Markets, LAdies Market and the Symphony of Lights! Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Novotel Hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: bdmnmch
Reviews.Content: When our mini bus turned its way toward the Novotel Nathan, we were presented with a surprise, it was our 1st hotel in Hong Kong back in 2005 (we forgot its name back then) and the fact that I didn't have a slightest idea that it was the same hotel. The reason I chose it were due to its under Novotel (my fave chain hotel brand lately) and its rave reviews on Trip Advisor. And it was certainly a perfect hotel to stay in downtown Hong Kong. I loved it cause of its modern interior, comfy bed & pillows, super fast service (I should’ve timed the seconds from the time you hanged up calling the housekeeping until they knocked on your door),walking distance up to 3-4 short blocks to Jordan MTR and bus stops along the main roads. Loved the room cause of its modern design, comfy king size beds and pillows guaranteed to make you sleep well, proper and good lighting (you have corner lights, table, reading lights). Bathroom was lovely too, bathtub was the perfect height, it didn’t give you hassle to go in and out of it after shower. However, a tiny bit irritation was the placement of plastic holder for the amenities, it kept falling off when you were taking your shower, it would be nice if it’s being put permanent to the steel holder.
