It even more memorable to us due to our ‘new 2 fave’ restaurants opposite the hotel, nothing beats local restaurants offering authentic and delicious locals food. We tried the breakfast in the hotel on 1st morning , it was alright but pricing definitely a bit steep and selection not a plenty. If you wish for a quick, cheap and hearty breakfast, it will be right opposite the hotel and we loved loved the Noodle selections (this was our 1st ‘new fave) and for dinner (they don’t open for breakfast), try the one next to 7-11, try the Dessert Selection, loved loved the Sesame Rice Ball and the Almond Milk Selection, Mango Pudding also a must try. Both restaurants have English Menu. We booked through Accor/Hotel website around late September and I'd say it was a good value... Another good point about Accor Hotel is their excellent online booking system. This Hotel definitely my No. 1 choice if staying in HK...

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: Michel99
Reviews.Content: I have been here for two night and just left. I made two mistakes. The first mistake was my room on a smoking floor. well, I am a smoker but this was terrible!! Never smelled something like this before in any hotel. The second mistake was the upgrade to the executive lounge. The price they charge for the upgrade is too much for what you get. 400 hk$ for a poor breakfast and a very poor cocktail hour.The room is smal but looked nice and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RobsieB
Reviews.Content: We took the A21 bus from the airport. It was HK$33. The bus dropped us directly outside the hotel. Took about 45mins. The airport express train was a good distance away and not walkable with luggage, though I believe you can get transitted for free to your hotel. We booked the premium room. The room was spacious and the bathroom a decent size. We have stayed in Hong Kong previously at the Holiday Inn Nathan Road and this room was far bigger. Premium rooms are on the 14th and 15th floor. With the Premium Room we received priority check in, continental breakfast, free internet on the 15th floor. This is separate to other guests. You also receive cocktails and afternoon tea for free. The afternoon tea consisted of cake and finger sandwiches. Nothing special but grea to tide you over till dinner. There were enough options for breakfast. The only thing I was not happy with was that we had to sit on bar stools in the middle of strangers because breakfast was so full. It is only a small room. The staff were very helpful. We ate in the downstairs bar a couple of times and the food was really good. There is no pool but the fitness centre is well equipped. This hotel is half way up Nathan Rd. Directly opposite the Temple Street night markets and a decent walk from Ladies Market. Jade market is not far. It's about 1-2km walk to the harbour to catch ferries. We also used the bus to get back from the ferries. They go up and down Nathan Rd all the time. There are malls on just about every corner if you're into high end brands. We tended to go to the malls around Ladies Market as they seemed a bit cheaper and had other stores besides high end brands. If you shop at the ladies market know your prices and bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Kowloon is basically brand spanking new. Novotels run the whole gamut, from barely clean, to pretty darn nice. This hotel is in pretty darn nice category. Nothing beats a new/newly renovated hotel. Everything was clean and well kept. Everything worked. Nothing to complain about. Service wise, the hotel staff were polite, efficient and helpful. Only downside is the area. There isn't really a lot to do in the immediate vicinity, but the MTR station (Jordan) is pretty close. Elements and Kowloon Station is also a short cab ride away. All in all, pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellersAuckland
Reviews.Content: Very good indeed. Staff very helpful and friendly. Stone Massages excellent. The room was very comfortable and modern. Great location as further away from all the other hotels at the other end of Nathan road and so get more of a sense of the real Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “The Only problem was the Taxi Driver finding the street.......”
Reviews.Author: Teddep
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Novotel for 5 nights in early Dec 09. Based on advice in Trip Advisor we had paid a bit more and gone for the Premium Rooms with access to the Club Lounge. This was totally worth the extra money as you got a exclusive check-in area, unlimited access to the Web (2 PC's) , free bottled water, continental breakfast, afternoon tea and 2 hours of free bar. With 2 fussy teenagers it meant they could eat as much or as little as they wanted with no stress on our parts. My 19 year old particularly liked the free bar. We requested two adjoining rooms, 1 x double and 2 x single which were ready for us on our arrival. The rooms were not massive but the facilities in them made them appear smaller than they actually were. For example each of our rooms had a "chaise- lounge" to recline on but as it was 1m away from the bed, we never used it. The location was fantastic for all the Kowloon attractions, the night markets are 5 mins away and ladies market is a safe 15 min walk or MTR ride if you are tired. The nearest MTR station is only a few minutes walk. We used Taxi's and MTR to get around and as others have said, transport in HKG is relatively cheap and pain free to use. The MTR has to be one of the cleanest subway's I have ever seen. The staff were fantastic and could not do enough for you Across the road from the hotel entrance is a 7-11 so you can buy any drinks (juice, beer, wine) to take back to your room if you feel the need. A new SPA had just opened in the lobby so the four of us checked in for some treatments which were fantastic and with a 50% off, a real bargain compared to Oz. Our room overlooked Nathan Rd but apart from the view you would have never realised how close we were, there was no noise from the traffic One problem totally unrelated to the Hotel was our taxi driver could not find the right road to turn down for the main entrance even with instructions in Chinese supplied by the Hotel, we could see the hotel sign from Nathan Rd but the main lobby area was on a little side street, twice round the block soon sorted this out. Would I stay here again ? most definitely if I wanted the Kowloon attractions, having now made my first visit to HKG ,I have the bug for HKG and want to try other locations.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: 2peregrinators
Reviews.Content: The lobby was dismal looking, but the room we got was decent enough. The hotel has been renovated. It must have been a dive before renovation. The bathroom in the room we stayed in was tight, but the towels were surprisingly plush for a moderately priced hotel. The room itself was okay with a nice big bed and a large tv screen. The elevators for guests were slow. It is not helpful when there are only two elevators for a decent size hotel. The heating/ cooling system was loud. This hotel is okay for those tourists who are out all day and just need a place to sleep and clean up.

Reviews.Title: “it was in a great location”
Reviews.Author: brigette1972
Reviews.Content: the hotel is recently refurbished and it served its purpose well it was a bit small but it had all the amenties that you would ask for the service was fantastic and the breakfast was good the location of all the shops is at your door step so you couldnt ask for anything more would def stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMember
Reviews.Content: We found the Novotel in Kowloon to be pretty good and served our purpose very well. The rooms are rather small, but all the necessary amenities are included and the rooms are very clean. The hotel is located right on Nathan road, just a few blocks from the Nathan road metro stop, which is quite convenient. It is a short walk from the night market and there are loads of restaurants around. The hotel also has a restaurant on site, which is quite good (buffet style), but so many other options available in the area, why not take advantage. Also, the rooms are soundproofed (can't hear neighbors at all). Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTravelmad
Reviews.Content: A relatively new hotel, located pretty well, easy walk to Jordan MRT Station. There are plenty of local shops to fill the most ardent shoppers wishes, and its an easy walk to Tsim Sha Tsui area for more shops. The rooms are typical HK - small, but they are well appointed, clean, tidy and have Wifi. The staff, particularly the ones you need to know things (Concierge) are helpful and friendly. Only one in-house restaurant, but as there are countless places to eat outside, why bother with it. Breakfast selection could be better for those wanting an Asian menu but for Westerners its ok. Cant really fault this hotel too much, would be ideal for business, but as the rooms are small, a family would require more than one. Adjoining rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel, very comfortable and polite staffs.”
Reviews.Author: soonsoon7123
Reviews.Content: will definitely choose this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “once again we are very pleased”
Reviews.Author: livastar
Reviews.Content: this is the second time of the year that we are staying in this hotel. everything was excellent especially the staff even the staff who was cleaning our floor (5th) very friendly. we feel really at home in this hotel and will come back again if we are going hong kong. the free internet service in the lobby was good too.

Reviews.Title: “If once again to HK, we`ll choose this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Finntraveller69
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from Finland and just spent 8 nigths in this hotel: good location, friendly staff, 14th floor worth staying: own reception and breakfast facilities (light but sufficient) etc on the 15th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great City”
Reviews.Author: STEVE78iPSWICH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay at Novotel Nathan Road. Superb spacious, modern and very equipped rooms, fantastic location, combined with excellent service. To add a few more suggestions and not to repeat the previous great comments. •Starbucks one block north and Pacific Coffee 5 – 10 minute walk south down Nathan Road is a great place to stop for breakfast. •Check out Knutsford Steps for a great dining experience with a huge range of restaurants. •Hong Kong Tourist Board walking tours available online or from the Star Ferry tourist office. To give visitors some idea of what you can achieve in a week – our time consisted of:- 1 Star Ferry – Peak Tram – Lunch at Peak Lookout – Dinner Knutsford Steps 2 Kowloon Walking Tour – Lunch at Genki Sushi Langham Place – MTR to Central Market – Tram ride - Dinner Knutsford Steps 3 Ferry Trip to Cheung Chau – Dinner at Bubba Gumps at the Peak 4 Central Walking Tour – Lunch at Soho – Temple Street Night Market 5 Macau 6 Shopping - Come Horseracing Tour to Happy Valley 7 Shopping – Afternoon Tea Pennisular – Harbour Light Show One of the great things about the hotel is the location just 5 minutes from the MTR or a 20 min walk down Nathan Road to the Star Ferry. But don’t forget if you get tired of the “want a tailor, copy watch” knockoff nigels then take the alternative route thru the fantastic and tranquil Kowloon Park. We would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “WE WOULDN'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE IN HONG KONG!”
Reviews.Author: keriblu
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 10 days on the Premier level (15th floor) and couldn't fault the service, cleanliness, location, the room or the value. The Premier level costs a little more but included is a light breakfast (served in a cheerful lounge area), afternoon tea, cocktails, and on-floor concierge service. Plus it is quiet even though the hotel is located on Nathan Road. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms are small but this is HK!!! However they are very well appointed and we were out sight-seeing every day so space wasn't an issue. The location is fabulous. If you catch the bus from the airport you will be dropped right at the Novotel (just walk around the corner to the Lobby) and to return to the airport you use the pedestrian underpass (subway) a few steps from the Lobby and you are right at the bus stop. Jordan rail station (MTR) is short walk (small block) away and from there you can travel anywhere in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel as a base for exploring HK”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Undercover
Reviews.Content: Welcoming friendly staff and well appointed guest rooms - and a great value for money price - giving us a great four night stay at this Novotel Hotel in Hong Kong. Well located along the Nathan Road with various buses (including the A21 from the airport) and the Jordan MTR just over the road - a great base to explore from. A 15 min stroll down Nathan Road past all sorts of shops took us to the ferry terminal for crossing to Hong Kong island. Like most hotels in Hong Kong the rooms are small compared with many Cities. Rooms however well appointed with everything we needed and spotlessly cleaned each day. Breakfast in the restaurant enjoyable although you could probably eat in local venues outside the hotel for less. Still however reasonable value given the choice on the buffet. I'd return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE BUT SMALLISH ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: seeyalaterAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it and the only drawback as with most hotels in Hong Kong is the room size. If you spend a lot of time in your room you would be disappointed but hell who wants to waste time in their room when your on vacation. If the small room size doesn't worry you you will be ecstatic with the location as it is near the Jordan MTR and two blocks from the night markets. There is an abundance of low cost eating houses in the area and some fantastic reflexology outlets offering foot massage for very little money. Staff in the hotel were extremely efficient and courteous and the cleanliness of the rooms was impeccable. A great hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: BlownThermos
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Hong Kong and we stayed here for 4 nights. We ended up taking the Airport Express to Kowloon and a taxi straight to the hotel. The room was modern, well priced,clean and everything we wanted. The room may be a bit smaller than western hotels, but it was more than adequate and far bigger than the hotel we had in Paris. The only thing I would of liked is wi-fi in the room. We ended having Dim Sum a couple of times for breakfast in a restaurant called Cheers around the corner. It had English as well as Cantonese on the same menu and the food was great. We went to other restaurants and as soon as you asked for the English menu the price increased 4x.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very good for business”
Reviews.Author: Anto057
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is well located in a shopping aerea of kowloon. My room was nice, althougn not big and spacious. Each room is equipped with LCD TV and high-speed internet Plug although not free. The Restaurant (The Square) offers international and local cusine. At lunch and at dinner until 9,30 pm there is a convenient buffet. Concierge is very friendly anf helpful especially for tanslating local adresses in Chinese.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 3-5 people”
Reviews.Author: aglazo28
Reviews.Content: booked online in this hotel with a promo, stayed with my mom and brother, near in night market area, good location

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Christine
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Hongkong. Came the hotel directly from airport. Easy to find shuttle bus in the arrival terminal. Cost is about HK$130 and it takes about 30 minutes to reach the hotel. Main entrance of the hotel is located in an adjacent street to the busy Nathan Road. Very friendly staff and helpfull with taxi. Modern facilities. View from my room was not so nice but being in HK, it's normal. Internet worked fine in the room. Have a nice bar/piano bar (I didn't try but looked cosy). Close to the hotel, you have plenty of restaurants - lot of noodle soup shops and 'hole in the wall' restaurants. In the evening, if you take the underground path just outside the hotel, you will reach some busy area with seafood/crab outdoor and some 'tourist market'. Located in Kowloon, you have plenty of shopping malls walking distance. 15 min taxi drive to Central station. Hotel had a gym, looked quite busy but havent visited myself. You have a Seven Eleven right in front of the hotel (did work for my breakfast juice and japanese red bean stuffed pancake). Will surely stay there again for my next visit. Hongkong being one of my favorite asian cities....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Sim038
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in a an Executive Premier Floor Room. I would HIGHLY recommend this style of room to anyone - even with a child. Our room was on the top floor, had our own reception area, computers and free internet use in our reception area, free afternoon tea and Happy Hour. The use of the lounge for afternoon tea and Happy Hour was superb as it gave you a chance to socialise and swap stories with other guests. Our room was small, compared to Australian standards, but the King Size bed was great! Instead of getting in a roll-away for our 13 year old she shared the King size bed with us and we didn't even know she was in it. The rooms are very clean and the service is great. Breakfast downstairs was also terrific. The waitstaff were also very good. I would just be wary of the cost of the buffett dinners - we were tired when we went in so didn't pay much attention to the cost... ended up being about AUD$150 for the three of us, with just three cokes! The location is great and the MTR not too far away. There is no swimming pool at this motel - but to be honest we didn't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: 101holidaylover
Reviews.Content: Went to Hong Kong with 3 girlfriends for non stop shopping and WOW what a hectic 6 days we had. We arrived at the hotel and checking in was prompt and the staff very efficient. We were given rooms on the 12th floor, we caught the lift up and was hit by the smell of cigarette smoke. Went back down to reception and without any trouble at all they moved us to the 10th floor. The rooms have a modern/trendy feel which is nice. The linen was fresh looking, beds very very comfortable and loved the pillows and the selection. Bathroom was very clean and well equipped. Plush bathrobes in the wardrobe for wear. Free bottled water x 2 daily, selection of tea on offer and the newspaper daily. Room service food was fantastic - I had the lamb curry and it had an authentic taste. The serve size was very filling. All the girls had something different and definately no complaints. We also required wine glasses, champagne glasses on some nights to indulge in our duty free wines & champagne after a hectic day of shopping and the glasses was delivered promptly to our room. Rooms made up daily and restocked. House-keeping came one morning and we asked could she return in 1/2 hour as we were still not ready and she was happy to come back in an hour - by then we were ready. Concierge very helpful and could answer all our questions easily and understand what we wanted. They even offered to take our three suitcase of shopping up to our room. What great service and with a smile. Location was also great, one block to the MTR and within walking distance of Temple Street Markets. Mini mart across the road and also two money changers in the street (the one on the same side as the mini mart offered a much better rate - 6.80 HK to Australian Dollar). Watson's pharmacy on the opposite corner to the MTR entrance. Easy railway service to use, all entrances & exits marked with signage, very clean and tidy, people are happy to help with directions. What great service, perfect location, clean and tidy from the entrance all the way to the room. This was my first visit to Hong Kong and I must say I will definately return !!

Reviews.Title: “Large modern rooms at a great price in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: donnalovescheese
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on Nathan Road, 5 mins walk from Temple Street Market, loads of cheap restaurants and Jordan MTR station. The airport bus A21 drops off directly in front of the hotel. Despite the central location we had abolutely no problems with noise of any kind. The rooms are a very good size (certainly as large as any UK hotel room I've ever had) and we only booked a standard double room. The decoration is very clean and modern, very nice. The room contained a massive king sized bed, plenty of hanging space and a good sized modern bathroom. Free internet is offered in the lobby although there are only 4 computers so sometimes you could have to wait a while for a free one. If we ever return to Hong Kong, we will definitely book the Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Curlylocks47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on route to Phuket and got a reasonable rate. Paid extra for executive/VIP room which was probably better as breakfast was included, and it was on the 15th floor, however I would have rather paid a bit more and got a decent view. I am not too keen on overlooking a tenement block but as it was only the one night I wasn't looking at it for too long. The hotel itself was ok and fairly central. The staff were lovely but the room was too small. Breakfast was only ok. All in all I wouldn't stay here again as I am sure there are far nicer hotels in Hong Kong .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with the best accommodation, service and value ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyInHonkas
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 14th floor "Premier Suites" for three nights. Rooms were fantastic, king beds, decor new and modern, airconditioned and extremely clean and well serviced. All staff were efficient and friendly. Our breakfasts, happy hour (2 hours) incl. food, afternoon teas from 3-5 daily, plus free internet access were complimentary and delicious. Would totally recommend Novotel Nathan Road Kowloon, and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights at Novotel Nathan Road. Very polite and friendly staff in a lovely and clean hotel. We stayed in Premier room and enjoyed some of the extra entitlements that come with Premier club- comp water daily,evening cocktails etc. Buffet Breakfast also enjoyable. Affordable value. Thank you to all the staff at this hotel (especially Anne) for a wonderful customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: nicky16
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic three night stay in the Novotel Nathan Road. After five weeks of travelling around Europe staying in hostels and cheaper hotels, this was a very welcome change! The rooms are quite big for Hong Kong, the beds are super comfy - I wanted to take home the duvet and pillows (and you even get a choice on what hardness you would like your pillow to be!!) Bathroom has a bath which can be very welcome after a long day shopping! Great location on Nathan Road, halfway between Mongkok and the harbour. 15 minutes walk max in either direction to get to them. Only a couple of streets over from Temple St night markets which are definitely worth a look - make sure you barter to get the best deals! Nice walk at night down to the Avenue of Stars for the 8pm night shoe. Concierge staff extremely helpful - went out of their way with a couple of our requests - we really appreciated it. Only gripe would be that our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 3.30pm. We'd had a very long couple of days - Eurostar from Paris to London before 12 hour flight from London to HK. We were told the room wouldn't be ready for an hour and were given a welcome drink voucher, which was nice, but all we really wanted was to get up to the room and have a shower! I will definitely be staying there next time I go to HK, after only ever staying in Mongkok before, this area was a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “YES....”
Reviews.Author: jamila_k-mat
Reviews.Content: just got back from a trip in hongkong with my wife and two kids.. First, i hooked up the net 3 months before the trip just to review which hotel to stay. i also checked the hotels with a harbour view but it cost you more than what i paid in novotel coz i got the room by a city sale.. imagine a 50-60% sale on the room... 4nights of stay and you can save that... harbour view is just for people who want to stay in the hotel.. do you spent more time in the hotel when you go for a tour? seven eleven is just a sec of walk and train station is just few minutes... A very, very good service from staffs.. fast and very friedlly, formal and professional... If they could just lower the price of the buffet, coz its a bit expenssive. its like price of 1 is to 3or4.... so if you want to go for a trip to hongkong ill give you some tips according to my experience.... Shopping... temple and ladies market... if you want to buy, get more than just one item coz you can get more discounts.. branded products but you can see its all fake, but who cares... fakes are ment to be like originals so check your item first coz not all have a clean cut.. if they give you a price, dont hesitate to tell them what price you want... Eating.... the eating place in temple street... the best place for eating experience... a lot of foreigners go there at night just to have a dinner.. not as clean as you want... good place people who stay in jordan area hotels.. Transport... taxis are expensive and some drivers are rude.. extra charge for your baggages... some people do a lot of walking just to save money for shopping... ill stay again in novotel kowloon given a chance ....

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: StokeonTrent_UKLinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Nathan road. It is in pristine condition and spotlessly clean. The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The location is very good as it is near to the Temple street night market and close to Jordan tube station. From the tube station you can easily get to any destination. If you prefer to use buses, lots of them leave from Nathan Road. We had a lovely stay here and would choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MY20
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean and staff was very helpful. Location was great as it was so close to tube.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and lovely people”
Reviews.Author: jjw62au
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice room with view of the street below. Very nice staff that could not do enough for you. Fridge not very cold was the only downside. If you left your shoes outside the door they cleaned them for free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, will come back if promotion is on...”
Reviews.Author: icebaby0
Reviews.Content: We managed to book 1 standard room and 1 superior room during their 3 days Asia sale at S$100 and S$125 per night respectively. Generally the difference between the standard and superior were: standard had bathtub, superior didn't. Superior had 3 complimentary water, higher floor, free bedroom sleepers. Other than that, the size and room were the same. Each room comes with a single sofa seat. We had free roll away beds, so sleeping was so comfortable esp when each of us had our own bed. The bed was good and so were the pillows. We had 6 in total of bedroom pillows and 3 small pillows. With the rollout bed open, there weren't much space to walk BUT we loved the bed. The roll away bed was fantastic. As everything was new, so everything smelt new. We took the airport express from Kowloon, took like I think 6-8 stops before it reached Eaton hotel which was 2 streets from Novotel (2 small lanes more likely...very short walk). And airport express back to Kowloon is 2 stops from Eaton to Kowloon station! MTR was 3 streets away. On Novotel lane, there is a subway (their term for an "underpass") to go over to the other side. Porridge shop opposite Novotel serves good porridge. Overall, the experience was a total thumbs up. Would stay there again if i can get the promotional value if not, it will be pretty expensive compared to other hotels such as Cityview.

Reviews.Title: “Loving every moment!”
Reviews.Author: melbgiggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 19 to 21 June 2009. I booked directly through the hotel's website for about 100GSD per night. A week our arrival, we were invited to upgrade our room to the Executive Floor for an extra 50 SGD, with daily breakfast and afternoon tea/snacks. Of course, we did! The room is well decorated and the amenities were adequate. We love the array of snacks in the afternoon with free flow of beer and juices. The location was apt, with the MTR Jordan just footsteps away. On top of that, we had free broadband access in our hotel room. An excellent stay and we'll definitely be back with Novotel Nathan road should we visit Hong Kong again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B'Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dara58
Reviews.Content: My hubby surprised me with a trip to Hong Kong for 5 days/4nights. for my birthday. He got a great deal with this hotel. Let me first just say the location of this hotel is perfect, right in the middle of Nathan Road. So either way up or down the road is great. A short walk to the Temple road night market which is huge as there is 2 parts to it. Also the Ladies Market, during the day which was about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The young lady who checked us in, was very polite and quick. Our room was on the 6th floor. Good size room, the bed (king size) was very comfortable as was the pillows and doona. The bathroom had all the lovely bits "n" pieces included, shampoo, body lotions, toothbrushes and toothpaste etc. Our only negative was the bathroom door which was a sliding door and also covered the cupboard space area, so every time you shut the door to the bathroom the cupboard light was on. A little annoying. We did not have breakfast included in our deal but we did eat breakfast there. A large variety to cover everyone's tasted I'm sure. We did not get the chance to use the pool so cannot comment on that area. Overall this hotel was perfect, nothing flash but it was clean and right in the perfect spot. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Melvinlhm
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel, which is modern looking and clean. Unlike other hotels which have a lingering cigarette smoke smell, this hotel doesn't. Location is good, near the Jordan MTR, some nice eateries. Staff are friendly and the hotel has 4 iMacs for guests use. Unfortunately, the time limit is a little short. I liked this hotel so much I even cut short my stay in Macau to return to Hong Kong earlier. I'd definitely consider this hotel the next time I travel to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool.. But think twice about Premier Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mms77
Reviews.Content: This was a very cool, chic, modern hotel.. just my type. We opted for the Premier upgrade so that we could make use of the Premier Lounge. It offers breakfast, snacks, cocktails... but realized that it wasn't worth the extra 275 HK dollars. The breakfast was so-so, the snacks were quite pathetic, and the cocktails ended way too early for cocktails (8:30?!?!)..

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a busy street”
Reviews.Author: vdany
Reviews.Content: easy to get there by the airport express train & a 15 minute ride (free) by bus or a 5 minute ride by cab (for less than 5$) We got a high floor although we asked for the "simple" rooms that were booked when we arrived. The room was confortable and the personal nice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterTravels
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent few nights at the Novotel Kowloon. The room on the executive floor was excellent. The bed was comfy and everything was modern and great. Providing the electrical converter was a huge help. For a little bit more (exec. floor price), we got breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails in the evening. We never got around to enjoying afternoon tea, but the other two were pretty good. In the evening, we enjoyed beer, wine, cocktails and some great food, although I noticed that the two times we went they didn't change the menu. The hotel's location is further pretty good. It is located near markets, shopping, food etc and just a few minutes to Jordan station. In the end, if you get a reduced price, this is an excellent find. We enjoyed summer rates. Thus, I am pretty happy about my price and stay. I would avoid the tours offered downstairs. We went on the Hong Kong island tour and were bored to death. It was expensive and a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Novotel group!”
Reviews.Author: syloft
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights of stay here via Accor's 3 day website sales at a very good deal! We were upgraded to the superior room upon check in and we were delighted! Love the modern decor of the room, and also the options of choosing the kind of pillows that you like. Bed was comfy as well. The feel of the room was very cosy, clean and comfortable. Oh yes, do remember to put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on, to prevent intrusion of your sleep from the housekeeping ladies who started to call rooms up for housekeeping at 830am! There's also a gym for those who are interested in working out, what is lacking is a swimming pool. Location of the hotel is great, just about 5 mins walk from Jordan MTR Exit B. Once again, Novotel has lived up to its name! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Cosy & Comfy”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPrincess
Reviews.Content: have a great stay over here. room was cosy and comfortable and service as good. didnt had a chance to try the buffet lunch at the hotel though. i will definitely stay here again ~! will be great if there are more TV channels and if there are disposable comb and shaver provided in the hotel room..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you're paying for!”
Reviews.Author: ArcherScali
Reviews.Content: The hotel really lived up to it's name. Everything is great, friendly staff & free internet at lobby. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: etll
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel when the Accor hotels had their 3 day asia sale. For HKD4XX per night excluding breakfast, it was a steal. This hotel is centrally located. The MRT is less than 10 mins walk from the hotel. The temple street market is just across the road and there is an underground pass. Plenty of restaurants around the area and 7-11 is located just next door. Room - New, modern but small. I guess all hotels in HK are generally small in size. Lighting in the room was good. No complimentary bottled water provided. Bathroom - Came with the usual amenities but you can request for other amenities if you require them. Reception - They only had 2 reception counter and another reserved for the Accor Advantage members. It took awhile but waiting time was considerably okay. We arrived at 14:30 and rooms were still not ready. So went across the road to this restaurant called Nathan Congee and Noddle shop which served excellent noodles. Service - Fast and excellent Facilities - The gym is well equipped, there is paid wifi at HKD 80-90 per hour with nice Macs.

Reviews.Title: “For a little extra you get a lot”
Reviews.Author: Keitel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 14-21 of July. The point I would like to make is the good value of the $125HK per person for the upgrade which included a room on the top floors, breakfast was buffet style (not as extensive as that downstairs,but certainly enough for most), afternoon tea (limited selection of sanwiches.and cake or pudding, tea.) Evening cocktails, 5:30-8:30, was help yourself style, including wine, spirits, beer and soft drinks. It also included two hot dishes,often tandori chicken and spicy meatballs,dips papadams, beancurd, duck or salmon, nuts. After eating this you probably won't want to go out for more. Service was outstanding. Just ask and it is done in a flash, nothing is too much trouble. Location is brilliant as it is away from the really touristy part of the Tsim Sha Tsui area, unless you like the high end shopping culture. This hotel is around the block from the Temple street markets and hundreds of other less pretentious shops. Seven/eleven store across the road and Wing On Department Store across Nathan Rd catered for many of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DJEMJE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and could not fault it. It was clean, the staff were friendly. The hotel itself is only 2 blocks from the MTR Jordan station, from there we could get to nearly anywhere. It is not the cheapest, but it is in the middle of everything. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Only down side was - no pool - but can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Loved Loved It”
Reviews.Author: millie2112
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my two children (20 and 16) for 2 nights(15/16 of July) The hotel is very easy to get to. We took the bus from the airport and got off at the bus stop in Nathan Rd. We got off at the wrong stop and had to walk a little bit but that was ok. I booked the hotel when the Accor sale was on , so I got a very good deal for the room. Later I received an email regarding an upgrade. The upgrade was for the premier floor and included breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks. I decided to go for the upgrade and paid $250 Hong Kong extra for the upgrade(per night). I know that some on the forum have said the upgrade is not worth it, but for me it was and it was just fabulous. We arrived at about 9.30am and were exhausted after travelling non-stop for about 24 hours. We were shown to our room straight away. We were to have a roll out bed for the 3rd person. this was brought immediately. My son missed breakfast on the plane so he went to the premier room and ate breakfast. The room was on the small side but it was clean. Bathroom was also tiny. A bit of mould around the shower - but again no big deal. The beds were really comfortable. The pillows perfect. The doona perfect. The sheets just right. We had the best sleep. Breakfast was tasty - had the usual cereal, toast, eggs, pastries , juice and good coffee. Ater sight seeing each day, we would go back and have the free drinks and nibblies. This I really appreciated. My kids also got to use the internet for free and made use of it well. I really loved this hotel. It was very comfortable. The staff were also very nice. It was a good base because it was close to everything. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pianist/ Singer in the bar and overall a well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLEWY71499JONES
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Novotel Citygate a great hotel and this time we wanted to try a Kowloon location. Citygate staff recommend to try our Nathan Road property and I wasn't disappointed. My wife I went into the bar and to our suprise we found our favourite pianist/singer Mona from Regal Airport playing here everynight now. To have someone reconised us both by name is very nice and Mona is just a fantastic person not to mention a great pianist/singer. The Novotel was very busy and although they seemed pushed at times were always very friendly and accommodating. Goodbye Regal, these two Novotels will always now have our Hong Kong business now..

Reviews.Title: “best in nathan road”
Reviews.Author: iwanttotravelforfree
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at my stay last june 27-29 at this hotel. I stayed with my spouse and my daughter whose celebrating her birthday here. The hotel was easy to locate. I took an airport bus for more or less 30hkd for adults and half for my kid. As soon as we alight the bus, it was only less than 3 kms from the bus stop. it is across the jordan subway. Upon check in, we arrived 3 hours early for check in, the concierge willingly took our baggages, helped us carry it from 2f (hotel lobby) to the ground level. At the front desk, Phoebe checked our passport and we completed our registration. They took our credit card imprint for incidentals. I asked Phoebe hows the weather forecast for the rest of our stay for it was my daughters bday the ff day and we are planning to go to Disneyland. after giving us info, she gave my daughter a little reindeer stuffed toy as a birthday present. sweet indeed. it could be something small, but my 4yo daughter liked the attention. even the manager on duty greeted my daughter in advance. When we got back at pass 9pm to check in, i was surprised that they took care of our needs that I emailed a month before our check in. I even forgot that I have asked for a room far from the lift as to not disturb our sleep, the roll away bed is ready and prepared for my daughter, there are 2 big pillows for each of us and we have a room that has a tub. I believe we had an upgrade for free for we were advised early on that our unit has no tub. The room is abover average than other Hongkong hotels. We got 2 single beds. but the single bed's size is close to a double bed. our sleep was so comfortable, great big, comfy beds. functioning aircon. great blinds/ curtains and the rooms makes you think that you are the first one to use it. I like this better than the Prudential. In Prudential there are so many space but smaller beds. I won't be loitering in the bedroom anyway. But i will be lying down when I am inside as I am always out the rest of d day to go on sight seeing.Toilet is all that you could ask for. It has all the basics. There is a bowl of mentos candy on the reception, my daughter is very eager to get 1 everytime that we go down. And while I log in to the net for my free 30 min everyday, my daughter plays and read on the other side. they have a small kids corner with books than toys. walking distance to jordan MTR, Ferry bus and airport bus is all less than 5 min walk. night market at temple is so close. at the nathan hotel on the right block, 2f offers great, cheap dimsums. at the exact congee store across the hotel, they have the best congee at only 20-30 hkd. there are 2. try the one farther than 711. i can't remember the exact name. at the temple market try the dimsum eatery which is inside the chinese restaurant on the farthest right. this superb dimsum place is hidden. they are sharing space with 2 more chinese eateries that serves short order and they have the best hakao and siomai i have ever tasted in my life. 1 order is 30-35 each the stay was really great. And we will definitely stay back here if and when I go back to hongkong.*************************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for kids”
Reviews.Author: timekeeper28
Reviews.Content: Novotel NAthan Rd Kowloon near Temple night market. (Beware pick pockets) Accor have an excellent reputation let down by this experience. We travelled with two families with young children. When booking sent email to confirm that the hotel could accomodate the kids. Reply was that they could. Rang hotel and spoke to them in English & Chinese and again confirmed that they could. When we arrived after a night flight one room was ready, not a problem for us two but they could not provide two rooms with a double/twin single and an extra bed. Finally squeezed an extra bed leaving in their idea of a settee, two square modular units that one perched on rather than sat. I don't expect rooms to be generous in size but this was crowded. The only way to open or close the curtains was to climb over the beds. We had enquired about the upgrade package offered but a continental breakfast, express check-in and the same size room was not an attractive deal for 50% more. Check in was not particularly well handled as we should have been offered suitable rooms on arrival not the try a few rooms/floors aproach. Another couple also were checked in late after arriving early afternoon. They paid for the extras package and ended up in the same size room. Whoever designed a sloping large bedhead that pushes a king single/double bed into the room so one cannot manoeuver self or luggage about should be made to stay in said room for a year without being allowed out. On the Plus side. For a couple, and with the special price offered earlier this year. The staff mostly helpful and hotel was good value. 20 minutes free internet daily. Just leave the kids at home. PS one street over was a portugese style restaurant. Apple Barbeque that was downstairs, nicely airconditioned, soup, mains, desert and drink for less than $60 HK. Individual mains ~$30hk meat and vegetables. Chinese cafes over the road cheap for breakfast. Did not eat at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Davidcsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Kowloon from the 20-24 June and we have a really bad experience with the check in. The staff was doing million of thing while looking after us and then we were given a 2 single bedroom instead of 1 king size even though we made our book and paid for it like 1 month ago. While arguing we were told that either that or late check in like 8pm which was inappropriate as we were tired since we set off since 6:00 am and was now 4pm. We asked for the manager who never came around but when the reception guy came back, a king size bedroom was ready to check in. We felt so cheated and what a liar, from no room to one ready to check in within the 2 mins he was gone. Its a NEVER AGAIN FOR THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gary2007
Reviews.Content: Located in Jordan, a few seconds walk to Nathan Road. This hotel is great value for money. Clean rooms and nice facilities. Got a connecting room and size is good for HK standards. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our way back from UK. Staff were very polite and friendly Service was very good. Our room was clean and very nice, it had recently been upgraded. The room was large. We ate at the restaurant, it was ok nothing out of the ordinary. We caught the mtr a few times. easy to use Walking distance to Ladies and Mens markets. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location of hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Klokan73
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as an Advantage Plus member for our 7 day stay in Hong Kong. The hotel is easily reached from the airport by a public airport bus no.21 at HK$33 one way but be prepared that the bus takes about 1 hour to get to the bus stop no.10 (Nathan Hotel) and then it's about a 1 minute wall to the hotel (entrance to hotel is located on Saigon Street). Check-in was very easy and the reception staff were very friendly, our kids were given plush toys (tiger and seal). We had a king bed room with a rollway bed on the 6th floor with a bath (on request). There are 4 internet stations for hotel quests to use for free but limited to 20 minutes each day, plenty of time to check the emails. The Temple St Night Market is a 2 minute walk via subway underpass, Mongkok shopping (ladies market, electronics & sporting) is a 20 minute walk. Next to reception area there is a tour desk, bought Disneyland tickets there as they were cheaper than buying online or at the gate and accepted payment with Visa credit card, staff were very friendly and helpful. Walked to the Star Ferry terminal about a 30 minute walk through Kowloon Park but you can catch a bus. Bus to Stanley Markets no.973 also leaves near there. Cleanliness of our room was faultless, we did occassionally get less towels than the 4 required but a call to housekeeping and we had extra towels within 5 minutes. Didn't dine at the hotel so can't comment on the food or service. We did grocery shopping at Welcome supermarket located about 5 minutes walk from hotel. As our flight wasn't till midnight, we check out around 9am leaving our luggage with the concierge and went to Ocean Park for the day. In the evening we caught the airport bus to airport. Overall I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleastant stay”
Reviews.Author: TimmyJamesB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a stay in Hong Kong. My girlfriend and I stayed two nights as a short visit on the way to the UK. We stayed on the premier floor for a small fee which upgrades you to the highest floor and you can then have breakfast, afternoon tea and free alcohol in the evening. - you also get free internet on this floor whereas you would have to pay for it otherwise. The food however was nothing special - but the alcohol was plentyful. The rooms were small but modern and our room was quite clean. The staff were adequate and helped us with any questions we had. The lift service was fine and check-in and check-out also a speedy process. Location wise...I recommend if staying here, make use of Hong Kong's fantastic MTR (underground train system) as the Novotel is a two minute ride from Jordon Station. It is probably a 20 minute walk down to the prominade and ferry services to take you to main island. Don't expect a view from your hotel room - but you are in Hong Kong, why would you stay in your room and check out the view anyway?

Reviews.Title: “location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: holidaycrazyIndia
Reviews.Content: the approach to the hotel is misguiding, but the hotel itself is a good surprise. its in a bylane just across the temple street market.not shady,good location. right next to it there's a 7-11 store.the jordan mrt station is about 2 blocks away, a 3-4 min walk.very much in the city but also away from the madness of tsim tsa shui,which is just the next station.hotel is very good, but always ask for higher floors.i was on the 7th floor, too close to other residences nearby. need to keep the curtains drawn all the time.a friend on the 13th floor was better off.bathroom and room very modern and new. loved the interiors. the reception restaurant and bar on the first floor are good.there's free internet access for residents for 20 mins. each day.all in all a lovely experience and value for money.the staff is very co-operative.needed a late check-out. not once did they hurry me up.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SKL2009
Reviews.Content: We were in Hong Kong for 2 days on vacation and I booked Novotel based on tripdvisor reviews. I got a wonderful deal with a second room for the children at half price. We had two adjoining rooms with interconnecting doors which was perfect for the 4 of us (Self, wife and 2 kids). The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable and service was efficient. The tour desk offered us many options for sightseeing and we took the evening cruise and day sightseeing. The Hotel on Nathan Road is very conveniently located just minutes from the Kowloon Ferry Pier and choice of shopping and eating places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fabulous value for money”
Reviews.Author: jobanoonoos
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel! I first stayed at the Novotel Nathan Rd for a 3 night stopover coming back from a holiday in Japan. I was so impressed by the affordability, amenities and location that I returned for a week for a girls shopping trip in September 2008. I was not let down and am now booked in for a stay at the end of 2009. The hotel is stylish, sleek and, most importantly, in close proximity to public transport and great food and shopping (particularly the Temple Street night markets....I can highly recommend the street food there, by the way!) I found the hotel buffet to be pretty good - breakfast provides a wide variety of cuisines and flavours. Use of computers in the lobby is a nice touch and the rooms are more than comfortable (and surprisingly large by Asian standards). Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Good location”
Reviews.Author: princesspea01
Reviews.Content: Whilst not in the 'swanky-ist' part of Nathan Rd and Kawloon, this hotel was really good value for money and doesn't cost the same as the ritzy hotels up the other end either. The location so close to Jordon MTR just made it so accessible as well. Good modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Floor - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: championsmay2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for 6 nights at the end of April 2009 in an Executive room, we were able to check into the room at 9am, which was fantastic, the room was great, the staff all very friendly and helpful, the extra's that you get, breakfast, afternoon tea and a 3hour cocktail session with free hot snacks was really good. The only downside, and its not much of a one is the view from the bedroom (15th floor) wasn't fantastic. If you haven't been Hong Kong is great, and I would thoroughly recommend the Novotel Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “No point staying at the Premier Floor”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the premier floor inclusive of breakfast, afternoon snacks, cocktails and internet. Not really worth the money. Breakfast out of the hotel was better and cheaper. Afternoon snacks were quite lousy, some pastry and simple ham-cheese sandwiches. Cocktails were surprisingly good, compared to the breakfast and afternoon snacks. Don’t expect the hotel to serve any dim sum during these meals. The only dim sum I had was a bun during breakfast, which was a far cry from what I expect in HK. There was free 20 minutes internet at the lobby, additional internet in the room was good to have but not essential. It is wired access not wifi. Room was small but reasonably modern. However, housekeeping was not really professional. Apart from the bed and bathroom, the rest of the room was not really ‘cleaned up’. Glasses were left unwashed at the mini-bar. Room service was fast and good, but not really cheap. Useful if you feel like not leaving the hotel during the rain. No bathtub at the premier floor! If you want to have a bathtub, you have to get the standard twin room, which was quite disappointing. If you want or need a bathtub after a hot day in HK, this is not the level or hotel for you. The gym was smaller size than the hotel room, so don’t expect much. It is one of the smallest gyms that I’ve seen at a hotel. There is no swimming pool at the hotel, which was ok for me as it was raining most of the time during my stay. No VIP treatment as was advertised in the hotel webpage when you stayed on the Premier floor. Concierge refuses to give additional umbrella to me (who am staying on the executive floor) but gave an additional umbrella to a Caucasian (who was not staying at the executive floor)! Forcing me and my friend to share an umbrella in the heavy rain! Location wise was quite ok, near temple street, lady street, the MTR. Easy access to HK island and most other interesting places. The restaurants and eateries opposite the hotel provide better and a greater variety of food. Try the dessert stall opposite, it is cheap and good. I probably won't stay here again unless there's a promotion. Given the price I've paid, there are better hotels out there in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with choice”
Reviews.Author: Mistycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before going to the Parklane ( husband had business meeting to attend thus work paid for Parklane). We chose the Novotel because they had a great Asia Sale when I was looking at booking our hotel, we paid $550HK and then paid another $250HK to upgrade to a premier room. We stayed our last 2 nights at the Novotel Citygate. The hotel is in a great spot, walking distance to TST and Mongkok, although we has an Octopus card we really enjoyed walking around hotel. There were definately less people hassling you to get tailoring then further down Nathan Road. The hotel is close to Temple Street night markets where we ate dinner twice, cheap and enjoyable. For nicer shopping you do need to go further down Nathan road or better still to Hongkon Island or Citygate Mall. The rooms are small but very user friendly and clean, TV has good viewing. The internet provided free as part of the upgrade required a cable that the hotel provided, speed OK. The upgrade included breakfast in the premier room, this was limited but ok quality, the afternnon tea was really only a sad piece of cake. The evening cocktails and snacks were nice and guest sat around talking to each other. I would stay here again if the price was right, however the upgrade at the Novotel Citygate was far better. This hotel is a good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy”
Reviews.Author: fayyong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the labour day holidays for 3 nites. Booked from the Accor Sales(very cheap) weekdays cost about 4xx hkd a nite! Location is superb! only 5 minutes to Jordan MTR and u can use subway to pass nathan road and get to temple street. Check in was annoying, as i've booked 5 rooms, they required all guests passport for registration which took up a very long time. Besides they need me to arrange which guest and which guest share a room, so what is this hassle all about? Just feeling all these are unnecessary as we were all so exhausted after travelling from Disney hotel. Our room were standard room on the 7th floor. No view , room is facing some residential buildings. I guess all standard room are without view. Size is good enough. There is bathtub in my room as i requested from them earlier through email. You gonna need this in hk! TV offer only about 28 channels?( All boring channels) include pay TV channel which is ridiculously priced and with some old,uninteresting movies. Bath amenities were good enough but there's no bathrobe,slippers and complimentary water (standard room perhaps?). Anyway you could get it at 7-11 opposite the hotel.Did not have breakfast there as it charges too much about 120hkd if im not mistaken. Can always go to temple street for breakkie~ Overall i enjoy my stay with the hotel, will return if only during accor sales =)

Reviews.Title: “Room next to the Service Lift”
Reviews.Author: avagraceisace
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was great. Nice and clean, the staff were friendly. I managed to get the room at a great rate with the Novotel Asian sale at the beginning of the year. Location was evreything I could have asked for and more. Very handy to the Night Markets and a pleasant (and interesting) walk to the Ladies Market, Gold Fish Market and Bird Garden. Buses were literally at the front door and left every 30 seconds (or so it seemed). I had the buffet breakfast which was nice and easy and a pleasure after eating Chinese food all the time. i didn't do the buffet dinner as it seemed rather expensive, so I can't comment on that. The only complaint I have (and it took me a few days to work out), was the droning noise next to my room (at first I thought it was some sort of building works). It was constant durng the day and just loud enough to become very annoying. I was woken up at 6am every morning (we stayed 4 nights). Was going to ask for a room move, but couldn't be bothered with the changing of rooms. 'Droning noise' would stop at about 9pm. With a 4 year old in tow and the need to have a relax in the afternoon it would have been nice to have no 'droning'. Not to mention a sleep in on my holiday after days and nights of sight seeing. Anyway, I can only guess it was the service lift in the cleaners room next to our room. The occassional banging coming from the cleaners room as things were dropped or moved about I could put up with, but the constant droning was enough for me to never want to stay in that room again. If you are offered a room next to the cleaners room - Run! Other than that, I had a pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel - just not the rooms next to those lifts!

Reviews.Title: “Hong Pong”
Reviews.Author: RexVictoriaAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Nathan Road HK is a good 3.5 star hotel in an excellent location for shopping and public transport. We stayed on the club floor which has a small club which seats about 25 people. The rooms are small and clean suitable for 2 guests only. The staff are friendly enough but some seem to have a fixed "grave yard type of smile". I do not recommend the food in the hotel but plenty of other better food nearby.The resident Indian tailor out the front of the Hotel makes a real pest of himself and can be quite rude. Hong Kong was a real let down with terrible smog visability very poor and not good for anyones health. Disneyland really is not up to the standard of other Disneylands around the world very small and very tame rides with a lot of very rude queue jumping mainland chinese which will really spoil your stay. What Disneyland lacks in wild rollercoaster type rides can easily be recitifyed by taking a double decker bus from the top of the summit back to the tram as these bus drivers drive as if they have a death wish. Madam Tussauds lacks the display in London and is very poor value for money. It is impossible to get a real good view of Hong Kong from the Peak because of the smog.The Panda Bears are worth seeing at ocean park. In closing I suggest you give Hong Kong a big miss and travel elsewhere in asia. The best part of Hong Kong is watching the runway lights disappear into the smog on take off.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, Good location”
Reviews.Author: lwk-my
Reviews.Content: Booked online during the Accor 3 day sales in Feb 09 for a 6 nights stay. For the first 2 nights we didn't get the room with a double bed as we requested. This could be due to our late check-in. Finally got a room with a double bed on the 3rd night. Rooms are of adequate size. It has a large screen Sony Bravia flat screen TV with a good selection of TV channels. Location is very good - the Airbus A21 stops right in front of the hotel and the airport express shuttle bus (K1) stops 2 streets away at Pak Hoi street in front of Eaton Hotel. Plenty of eateries and shops as soon as we step out of the hotel. Temple Street Night market and Ladies market are within walking distance from the hotel. The Star Ferry pier and Avenue of Star are about 25 - 30 min walk. Only one negative experience from our stay - we were attacked by bedbugs in the second room we stayed in. Till now, we are still recovering from that episode.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: CD001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Overall all it was a pretty good hotel. We have stayed at numerous hotels in Hong Kong. I would say that the room was average size, the location was good (about 2 minute walk to MTR). Free internet in lobby for 30 minutes/day. Room was quiet. We have stayed in hotels that were twice as much and definitely not much better. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: VTAS
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 standard rooms during 1st week of Apr, got it for a good rate during the Accor hotels promo. Design and Amenities: Very new and modernised, interesting lightings in room. Hotel room provides 3 types of pillow - soft, medium and hard though i cant tell a difference. Bed is comfy, toilet would have been better if there was a bath tub. Location: Novotel is located in between Jordan and Yau Ma Tei MTR (nearer to Jordan MTR). At main nathan road, it takes only 5 min walk to Temple Street. And 15 min walk to Ladies market, Fa Yuen Street etc. Checking in of rooms: Had a bit of problem with check in as they were pretty strict with 3 pax sharing and insisted on charging for 3rd pax. Not advisable for triple sharing as rooms are quite small. Overall we had a good stay with Novotel @ Nathan Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Sept_Rain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely renovated so everything were new. The design was very zen & modern. We went for the superior room and was given a room on the higher floor. We didn't hear much noise but there was no view either. My room was actually oppossite a residential apartment. There's a LCD TV, stand in shower and nice amenities. The room is small (common for HK hotels) so if you have more than 3 adults, i recommend you get a bigger room or go to another hotel. There is a 7-11 just opposite the hotel - you can pick up magazines, drinks etc easily. I didn't have any meals at the hotel as there are nice cafes and a dessert stall just opposite the hotel. I requested for a late checkout and the reception was very accomodating. A 5 mins walk to the Jordan MTR. Cons: we took the airport express train (we hop onto the Tsuen Wan train at Central MTR) and it was challenging trip to the hotel. There was no lift to the street level - you have to carry your luggage up the stairs and down the stairs. So i suggest you either take a cab or take the airport bus. There isn't much shopping around the hotel area too. You have venture out to Mong Kok or TST or Central etc. Other than this, it is a nice hotel & i won't mind visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: kazataza
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in early Apr on the 14th floor (the highest floor is 15th). Had booked the stays during the Accor Sale and paid less than HKD2600 for 4 nights. Pros: - Hotel is newly renovated. Hence all the rooms and designs are still very "new". Rooms come with Sony LCD TV, LED reading lights, etc. - Great location. Jordon MTR is just less than 5 mins walk away. - If you're taking the free airport express train shuttle bus, line K1 (which stop at Eaton) is just 2 streets away. It's just a short 3 mins walk. A21 bus stop is very near as well. We took a cab from the Kowloon station (of the airport express) to the hotel. Cost us HKD32 (note: HKD5 for our 1 piece luggage) - 7-11 is just across the hotel - Near to Temple Street, so no worries you're hungry at night - Complimentary internet access (20 mins per day). You have to obtain the password at the front desk. 4 MACs are available at the hotel lobby for use as well. Cons:- - Gym is small and no swimming pool (if these are important considerations for you when choosing a hotel). - No bath tub for the room that I'm staying - Room is not very big. This is quite typical for HK hotels. I'd stayed in Kowloon Hotel before and its far worse than Novotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mmyk72
Reviews.Content: Others have written that the rooms are small, but I disagree. By HK standards, the size is very comfortable. I had a twin room (2 beds), which fits 2 adults nicely. The beds are placed close to each other with a small gap in the middle. There's enough space for luggage and we certainly don't feel squeezed into a box like other HK hotels I've heard of. The lobby and room feel new and is tastefully furnished. Bed/pillow are comfortable and linen is fresh and clean. The bath has a modern chic look. I love the walk-in shower (others may not like this if they have children) except the shower water doesn't go into the drain very quickly. The way the bath door closes is clever but a bit weird. It slides back and forth and serves both the bathroom and the closet. It's a bit annoying that the closet light stays on as long as the closet is open. Bottled water is provided. Since you can't just drink out of the facuet in HK, I usually use more than the 2 bottles supplied. Housekeeping sounds a bit reluctant everytime I call for more, but they still bring additional bottles nevertheless. My view is not that great (not facing the main street and into some old building not too far away). But I don't think that's a big deal. The windows do block out all the sound and has great slide down shades. Air conditioning is not super cool. I end up setting the temp to 15C just to keep it going. Otherwise the fan kicks on without cooling and the humidity builds up (this was not even in the summer). Location is super as others have said. I actually prefer this area more than the more touristy section in Tsim Sha Tsui. Here, you can walk a few steps and join the locals for food, shopping, etc. If you are arriving by bus, you get off at the same stop as Eaton Hotel. The hotel entrance is in a side street. The Wing On Department store across Nathan Rd is a good landmark. There are a lot of local restaurants, so I did not eat in the hotel at all (my room did not incl free bkf). In HK, you can easily have breakfast for under US $5. No need to pay the hefty hotel price. I agree that lobby service is not super great. But, I didn't expect much more (it's not like this is a 5 star hotel). The internet is free for 20 min at the computer terminals in the lobby (I think there are 6 Mac's for use). I got my own computer connected to wifi with no time limit in the lobby (maybe I was lucky?). Printing is HKD $5 per page, which I thought was ridiculous. Overall, this is a great hotel without the outrageous pricetag. It's a solid choice. One thing I should complement the hotel on: I left a small electrical converter plugged in at the desk and didn't realize it until after I checked out. I called the hotel back and they found the item and kept it for me at the front desk so that when I returned to the hotel, they instantly gave it back to me. That's pretty efficient.

Reviews.Title: “good safe choice”
Reviews.Author: brookea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated not too long ago,so everything was quite new. The room had no weird smell and very clean. The bathroom was small but very clean. King size bed was good not too hard. The subway station was only a few minutes away and only took 20 minutes to talk to the Star Ferry pier, or you could just take the bus which stopped almost in front of the hotel. The hotel also gave 20 minutes per day free Internet access, enough for me to check email and look up some travel info. service was so so, but I really didn't deal with them except check in and check out. Tried the breakfast buffet for the first couple of days, for $150 HKD, wasn't really worth it for me. For what I paid overall it was good value I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for stay in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: Lew88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Nathan Road , the main strip in downtown Kowloon, and is in a great location. It is 5 minutes to Temple St night market, close to Mongkok & Yau Ma Tei where goods and food are cheaper than the main tourist area of Tsim Sha Tsui. The MTR metro train station of Jordon is just acound the corner, and the bus stop is right outside the hotel in Nathan road. To get to the Star Ferry terminal which will take you across Hong Kong harbour to the main Island , you can walk or take a 10 minute bus ride. Walking will give you insite into the wide varierty of shops and restaurants which are open to 11pm in the evening. The hotel rooms are larger than the average Hong Kong Hotel room, and is clean and functional, as the hotel was only renovated a couple of years ago. Unfortunately there is no swimming pool, and the gym is very small, but as you are probably out shopping/sightseeing, you probably will not have much chance to use these facilities. Walking in Hong Kong is the best way to see it, and you will get fit at the same time . The Premier floor that we stayed on provides free breakfast , free Internet access ( broadband in room ), afternoon tea and drinks in the evening, all in the one room charge. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting a hotel that is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: bernyb23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Novotel from March 7-8 then checked out for our trip to macau on March 9-10 then came back for an overnight stay on March 10-11.With this shuttling back and forth from the hotel we never encountered any problems with the service of the staff specially when we had to check in and out of the hotel that often. The rooms sizes were not that big but enough for 2-3 person and their quite new or they just know how to maintain it that well. The location is centrally located specially if your travelling with two senior citizens. Its near an mtr, shops and restaurants so a regular tourist won't have a hard time getting around. And if ever you get hungry at night you can just cross the street and a 7-11 is just there. All in all i guess my stay with novotel is one of the best stay i had in hongkong and i wouldn't mind staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not "family friendly"”
Reviews.Author: kiwinz_7
Reviews.Content: The start of our 7 week round the world holiday, family of four 10 and 15 year old kids plus 2 adults. I had numerous emails to staff at this hotel after seeing "familyrooms" advertised on the website and we were all looking forward to a stopover in Hong Kong staying in our ?familyroom". On arrivalwe checked in went to room to find 2 single beds in a room that was so small. Front desk "fixed" our problem (at extra cost) and gave us adjoining rooms. The 2 rooms were very comfortable but I was extremely dissatisfied with the service I received on booking this hotel as I felt the rooms were totally misrepresented (the website did state "familyrooms") I have written to hotel and they have rectified the website. Hotel was very nice but be aware that 2 people max in room - I really do not think you could fit a 3rd in -even if they were a baby!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Melb1985
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Novotel Hong Kong in August 2008 and the hotel itself was fantastic, all the rooms have recently been renovated and the beds were super comfy, the bathroom was great although sometimes the water from the shower leaked on the floor which was easily fixed with placing a towel there. The rooms were definently not huge, we had 3 people sleeping in our room and the was no space at all but we were in Hong Kong afterall where space is at a premium so it seemed pretty normal compared to other hotels. The location was great, down a small side street away from the noise of Nathan road and only around a 20 minute walk to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sungirl125
Reviews.Content: The Novotel in Kowloon would definitely be one of the best hotels to stay in. The location on Nathan Road is fantastic. The hotel is very modern, clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious with marble bathrooms and luxurious amenties to compliment. The have a flat screen cable tv, complimentary tea, coffee and bottle water replenished daily. The also off the use of an adaptor without charge, which I have never seen in other hotels. The restaurant and bar is great, offering a wide variety of food options, including organic, and the cost is extremely reasonable to dine there. The also offer 20 minutes free internet on the latest apple mac computers. The gym is rather small, but the equipment they do have is the very latest. the only thing that lets this hotel down is that they dont have a swimming pool. I would definitely recommend this property, and would have no hesitation returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: ComfortWise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nathan Road Hotel for 8 nights while on business/pleasure in Hong Kong. My room was on the 15th floor. The place was clean and quiet. Rooms are a little tight but tolerable. Staff was very helpful. The place is four short blocks from the MTR (subway) Jordan Station so I was able to make it from the hotel to the Convention Center under 15 minutes (not in rush hour). The food is above average if you have to eat at the hotel. From the airport you can get to the hotel either by taxi or taking the Airport Express to the Kowloon Station. You can pick up the free hotel shuttle bus from there to the drop-off point about 2 blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood is busy and appears safe. I would stay there again if the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: kpth
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights with my family at Novotel Nathan and had a very nice stay. The room was of a good size with nice amenities (flat screen TV, bathroom amenities...) The staff was courteous and helpful (particularly the concierge) The location is pretty good, a few minutes walk from Jordan MTR station, and opposite Temple market. Overall, a very nice stay. I can only recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallscottishperson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for 2 nights enroute from mainland China to Australia. Booked through Advantage Plus membership so got great rate of $715 + tax. The rooms are pretty small but newly done out and really comfortable. No free internet unless you are in an executive room and breakfast was not included burt we get 2 for 1 with our advantage plus card. We had a late night snack in the bar on arrival which was excellent, and breakfast each day - the buffet breakfast was excellent. But the highlight was the dinner buffet. I am not always a fan of buffet dinners as the main courses are often cold and overcooked but this buffet was really really busy so the turnover of the food was fast which meant everything was fresh and hot. They also had an amazing selection of salad, seafood, sushi, sashimi, cheeses which apeals to me too. They also had a great grill with fresh prawns, fish and meat being grilled to order. And as with many Asian buffets, the dessert array was spectacular! Well located near an MTR station and right on Nathan Road for shops, we thought this was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaporePrincess
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Hong Kong. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 16 May 2008 to 18 May 2008. We had booked through a travel agent. The travel agent had booked a standard room for us - 2 adults & 1 child (6 year old).. However, we upgraded to the Premier Room located at the 15th floor which is highest floor of the hotel. The Premier Room comes with internet access, breakfast, afternnoon tea and cocktails. We can choose to have the breakfast at the 15th Floor lounge or the cafe at the ground floor. The room is very clean and comes with nice refurnishment. The electric kettle is also very clean and not rusty as it is new. Clealiness and room size are top priority for me when booking a hotel room. However, i felt that the room is rather small. Services are good and staffs are friendly and helpful. Good location and very convenient. A lot of shops nearby (7 Eleven and restaurants) Just few mins away from Jordan MTR. And also very near to Temple Street Market.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Reasonable Price, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: jus_rub
Reviews.Content: This hotel was known as Majestic Hotel. It's newly renovated and just had their grand opening on Mid March 2008. So when I was there for 6 nights in late March, it was a brand new hotel, we still could smell the paint and the new furnitures. It was a pretty good experience there, although we started a little bit rough. It was when our room wasn't ready when we checked in ( although we'd paid our total bill in advance when we did the booking and it wasn't an early check in ) and we had to wait for 1 hour. But when we looked our room for the first time, we really liked it. It was really modern room, smaller than the impression we got from the hotel's photo, but it was really pretty. They gave spares of almost everything, from soaps to tissue papers. They even prepared what they called a la carte pillows, meaning you can choose the tenderness of pillows you want. The first morning, we got The South China Post which was very good. However, the next 4 morning, the sent us The Standard which was very thin and it turned out to be free copies. The last morning we got The South China Post again. We thought maybe that morning the hotel couldn't find any free newspaper that could save them a little money. Although I dont think giving the guests proper newspaper will cost them a fortune, but saving is saving. Apart from these, the hotel was really nice. The location is just perfect. It's in the middle of Nathan road where we can find anything. The famous Temple Street Market is just across the road through the subway, and even the subway is literally in front of the hotel door. The Jordan MTR station is just max 3 minutes away. 7Eleven and lot of local restaurants are just across the street. And Starbucks is 1 minutes away. For the money value, it's just perfect. The hotel is positioned next to Eaton and Nathan Hotel, but it's cheaper than the 2 neighbours. I've been to Hong Kong a couple of times, trying a couple of hotels and if I have to choose 2 hotels as my favourite hotels in Hong Kong, this hotel is definitely one of them.
